The "large format", "family style" dishes that come in at $35-45 were single-person servings. Seriously. We didn't order the paella but saw it on the table adjacent to us and man, was it tiny. Many other Spanish restaurants in the area (Duende, for example) will serve 2-3x the portions at that price point. Our pork shoulder dish, as good as it was, was enough to feed one of us. We each got one small sliver, and no more.

Service was amiss, and a bit shady. Wine was spilled. A sauce bottle was accidentally thrown in the lap of one person at our table. Never once did they mention that they'll be charging us additional $$$$ by adding an extra $5 shrimp to our meal or any other additions to satisfy a 4-top. We didn't consent to any of the additional charges. They of course, brought out a receipt that was 1/2 the cost, albeit incorrectly, deceiving us that our lack of satiation was justified, only to charge us double that on our cards when they actually ran our credit cards. Deceiving and shady.
author: Kazu O.

description: If I had to choose one of my top restaurants in SF, my top choice is Coqueta. The paella mariscos was absolutely mind blowing, to the tapas patatas bravas & squid.
author: Taryn M.

description:
Great views, location, drinks y tapas.

Outdoor patio, screened in bar and full service restaurant. Favorite in the financial district.
author: Joe W.

description: The best octopus I've ever had!! It was super flavorful and the texture was amazing; it wasn't too chewy or soft. Also the pork shoulder was so juicy and tender! The salmon and chips were good too but nothing extremely special. We also got the agua de valencia which was delicious and I will definitely come back to try the other dishes and cocktails! The atmosphere and servers was nice too.
author: Bianca L.

description: Made my bf take me here for Valentine's Day lunch because I saw on Insta that the gin drinks have pretty flowers in them. Should've asked which ones cause ours didn't end up having flowers...but still really bomb cocktails. The waiter was chill. The vibe of the place felt comforting. We ordered one montadito ($5 -- too much), one tapas frias ($7 -- honestly so crazy for eggs, but as an egg fanatic I had too...), 3 tapas caliente ($8,$9,$14 -- wish it were more filling). These prices are crazy compared to tapas in actual Spain, but you know what YOU DESERVE A TREAT ONCE IN AWHILE. Everything was made so beautifully and delicately. Would I go again? Ya, if I were rich. I mean I respect the ingredients, which explains the pricing. Not mad about it.
author: Macy Y.

description:
Went here on Saturday for lunch. I made reservations for the dinning room but ended up sitting on the chefs counter. A blessing in disguise!!
We had the best service and wait staff!
author: Valerie A.

description:
This restaurant is located in Embarcadero in San Francisco that overlooks the San Francisco bridge... Location is great, the restaurant itself has a nice unique vibe... And they actually have pretty good food!

The reason why I'm giving this place 1 star is because we had one of the worst experiences we've had at a restaurant in a really long time.  

We made a reservation well in advance during busy saturday dinner hours and we showed 15 min early... The hostess who was very friendly asked us to chill at the bar until our table was ready.... So we chilled at the bar, had a few drinks (which were amazing by the way) and just hung out... The bartenders were super friendly and helpful...

15 minutes later, our hostess told us our table was ready so we get seated... After reviewing our menu for a few minutes, our waiter (W.A.) comes to take our order... We ordered a few tapas to start off and his response was:  "THAT'S IT?  THAT'S ALL YOU'RE GETTING?"  I responded as nicely as I possibly could and said "Uhhhh... this is just what we want... FOR NOW... Is that ok?"  He seemed like he was having a really bad day and went away...

20 minutes later, our first plate comes and it's the wrong order... We tell the person who delivers our food that we did not order that plate and 5 minutes later, our server comes to us asking why we did not eat the WRONG ORDER that was delivered to our table LOL!  

I politely told W.A. that we did not order that plate and so that's why we sent it back... Shortly thereafter, our food (the ones we ordered) comes out and they were all delicious!  Our server never once came back.  We had to track people down to get refills on water and to order additional drinks.  

He shows up with the bill the minute i put my fork down, drops off the bill without saying anything and leaves...

As upset as we were, we still left 15% tip.  We all have bad days and I understand but at such a nice restaurant like this, the ownership should try to hire better team members.
author: Jang N.

description:
I made a reservation two weeks in advance. On my reservation day I went there on time but was told they are closed for a private event. The reception kept telling me she called everyone to cancel the reservation but apparently my name showed in the next slot on her computer and I wasn't informed about the cancellation at all. 
coqueta, I want to tell you, if you are so cheap to take a 'bigger business event' and ignore you small business customers like me, you will fail one day. At least I will never go to this restaurant anymore. There are so many choices in this city, who take reservations and don't cancel them.
author: Hh Y.

description:
SOOO delicious and authentically good. Omg. My whole dining experience, I was literally blown away by how yummy most of the dishes were.

Had finished going to the Exploratorium After Dark with the bf and we were in the mood for some quick bites and drink before heading back home. Then we stumbled upon Coquette! First impression: damn... this place looks small... we're probably not gonna get a walk-in table... but heck.. i had this place bookmarked for a while and their food looks BOMB AF on yelp. After walking in, the place is actually bigger than it appears and is divided into two areas. The room on the right is for reservations and the patio/bar seating on the left is for first come first serve (self-seat). At 7:45pm, the place was packed but after fishing around for ~5 mins, a party got up and we snagged their table !! woo hoo !

The seatings in the bar area is so weirdly cute. We were literally eating off a vertical tree log! The vibe was cozy and casual. Not necessarily warm so layer up!

The GRUBBS:

- Jamon Iberia de Bellota ($29): The bf really like his meats so when he saw this imported cured meat appetizer, he was ecstatic. The app came out in this tiny cute wooden board with slices of thin cured meat imported from Spain. It also came with these cone looking crackers to wrap our meat around. The meat was so flavorful and delicious. Had me licking my fingers after each bite. 

- Salmon Ahumado ($8): Came in 2 lox bagels topped with smoked salmon, quest fresco and truffle honey. This is by far my MOST FAVORITE dish of the night! Super tasty!!! Never had I thought to eat smoked salmon with truffle honey; the combination of smokey and sweetness was just crazy. I was sooo in love with this dish I had to get seconds!! MUST TRY!

- Mar y Montana ($14): darnns.... This was the one dish that captured my attention the most.... cause of the sea urchin! but it wasn't as great as I'd hope it to be. Pretty bland and boring. The uni was a bit bitter. Definitely prefer the salmon ahumado more. won't order again. 

- Pulpo a la Parilla ($14): wood grilled Mediterranean octopus with fingerling potatoes. YUMM. The octopus was so tender and slightly chewy! The herbs brought out the taste and paired with the fingerling potatoes was divine. 

- Pluma ($38): Pork shoulder loin with honey-chilled glaze. OMG. fantastic flavors! Made medium rare, the meat was flavored unbelievably good. Could even do without the honey-chilled glaze! The meat was so juicy and charred with a hint of spice to it. This was the best finishing touch to our meal. left us super satisfied and craving our next return already. 

DRINKS:

- Barca Gintonic ($13): London dry gin with fever tree tonic grapefruit and thyme. wow. the presentation was so beautiful. Literally looked like a pretty flower garden in a cup. Citrusy, refreshing, and delicious!

- Spanish Holiday ($13): Technically vodka, lemon, and soda. Nothing too special and kinda watered down and not strong. 

Overall, a great dining experience. Loved the atmosphere and the food. Perfect date spot for couples or a girls night out for drinks and catching up. I advise making a reservation.

In total, our bill was ~$153 pre-tip. A bit pricy for the small portion but this is a tapas place. Everything was just the right amount for two from what we ordered. We left satisfied.
author: Anissa D.

description:
Cute little place I've been wanting to try for awhile. Located on embarcadero close to Ferry Building, this place is a gem. They built this covered glass area which is an extension of the actual building. Nice views of the water. This place gets packed. 

We came here wanting a table but opted for the bar area in the glass room instead since we were starving and didn't want to wait. 

Had a few unique drinks. All sounded unique but I love gin so opted for that. Forgot all the names but tried 3 and all were pretty good. 

Shared a bunch of stuff ranging from the croquettes (which were delicious and maybe one of best items), deviled eggs (which I wouldn't get again since they were small and basically $3.50 a piece), mushroom salad thing, meatballs (also really tasty), and we finished off with the churro dessert (comes with chocolate sauce which was okay).
author: Melissa L.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place for a while but was sorely disappointed.  The food is good but not amazing, and really way too overpriced for what it is.  Two main issues were the price gouging and the poor service.  

Everything was way too overpriced. Most things appear to be an average of $5 per bite.  Most restaurants that have large format items actually give you a large portion that is meant to be shared with multiple people.  However here the large format is probably meant for one person but with the price of a typical large format item.  Literally the large format pork is probably the size of my hand, laid flat (and I'm a petite Asian girl).  

Also there's the poor service, which doesn't seem terrible but it's barely passable.  The waiter 1) dropped a hot sauce bottle on our table 2) spilled our wine 3) forgot some of the items we ordered and we had to remind him 4) gave us the wrong check 5) We had a party of four and most of the dishes have 3 pieces, so there's an extra charge to have 4 items, but he didn't inform us (seeing this on the bill quite a surprise).

Maybe their rent is ridiculous due to the location and it's designed for tourists. Really must better places to eat in SF, especially for the price.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
My god - incredible! This is a MUST go! The food - packed with unbelievable flavor. Branzino was one of the best I have ever had - served with olives and Meyer lemon slices - yes, please! The mixture of mushrooms was to die for - hearty, flavorful, and fun! Also the small skewers to start are perfect little bites of heaven! 

The host for me in on a really busy night - thank you! And, the service was impeccable!  Please go or you will regret it for the rest of your life. :)
author: Jennifer P.

description:
I'm torn on whether to bump what would be a standard 3.5-star Yelp review up to 4 stars or to round it down to 3. Yes, the Coqueta offers a solid take on traditional tapas dishes. But - also - yes, the ever-so-slightly-spendy prices and the ever-so-slightly-tiny portions (even for tapas) reflect its unbeatable waterfront location.

To start, a selection of pintxos (bite-sized skewers) at $2.75 each (see pictures below) was an interesting way to taste several different things at once, but let's be honest, from a sizing perspective these would barely pass for acceptable hors d'oeuvres at a reception. Indeed, the sizing was so small that it was hard to taste anything to begin with before it all went down. 

More savory dishes like croquetas, albongidas (meatballs), and open-faced salmon sandwiches were far more satisfying, whether from a taste, quality, or value perspective. But let's hope this doesn't give Croqueta an opportunity to raise what are fairly reasonable prices any further for these items.

Service at the bar was decent enough. The crowd appeared to skew more towards less-knowledgeable tourists and business folks with healthy expense accounts. Would the whole experience be as compelling if it were located somewhere sleepier? Hmmmmm... I'll have to get back to you on that one.
author: Vincent L.

description: The ambiance and location of this place are perfection. There's a large bar seating area on the left and a larger more formal restaurant seating area on the right. Our server was perfectly attentive, knowledgeable, and friendly. I was really happy with the gin & tonic that I ordered - it had flowery things in it and the bottle of tonic came on the side so I could control how tonicy I wanted it. My favorites were the jamón, mushrooms, and the albondigas (meatballs). I was nervous that the albondigas would be served in a soup or have a lot of rice in them, but that was definitely not the case. I was excited about the patatas bravas and croquettes. They were good. But not mind-blowing. Would I order them again? I'd probably try other things on the menu first, but eventually get them again. Because I would come back here repeatedly.
author: Derek B.

description:
Horrible service!! The host is incredibly rude beyond words! I believe he said his name was Josh and was reluctant to give his name, probably because he knew I would be writing this review. We were 15 mins late to our reservation and attempted calling them numerous times to let them know but their phone system go straight to voicemail without an option of leaving a message. I let the host know, to which he replied with "Hm, that's interesting", with a huge attitude. I'm shocked by this rude and obnoxious service. Completely unacceptable!  
This was supposed to be my and my husband's special night; we got a babysitter and were really looking forward celebrating our anniversary but instead had our night ruined by a huge jerk!
author: Kristina M.

description:
This place does it again! There was a group of four of us and we got:

- pan tomato
- Jambon serrano 
- croquettes
- octopus
- pork shoulder
- shrimp negra 
- potatoes bravas
- churros
- huckleberry cake
- sea urchin
- broccolini
- duck and pork meatballs 

And to wash it all down, we got a couple pitchers of the agua de Valencia. 

All the food was so delicious, especially the octopus, pork shoulder, meatballs, and churros. Service was fantastic, and the interior and atmosphere is really great as well. Our total came out to $240 before tax and tip, but very worth it.
author: Shabnam E.

description:
Writing my review after my second visit here. It wasn't as good as I remembered the first time - but still worth the visit.

Usually I'd recommend more small plates than mains, but here I'd say save room for the pallets and split it with 2-3 people.

Also the chorizo / shrimp / over easy egg tapa is amazing - you may not want to share it. Besides that the drinks were good, lamb meatballs also quite good, and I like how they cooked the octopus.

Service is attentive and friendly and not overbearing. In the end - expensive, but worth it.
author: Ross H.

description:
Beautiful location, delicious food, good service.

Coqueta is right by the pier, which offers beautiful views. We came for dinner and were able to see the sunset by the bay. It was so pretty.

I came here with a friend to catch up and we had reservations, so we were seated immediately.

We ordered the octopus, croquetas, patatas bravas, broccoli, mar y montana montaditos, churros, and cheesecake with caramel popcorn. Everything was delicious. I especially liked the octopus and the croquetas. Both were very well done. Desserts also really added to the meal and I would highly recommend the churros. Portions are on the smaller side, but typical of tapas. So this amount of food was shared for two people, and we were stuffed and so happy at the end of this!

Service was friendly. I have a nut allergy, and our server was nice enough to mark the menu with everything that had nuts in it. She ensured that nothing in our meal had anything I was allergic to, which I really appreciated.

Also, try their gin and tonic drinks. They're not only good, but super pretty too!
author: Julie L.

description: Had the jamon serrano and pulpo, which were both ok. The cocktails here are better than the food. I liked their margarita with salt foam, I just switched it to mezcal. Cool view if you want to bring visitors here.
author: Lisa T.

description:
We had the paella, jamon, patatas bravas, salmon ahumado, razor clams, cheesecake and churro desserts. Everything was delicious and on point except the clams, though they were still pretty good too. 

The servings felt really small, yet we each paid $60 before tip, so I left feeling unsatisfied at the end of that meal, even though I also wasn't hungry. 

Great ambiance and service for a night out with friends, but with all the great restaurants in the city I might choose a different spot next time.
author: Sheewon B.

description: Amazingly delicious food! We were sitting at the chefs table and saw orders of smoked salmon going by. We knew after we ate that it was heavenly! No wonder it's so popular.
author: A M.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place for a while now and was very excited about my visit tonight! 
We arrived early for our reservation and was told we could wait at the bar which is what we did. We ordered the Cvne Tempranillo Blend as our bartender recommended and sipped on that while our table was ready. Super friendly bartenders!

We were told before our scheduled reservation time that our table was ready.  Excited and hungry, here is what we ordered:
Pulpo a la Parilla - 5/5 - Octopus was very tender and seasoned just right
Albondigas - 5/5 - my fav item of the night. duck and pork meatballs.  MUST TRY!
Chicharron Crusted Croquetas de Pollo 4/5 - not as good as the ones I've had in Barcelona but close!! 
Churros with drinking chocolate: 4/5 - loved the warm chocolate sauce/milk and the berry powder

Well, why the 1-star review?

Our waiter was just terribly awful tonight. Maybe he was having a bad day but he just seemed annoyed and bothered anytime we asked for anything. From the time we sat down to the time we got our check, he did not want to be working today. He was very rude and it completely ruined our experience... 

I hope for a better experience for other yelpers but this was the worst service I've had in a really long time, especially for a higher end restaurant.. I'm sure I can't possibly be the only complaining about this server tonight...
author: Jane C.

description:
Love, love, love Coqueta. We were here for a birthday gathering that lasted from 1-5:30. Terrific Spanish inspired food. We had a lot of shared bites, all were tasty. Drinks were luscious, especially the special margarita. 

There is an "outdoor" space that is under glass, the indoor rooms is rustically beautiful. Service was impeccable, vibe is great. A place to go for a special occasion or on a regular basis.
author: Susan K.

description:
Boyfriend took me out here for date night on a Saturday night! He made reservations for us to sit at the chef's table. The interior of this restaurant is beautifully rustic with very tall ceilings to create that open roominess to it. My boyfriend and I sat inside but I bet sitting outside on the piers is stunningly beautiful. 

* Barça Gin & Tonic *
This is perhaps the most beautiful gin and tonic I've ever seen of had in my life. It has a strong floral smell and the lightest, most refreshing taste. 

* Spanish Holiday *
This is a gin and tonic with very citrusy and lemony tones. Not as beautiful as the one mentioned above but I personally liked this one better in terms of taste (I love hints of lemon and cucumber). 

* Mar y Montaña *
This appetizer includes two pieces of uni resting on toasted bread, topped with thinly sliced slivers, to the point there's spots of transparency, of melt-in-your-mouth pork. The flavor of the pork masks any taste that the uni has to offer but the texture of the uni makes it feel as though it were a buttery spread. Nothing too special about this dish for me, but if you love uni go for it!

* Pulpo a la Parrilla *
I've never had octopus taste and feel so much like meat before until I had this dish. The octopus is tender without losing its classic chewiness. You can actually taste the smokiness from when it is wood grilled; SO GOOD! It comes with the most tender and buttery fingerling potatoes that actually taste like legit potatoes; this is a nice contrast to the chewy and flavorful octopus. 

* Albóndigas a la Feria *
This dish comes with three ginormous, moist meatballs that are absolutely packed with flavor. Each meatball is topped with crispy shallots resting in a tangy sauce that is reminiscent of wine. This is the most delicious (and fancy) meatball I have ever had in my life. Not sure if I would get it again but it was definitely worth experiencing once. 

* Pluma *
This was my favorite dish of the night. I've never had pork that tasted so sweet and moist on its own. You can drizzle on a honey-chili sauce for even more flavor but it's definitely delicious on its own as well. The meat is unbelievably tender and it's almost like you can taste the acorn-diet of the pig as well; absolutely stunning. I can see myself ordering this dish every time with no regrets.

* Bizcocho de Arroz con Leche *
This dessert was recommended by our waitress but unfortunately I don't really see the appeal. The cake is very dry and if it were not for the ice cream on top, I probably wouldn't have been able to eat the cake. I don't think the rice pudding in the center of the cake makes this dessert that special. However, the huckleberry sauce that the cake rests is pretty good.
author: Sylvia L.

description:
Coqueta is one of my favorite Spanish restaurants in San Francisco. It is a little pricy, but you are paying for the quality. The ambiance of the restaurant is a little fancy but when you are there, you will see people that are dressed casual so you won't feel out of place if you are wearing jeans and a t-shirt. 

We had a variety of different tapas but the dishes that stood out were the Salmon Ahumado (smoked salmon, queso fresco and truffle honey), Pulpo a la Parrilla (wood grilled mediterranean octopus, freshly dug fingerling potato, and pimenton olive oil), and the Paluma (acorn fed spanish ibereco de bellota pork shoulder loin with honey chili glaze). 

I would definitely recommend trying each of these dishes. The truffle honey made the salmon dish. The octopus was the most perfectly cooked octopus I've ever eaten and the honey chili glaze was the perfect pairing to the most tender piece of pork shoulder loin I've ever had.
author: Kacie H.

description: What an experience! One of the best servicings ever. You can tell the staff have fun and are superb. We were a party of 5 and got tapas after tapas served to us. All were exquisitely tastey and professionally presented to us. It was a real treat! It's a gorgeous location at evening time. I'll definitely be coming back!
author: Leonardo O.

description:
Since I live in the neighborhood, I've passed Coqueta one million and one times and only went about a month ago and it was an impromptu decision. The day was lovely and we wanted to sit outside. I met up with a few friends on Saturday afternoon around 2pm. 

My girlfriend and I shared 2 appetizers -- the open faced salmon ahumado and the jamon serrano with bread. The food was good. Like SPAIN good. 

We were all in a sparkling mood. I had the Avinyo, BRUT RESERVA, Penedés. Delicious, easy to drink and racked up the bill. 

Overall, it's a bit pricey. You just don't realize how fast it adds up. But for the location, the ambiance, and the food you won't leave disappointed.

This review is making me amped for my trip to Spain soon! Wahooo.
author: Priti K.

description: We came a few weeks ago and the food was great. We sat at the chef's counter overlooking the kitchen. They guy who seemed to be the chef de cuisine (he was running around telling people what to do and interrupting them, but not cooking) was pretty distracting and for some reason, kept saying "well this is San Francisco" or "welcome to San Francisco" to pretty much everything anyone in the kitchen said. That's besides the point because he kept rubbing his hair AND face in the kitchen. I thought this was gross, but it was even grosser when I saw him pick up food right after WITH HIS BARE HANDS. Didn't wash them. Yuck.
author: Lindsay M.

description: Tried to get tapas but the hostess was so rude, we left. I understand it's a busy Friday night but you don't just hand people menus and tell them to check with the servers to see who's leaving. So we went to La Mar instead.
author: Teri K.

description: My favorite spot in SF  gorgeous restaurant with an open kitchen. Their tapas are amazing - get the open faced toast with sea urchin. Fabulous drinks and the gin and tonic is gorgeous with edible flowers
author: Weich Y.

description:
Came for a late lunch yesterday even though I wasn't too hungry but really enjoyed my experience here! First of all, the location of this place is amazing. It's right in front of the bay bridge and the views from here are to die for. Going in here we had a reservation, so we were promptly seated at the time of our arrival. Here we ordered the following:

Pulpo - octopus which came with potatoes- this was amazing, tender, with a hint of toasty flavor. Really enjoyed this dish
Patatas bravas- this was also really good but I noticed instead of using cut up potato pieces they used fingerling potatoes. The sauce it came with was very good
Croquettes- this was actually my favorite- the flavor and filling of these were delicious 

We paired this off with the albanino wine which went well with what we ordered. Overall I would go back to try the other dishes.
author: Prasiddha H.

description:
Coqueta, oh Coqueta. Perfect restaurant for girl date, bro date, friend date, birthday celebration, promotion celebration... honestly I just hope my friends and boss read this review so they can treat me and so I have an excuse to come back.

I came here with a girlfriend because their menu enticed me! Spanish tapas.. who can say no! First small bite was the smoked salmon with truffle honey. I am NOT a truffle fan (please put away your pitchforks), so I brushed the truffle off my salmon and onto my friend's. But I gotta say, the salmon is super fresh... heavenly... divine.... just get this. #noragrets. Seriously. So. Good (Drooling just thinking about it). Our second tapa was the octopus with potato. Octopus cooked perfectly, and flavors meshed so well. Taste buds continue to dance in my mouth. Lastly, we ordered the prawns with black garlic and chili sauce. I appreciate that the prawns were ready to eat (I suck at de-shelling those suckers). Couple of pieces of bread on the side to soak into the sauce! Yums! Lastly, I asked our waiter to recommend me either the churro or the arroz con leche cake. He said the latter was his favorite - well, in the infamous words of Janice (Friends): "Oh. My. God!" The ice cream and cake pair so well together. Thank you to our waiter for the excellent recommendation!

Service was terrific! Every staff member that helped us was extremely nice and attentive and shout out to the one that gave me a cup of sangria on the house :) You have a special place in my heart. 

Ambiance in the restaurant is equally fantastic. Lighting is a bit romantic and I wouldn't mind sitting either indoors or outdoors. 

We didn't order any of the entrees... but I would love to come back to try the bigger dishes. Paella, I'm coming for you!
author: Cathy C.

description: Great scenery, very good service, and flavorful food at a decent price.  We had the patatas bravas, grilled octopus, shrimp, and paella.  The octopus and shrimp perfect.  The patatas bravas were very good but lost points when compared to other Spanish restaurants.  The sauce for the patatas bravas was bland.  The potatoes were pretty good by themselves.  The rice was perfectly crispy on the bottom, but lacked rich flavor which I look for in a paella.  The toppings in the paella were filled with amazing flavor, very distinct from each other but worked well together.  Did the rice lack the rich flavor so the toppings could shine?  I don't know, but the star for me is always the rice--making that simple ingredient shine.  It almost did, but since it didn't it reminded me of other places in sf that might not be as fancy but had a better paella and better red sauce.  Still had a great experience and I would come back if I was in the area, but I wouldn't make a special trip out of my way.
author: mick H.

description:
Love, love, love this place 

Alisa and Victor where awesome as well as the food.

The  32oz  rib eye was to die for especially with the mushrooms! Where off the hook.
author: Ahmed H.

description:
I visited Coqueta last week with a small group of friends and was blown away! Coqueta completely lived up to it's high expectations and then some. 

First off, our server was fantastic -- if you can, ask for the younger, stocky fellow with the short, red-ish hair. I can't remember his name. The menu was a little daunting so he gave us some phenomenal recommendations, especially the paella. His wine recommendation was also on point, and he was friendly, helpful, and intuitive for our needs. These days, amazing service can really make or break a dining experience.

The location of Coqueta can't be beat, and the ambiance and decor is approachable but still a little adventurous! The food, the service, and the location make Coqueta a slam dunk.
author: Laura H.

description:
We absolutely LOVE Coqueta. We went here for my dad's birthday and we were seated right away considering we had reservations. I highly suggest you do so btw. 

We ordered a few tapas and few entrees in order to share with my parents. We ordered the patatas bravas which is basically crispy potatoes with a salsa to dip and a garlic alioli on the top of each one. This was perfect because there was about 10 pieces to share amongst three people. It was a light crisp on the potatoes and the salsa was a great pairing. We also ordered the Pulpo a la Parrilla which is grilled octopus. It was so tender! 

For the entrees we ordered the paella, of course and the pork shoulder loin called Pluma. Both dishes were amazing! The pork shoulder was great with the honey chili glaze and so tender and juicy. The paella was just the right amount of bomba rice to shirmp, clams, chorizo. It serves 2-3 people and it takes about 30-40 mins to make so if you know you want to try this dish, order it right away so you're not waiting too long. 

We'll definitely be coming back! I want to try the open face sandwiches next along with more tapas.
author: Loree T.

description:
...alright I'm just making sure you're done staring at the view. Now let's stare at the perfectly placed open kitchen that illuminates the restaurant. The smell of lamb/pork/chicken are all coming from there.

I love gin... so this place beyond an experience for me. The gin and tonic is served in a stemless wineglass with a wedge of grapefruit. Now the presentation is 5/5, but it tastes as good as it looks -- between the flower and grapes, everyone at the table wants at least one.

Order a ton of the screwers, meat+cheese and the squid to start. Also, don't forget to put in an order of paella. The menu is exotic and not typical of a Spanish restaurant... be bold while ordering!
author: Jesse C.

description:
Celebrated my 6th birthday meal at coqueta last night and the food and drinks were all it lived up to be. The pintxos were beautifully presented and the drinks were beautified with fresh flowers and fruits. It is true that we also eat with our eyes and coqueta didn't disappoint. 

The prom and duck meatballs were amazing as well as the branzino and paella. But the dish that stole the show was the gaucho bistec, a 32oz bone in cowboy ribeye cooked to perfection! I could not recall having a better piece of steak in my lifetime. It was tops!

The desserts were also cute and well thought out. The single bite of the manchego cheesecake pop with caramel popcorn was decadent and dessert perfection. 

The only reason why this is not a five star review is that there is a serious wind problem in the restaurant. We sat near the door which we had to request the staff to try to keep closed. The door was open for the first 10 minutes we sat down and I'm not exaggerating, it was like sitting in a wind tunnel and getting your body fully blow dried at a car wash. I sincerely hope that coqueta can build a wind-blocking wall, awning, or anything to try to remedy this problem. We were not the only table discomforted by this issue and it put a big damper on our otherwise flawless meal. At the end of the dinner, 2 out of 6 of our diners felt as if they caught a cold. 

But even with the wind issue, coqueta deserves its accolades and is still an excellent experience. The food and drinks will speak for themselves.
author: Charmaine L.

description: It's a gin bar and typically not a fan of gin but they have an expensive wine selection. The food is also pretty good. Had a great experience here for a private event in the tent area. Would recommend for s networking event or private party.
author: Tiff W.

description: Coqueta - you took me by surprise. I came in for happy hour and my friends recommended the Gin and Tonic. Skeptical at first, since I am not a fan of Gin and never was, I took a chance and ordered a gin and tonic. Presentation of gin and tonic was appealing to my eyes; the cocktail comprised of a slice of lemon, a sprig of thyme, and botanicals. The cocktail itself was refreshing and I wondered why I disliked gin before? Definitely will be back and order another refreshing glass of gin and tonic at Coqueta. Cheers~
author: Minji K.

description: Coqueta was today's lunch destination and I'm so glad I discovered this gem. My team and i ordered a variety of tapas and drinks. I got the barca gintonic which was so cute and refreshing. My favorite tapa was the bikini one as it tingled my umami tastebuds. The waiter who served us was hilarious and knew the menu in and out and gave us personalized recommendations. I can't wait to come back and try other items!
author: Vivian L.

description:
First thing I would say about coming to Coqueta is that it'll take a pretty penny to get full, with that said though, the food here is pretty amazing. I've been here twice now, and both times have been very consistent. My favorites here are definitely the lox and bagel and the octopus. A lot of restaurants tend to overcook octopus, but not here! It's extremely well flavored and cooked perfectly. Although, you only get one tentacle per serving...

Other small bites here are also good such as the assortment of mini skewers, prawns, etc. I did want to try out the paella but didn't get a chance to, so perhaps next time. But like I said before, the bill will probably be well over $100 for 2 if you're planning to be full and have drinks as well. Speaking of drinks, the gin&tonics here are very good and the presentation is pretty spot on (for the IG fame).

As far as the bad goes, there's not really a bad thing about coqueta besides the aforementioned slightly overpriced menu and occasional long wait times. So remember to book ahead for bigger parties and prepare to order A LOT if you're planning to get full. Other than that, this is a solid establishment!
author: Marco M.

description:
Love @coqueta_sf they made the beautiful beverages and delicious food. We had gin and tonic, Spanish margarita, Sutter Smash and sangria. We ordered almost every dishes in the menu..
Pulpit a la Parilla - squid (delicious )
Pardon peppers ( fantastic) 
Jamon Iberico de Bellota ( love it ) 
Rib eye steak  it was ok.. but I won't order again 
Am bondigas a la Féria ( good ) 
Patatas Bravas (crispy , tasty but not a fan)
Paella ( great dish ) 
Lubing a la Brasa - wood grilled branzino ( love it ) 
Overall everything was great and friendly service Definitely come back again!!
author: Katie E.

description:
I really enjoy the food and the vibe of this place.  Their gin and tonics are amazing.  They also have amazing shrimp, octopus, and potato coquettes.  Their portions are a little on the smaller side, just a warning.  Your bill will quickly add up. 

I've only been here for drinks and appetizers.  I think the service could be improved, but I think the servers focus more on the dinner crowd, which seems to always require a reservation.

The restaurant is right next to a pier, which makes for a nice walk to and from the restaurant.
author: Alyse S.

description: Ok food (it's good, but good is average in SF), and terrible service). Waiting 50 min for a couple of tapas? Don't think so.
author: Pauli B.

description:
One of the best meals I've had in SF. Great selection of tapas and larger dishes that are exceptional! Some of my favorites were:

Salmon Ahumado: Essentially a mini lox on bagel with a nice amount of smoked salmon on a crunchy small bagel with cheese and some honey. 

Croquetas de Pollo: The chicharron crust is light and crispy but you can still taste the pork and the inside is gooey with chicken and cheese. Orange slices are a nice complement.

Gambas Negras: Perfectly charred prawns that you don't have to shell and the head just falls off. Soap up all that truffle sauz on the plate with some bread!

Pulpo a la Parilla: Everything about this dish is great. Most importantly, the octopus is extremely tender and everything else complements it well. 

Setas al Ajillo: A must order item. Delicious mushrooms cooked in a oil with ample amounts of garlic

Gaucho Bistec: Just a good old classic steak cooked just right.

If you're vegan (like my friend I went with), the menu is tough since half of the menu has pork in it. The restaurant is on the embarcadero near the water with an enclosed patio area with bar seating and an indoor area with high ceilings and a rustic but clean interior.

Highly recommend this restaurant!
author: Kyle R.

description: Came by for lunch and drinks on a Saturday and were able to snag a table outside. Since it's all tapas style, they recommend 3 plates per person. We tried 7 dishes and by far the stand out ones were the salmon ahumado (open face sandwich with truffle honey) and the sunny side up huevo (with chorizo). They also make pretty drinks with flowers in them, but I stuck to the red sangria - it was delish and not too sweet.
author: Melissa P.

description: Love Coqueta, it is such a pretty place right on the Embarcadero! It's a vibrant place and always busy. Make sure you make a reservation, otherwise be prepared to wait or be turned away because they are usually booked. You can try to get a seat in the patio/outside area but it gets really crowded. I've pretty much samples all of their tapas, so you can't go wrong with any of them. My favorites thing that I come here for is the gin and tonic! It's amazing and so pretty.
author: Iryna P.

description: Lovely vibe and service. My favorite dishes are their octopus​ and the mushrooms. Taking a walk after along the bay is priceless, would always bring visiting friends here for either lunch or an early evening dinner.
author: Christina Y.

description:
I'm sorry to say, but this spot was a tad overrated if you ask me. The skewers were lacking, the shrimp potato hot tapas was good, but nothing memorable. Mushrooms pretty good. The albondigas being the best thing we ordered. The cocktails were the best part of the experience. 

Maybe the entree dishes are more exciting?
author: Jessica C.

description:
This place has such a fun vibe.   I would've never guessed it walking by outside.  There is fun music and the atmosphere is buzzing with energy. We went last sat with friends for the first time.  This place deserves the 4 stars for food, atmosphere and service

We shared a bunch of stuff.  Personally I wasn't as into the individual bites but my hubby and friends really loved them.  As for the rest, here are what I loved
- grilled Polk shoulders - omg 5 stars.  So tender and tastes almost like steak.  I will definitely order again
- kale salad - should have asked for light dressing but it was very flavorful. 
- grilled Bronzino - still like the one at Kokkari better but this was solid. Like the smokey flavor
- the fried egg dish with potato strings.  Yum. 
- strawberry sorbet was the perfect palate cleanser.  

I also loved their red sangria, one of the best I have had.  I booked another reservation on the spot.  Will be back in a month. ;-)
author: Lei H.

description:
Coqueta
Here is the 3-1-1: 

Food: Michael Chiarello tapas style is nice surprise as the flavors are bold and long lasting. The bite size skewers such as the quail egg with serrano jam and anchovies with piparra pepper are great pairing with any of their Spanish white wines. Sunny side egg with shrimp and the grilled octopus are great shared appetizers before moving on to the seafood filled paella.

Service: Very helpful and enthusiastic staff who helps with how much to order so that you can try the right number of dishes. The staff walks around with the skewers, so you can choose accordingly. 

Ambiance: Great view of the bay as it sits on the pier and very open space. Not too loud to have good conversation but loud enough that you know you are in a happening place.
author: Irwan A.

description:
My wife and I had a wonderful time at Coqueta's NYE Dinner Party.  First of all I'd like to thank Josh for finding us a table after my persistent calling.  He was truly a lifesaver and had been very courteous throughout the whole process.  

The dinner (3rd pre-fireworks seating) started with a cocktail gathering, then a 4-course dinner till right before the fireworks.  We just needed to step out to enjoy the festivities without all the waiting out in the cold, and then went back to the restaurant for the post-fireworks party drinks.

Throughout the night the servers were very attentive despite being very busy.  The dinner courses were organized around a theme of famous Spanish artists like Picasso, Dali, Gaudi, and Miro, which was a very nice touch.  My wife and I had an awesome time and will definitely put this as top on our list for future NYE events.
author: Sean J.

description:
Our last supper of the Seattle/San Francisco West Coast work trip, and I must say we definitely saved the best for last. We've had some amazing meals and experiences on this trip but this was on another level. Like we took the best quality from each place we've gone to so far and put it all together.

Amazing service, informative, and great recommendations by the service staff. or it could've been that there just isn't a single bad recommendation on the menu? hmm. The menu is exciting, the beverage list is fun, and beautiful atmosphere!

Food and drinks can get pretty pricey. Did I mention work trip? After this experience, I think I need a work trip to Spain!
author: Harmony K.

description: I came here tonight with friends and loved it ! The paella was outstanding yummy apps and tasty desserts . Stephanie was an excellent waitress who gave us great service and was on point about the menu! We will be back!
author: Pooh W.

description:
I'm not great at deciding how spanish food is, and I was hesitant about eating in this area, but I really enjoyed this place! Kind of between a three and a four to me for the food, but since it was such a good experience overall, I'll round up haha.

I came here with a coworker and we both enjoyed our meal. The drinks were fantastic. She got the gin and tonic, and it was so pretty with a flower in it and some other plant type things haha. Tasted good too! I got the spicy margarita, which was excellent. Not too sweet and the pepper in it was pickled, which was gross at first and then perfect.

We tried the mushrooms, the duck and pork meatballs, the octopus, and the egg and shrimp potato thing.

My favorite was the mushrooms. They were cooked so perfectly with a smoky sear. I really loved the mix of different mushroom textures. I also liked the octopus, which was tender, but had a little less flavor. The potatoes in that dish seemed a little undercooked to me, but I like mushy potatoes, so that could just be me. The meatballs were good too, though I feel like they were less weird than the menu made them seem. The eggs and shrimp was my least favorite. It had potato strings and baby shrimp that were kind of flavorless.

Overall a fun meal, and especially for this area, I was pleasantly surprised with it. Prices weren't awful either, with both of us being perfectly full and spending less than ninety dollars before tip - not bad for small plates! It was really busy but the service was great. Several food runners to help out as well as an attentive and knowledgeable server.
author: Kensey W.

description:
Who has two brunches on a lazy Sunday? We do!!! Started with sashimi and a pisco sour (for me) elsewhere, then came here to indulge even more. Worth the hype? I think so!

Must order: 

--pulpo (octopus) 

I LOVE OCTOPUS, anything. Seriously, if you can't get with that... we can't be friends #sorrynotsorry BYE~ Coqueta's version was charred, smoky, and cooked to near perfection. There were a couple of pieces that were burnt to a crisp, not good. The rest of it was heaven~

--jamon iberico de bellota 

Who needs an excuse for salumi?! Cured meats are one of my fav apps of all time, anywhere that offers it, I usually order it. There were many salty meats to choose from, but of course bestie ordered this particular one cuz he knows I love it. Awwwwww~

--salmon ahumado

This may be because I've been craving lox bagels, but damn this hit the spot. Perfectly bite sized perfection. Mmmmmm. I'm running out of words. Still full, brain function diminished. Le sigh. 


Pass!!!

--mar y montana

Wtf?! Can't believe they served this putrid uni. F'ing nasty. I had to spit it out. Yes, that bad. I almost threw up in my mouth. It was way past it's sell by date! Worst uni I've ever had. PASSSSSSSSS. NEXT!


Must try the rib-eye and paella next time. They look delicious ;) 


P.S. If you're into imbibing on the weekends, or whenever. I'd suggest the "salt air margarita" It was fantastic! I could've had a dozen, but I didn't :p LMAO
author: Grace C.

description:
If you love Spanish food, then Coqueta is the place to go. I love this restaurant, it's located at the beautiful Pier 5 so you can take a stroll after your meal and enjoy the scenery :)

I always like to start with their pintxos (bite-size skewers) while waiting for my food to come out. You can ask your waiter to bring the whole pintxos board, and you just pick whatever you want. If they leave the whole board on your table, don't feel tempted/obligated to finish all of them. The pintxos is not expensive at $2.75 per skewer but they could add up. 

Their patatas bravas is the best one I've had in the city. It's lightly smoked and perfectly crispy. They are individual potatoes (small round yellow and purple) unlike the patatas bravas at other places.

The sunny side up eggs with chorizo, shrimp and fries shoe string potatoes are also great and fun to eat. Just mix them up all together and enjoy the salty crispy goodness! 

I've tried all of the large plates and they are all awesome. The steak is juicy (order the wild mushroom as a side dish to compliment your steak). The whole grilled branzino is very fresh, simple and delicious. The Spanish iberico pork shoulder with the honey chili glaze is very tender and flavorful. Lastly, the paella is really delicious as well. The rice is perfectly cooked and the seafood taste really fresh; it's served with some sliced pickled pepper and lemon aioli. Yum!
author: Sam M.

description:
This place has a consistent bad service attitude. One time it's an accident, two times it's an coincidence, three times it's a trend. 

Tapas are alright but the chef apparently has a sweet tooth; cocktails are innovative and refreshing; location is great for a walk after dinner, but probably not worth having to suffer through the service.
author: Eve M.

description: Great place for tasty cocktails, you can't go wrong. The food is delicious and all the staff is so nice and friendly.
author: Jessica R.

description:
Super delicious! We got a bunch of tapas for the table. 
Everything was so good & the waitress gave us excellent service. 

We had: Papas bravas, croquetas de pollo, albondigas & couple more I forgot the names. Everything was delicious.
author: Mary S.

description:
Excellent food and service. 

Menu highlights include:

Cheese and cured meet platter - almonds were great as well
Smoked Salmon - not to be missed
Kale Salad - best kale salad I've had anywhere 
Patatas Bravas - can't miss on this, sauce in middle of the plate is wonderful 
Croquetas de Pollo - great chicken flavor 
Churros - save room for these!

Stay away from the deviled eggs, I will go back there next time in San Francisco.
author: Chuck K.

description: What a gorgeous location! Right on the water and the interiors are absolutely beautiful. However, despite making a reservation we still had to wait 20 minutes (in the freezing cold because the wind by the embacadero is not gentle) before we were seated. The jamon Serrano, quince paste and manchego cheese were all perfectly on-point. So was the pitcher of Red wine sangria - really balanced flavors and not too sweet. Similarly, the croquettas and Patatas bravas were also pretty great - crispy and well season. The highlight of this meal was definitely the churros con chocolate though! The churros were fried to perfection and coated with cinnamon and sugar - and the chocolate was a lovely dark chocolate. 100% win!
author: Sam M.

description: Great food and drinks. Drinks are very pretty and instagram worthy. The steak was amazing. Can't wait to come back again :)
author: T N.

description: This restaurant never fails to impress!  I took my good friend there for her birthday recently and the atmosphere was upbeat and lively!  The food was more than amazing, it was an experience.  We let the chef pick our menu with surprises.  Excellent! Excellent! Excellent!
author: Cynthia H.

description:
The food was fairly pedestrian. Nothing stood out as exceptional. The gambas lacked the complex taste normally found in this traditional Spanish dish. The octopus was pretty good and was probably the best dish of the seven we ordered.

The biggest problem was the pacing of the food. It seemed haphazard like there was no coordination in the kitchen. We'd get one plate and then nothing for ages and then two and then nothing again. The waitress would come by with a cheery "I know you've got something else coming!" but couldn't remember what it was. I asked for a second glass of wine and it didn't make it to the table until we finished all of the tapas. So instead I enjoyed it with dessert. The flan was so so with too much orange flavor. The churros were good.

The service was one star at the most.
author: M P.

description:
Finally try this restaurant in lunch time without wait. We sat in the open bar area and could see the outside view. All the food are tasty but definitely portion is way too small. And for those portion size of dishes which are a little pricey. After 5 tapas we are not full. 
A couples after they finished the lunch, I heard the lady said I am still hungry. Haha!
author: Sanly L.

description: Great location, outstanding staff, beautiful presentation on all dishes, and a nice wine selection. It has a very modern and comfortable atmosphere. Tried several dishes and was not disappointed by a single one. Our server was excellent and made for an even better experience. Very pleased with our visit and can only speak highly of this place. Will definitely visit again when in town
author: Maco U.

description:
Great spot for happy hour and small plates. I especially enjoy the deviled eggs and chicken croquettes. Most everything on tapas menu is a win. Wine, cocktails, atmosphere, view and staff are most excellent.

The paella however left us underwhelmed. The pretty presentation did not make up for bland flavor. 

Definitely worth checking out for date night or boozy weekend brunch.
author: Caroline M.

description:
Chiarello does it again. The food was wonderful.  The wait staff was very attentive and friendly. We had the Manchego with Serrano Ham: Brioche with eggplant;   Shrimp with Sunny side egg; Paella; and Churros.  Everything was delicious.  My favorites were the Brioche and the Shrimp.  

Also the must try cocktails:  Gin and Tonic.  It is refreshing and slightly sweet.  The presentation is pretty cool.   And the Margarita with Salted Air.  Slated Air was unique and really made each sip have that salty flavor. 

We will be back!
author: Billy M.

description:
tl;dr -- Delicious. Classy, busy, yet warm/comforting atmosphere. Favorites: Gaucho Bistec, Patatas Bravas, Sangria. Charcuterie seemed small for a non-connoisseur like me.

In Depth:

Delicious. I've been here 4 or 5 times and each time, the Gaucho Bistec was delicious. Consistency and options with the ribeye cut is a little unpredictable, but never disappointing.

Having been to Spain, their Patatas Bravas are unique (I'd never seen them made this way in Madrid or Barcelona), but Coqueta's take on them holds up for sure.

If you like Sangria, make sure you try theirs.

I found the charcuterie portions to be a little small for the cost (not uncommon in San Francisco) but perhaps their quality is beyond my non-connoisseur taste. The Jamon Iberica and chorizo cuts *were* excellent.

Their desserts were great, too. Probably can't go wrong here if you pick something that sounds like "you". They have an interesting chocolate dessert that is at least worth trying once in your life.
author: Patrick F.

description: This is perhaps one of the best Spanish restaurants in SF. The service is good, 5 stars for the current general manager Laura who has an eye for detail and excellency. The 3 time I have visited this venue,  have been memorable and full of delicious tapas. You my good reader should try the albóndigas, huevo with shrimp, jamón serrano, jamón ibérico and pulpo a la parrilla (grilled octopus). The only downer is the paella, it just ok. Thanks to the friendly staff. I'll keep on sending people to this restaurant.
author: Gabriel M.

description:
The location is the best feature of this restaurant. Right on Embarcadero and next to a pier where you could walk out and see the bay bridge... The restaurant has a covered patio area that has great ambiance for you to relax for a casual dinner out. 

We shared a few cheese, jamon and patatas bravas tapas. They were nice small bites, but nothing to write to your Spaniard friend about. We also ordered octopus (pulpo) and it came out well after our entrée which was a bust. 

The main event was supposed to be the seafood paella. At $45 per order which suggests to serve 2-3 people, I thought this dish missed the mark. The dish was dried out and not moist like most paella I've had. The chorizo was few and far between with each bite and the seafood consisted of a few shrimps (I think 4 to be exact) and a shelled clams thrown on top of what felt like a fancy fired rice. I was not impressed. 

Service and drinks, in addition to the location, was what made my night here enjoyable. The cocktails we ordered here were well made and tasty and the manager (I think it was a manager) came out to check on us and was very attentive. We appreciated him being so gracious with a uniformed service member that was seated with us.
author: Billy P.

description:
Overall: Fantastic ambience to go for a date night or with friends or family. Great drinks, service, tapas, and view. 

Drinks: Sangria- one of the tastiest I've had! 

Food: 
Chicken Croqueta (4.5/5): basically a fried chicken pot pie
Salmon ahumado (4.5/5): bagel + lox kicked up a notch with truffle honey
Patatas Bravas (3.5/5): crisp non-greasy potatoes; make sure to dip in the salsa! 
Pulpo a la parilla (3/5): octopus was tender but not a dish I would get again
Wild mushrooms (3.5/5): good but took a long time to arrive

Desserts
Churro w/ chocolate (3/5): hard to go wrong with this combo
Manchego cheesecake (3/5)

Pro tip: you can ask your waiter to adjust your orders so each member of your groups gets to try the tapa (i.e. croqueta comes in 3, salmon comes in 2, etc)
author: Monica C.

description:
Worst meal I've had in SF in a decade- BUT also overpriced!

The evening was beautiful- the server was lovely- and my company (28 y/o daughter) was fun. The wine was OK. However the Octopus appetizer was burnt and the paella ($48) was incinerated.  

Never again.
author: Edward F.

description: Came back and the Branzino tasted like it was caught a week ago ..... and the paella was fishy too. So sad to have to update my review this restaurant is not consistent
author: Erin B.

description: I love everything about coqueta. You can't go wrong with anything you order. My favorites were the salmon ahumado, the jamon iberico, the gambas negras (exquisite!), the sunny side up Nuevo, and the patatas bravas and the pulpo a la parilla. I could order these alone over and over. I also love the pintxos. Can't wait to come back and try everything else. The drinks are also awesome.
author: Jeanne R.

description: Amazing ambiance, location and food .  What more can I say .  Can't wait to come here again.  Lovely veg choices .
author: Amaia S.

description: Definitely on the top 10 list of best places in San Francisco. Food is always consistent and absolutely delicious, drinks are amazing and can't say anything bad about the service. This is a great place for happy hour, lunch, dinner and date nights. If you haven't experienced Coqueta yet, you MUST! Will be coming back time and time again.
author: Roman L.

description: This was one of my favorites. The service here is horrible. The first waiter forgot to put in my order and I had to chase two other waiters to find out the status. Never saw my waiter again after I placed the order. When the food arrived it was cold and rubbery.
author: Michelle G.

description:
Atmosphere [4/5]: they have a bar area and a dining area separated. The bar was very crowded when I went there on weekends. The restaurant was a little bit hot and they had to keep the door open. 

Food:
 - Uni Bun [4.5/5]: don't remember the exact name of the dish lol. The Uni was pretty fresh! But I wish they could have a more kick flavor. 

 - Kale Salad [3.5/5]: the salad is a bit salty and did not quite enjoy the goat cheese personally. 

 - Spanish tortilla skewer [4/5]: in general, it's a pretty good little bite. And it would be better if it's warmed. 

 - Paella [5/5]: highlight of the dinner! Plenty of seafood and the rice was just cooked perfectly. I had always found paella was too salty, but this one was not! 

 We got too full to try some desserts. Probably gonna try their churro next time here!
author: Susan C.

description:
Sandwiched between two massive tourist traps(the Ferry Building and Pier 39), I had some reservations about just how good this place would be. What's more, its a Michael Chiarello restaurant and usually celebrity chef fame tends to lead to overhyped food. That said, reviews were good and so...came in with some lofty expectations.

Bottom line  - the place is awesome. Every dish except for the acorn squash(not my choice) was brilliant. Here I mean, the items were cooked beautifully and had interesting and amazing flavors. Sometimes, you want to give a place more than 5 stars when it makes such a memorable impression on you. Few places do and not all are necessarily four and five dollar sign restaurants. In fact, the more expensive the place, the more it takes to beat expectations. This place did.
author: Ajit K.

description:
made reservation online before going
time: Friday, 530PM (it's already pretty crowded)

Food we ordered: 
1. Pork shoulder loin with Honey ($38) -- this is pretty good but the portion is very little 
2. Mar y montaria (uni on top of bread) ($14 for 2 pieces) -- must order too
3. chef selection of cured meat  ($26) -- just ok
4. two skewers -- don't recommend
5. cocktail  -- pretty good

environment: loud and crowded
service: ok. 
price: too expensive. can have the same food in other places with cheaper price.
author: Tina H.

description:
Good but not spectacular, I have been wanting to try this place for sometime and made a reservation for Saturday night.  We sat at the chefs counter and ordered a number of items: 
Deviled eggs - rather bland no real flavor
Chicken croquets - really good, like chicken pot pie
Potatoes- really loved them, great sauce
Salami - so good
Olives and almonds - the almonds were awesome 
Pineapple tequila drink - can't remember the name but picture a lemon meringue pie in a cup, very tasty and not strong
Churros- disappointing, not sweet even with chocolate sauce 

We had some service issues too, we had ordered two other dishes we never got, it worked out in the end because we were full and they didn't charge us and gave us the dessert for free.
The location is beautiful and the drinks are too.  Not sure I'd return anytime soon.
author: La C.

description:
Wonderful little tapas bar and restaurant, right on the water. Always packed and lively. Of course, because the craft cocktails, tapas and everything is SO good. Would love to come again with a group and order lots of dishes to share.

This time just had two little bite-sized skewers (just $2.75 each) -- one w/ chorizo, roasted artichoke and piquillo pepper - yum; and another with manchego, Kamins, Serrano and an apricot sherry preserves - double yum. My server recommended their Barca Gintonic, and it was beautiful - and really well made. 

But the smoked salmon on toasted bagel w/ queso fresca, drizzled w/ truffle honey was out of the world.  I think the single most delicious and memorable item I had this trip to San Francisco. 
This place will be a must stop on all future trips to the City.
author: Amber E.

description:
WAY better than i expected!! Since I'm a big fans of wood-grilled seafood and meat, my friend Anna recommended this restaurant to me. 

Service: i called and made a dinner reservation in the morning on the same day, the hostess was apologetic and told me they only had availability at 5:30pm. Of course i wouldn't mind and was impressed with her nice attitude! 

I was blown away with their tapas, entrees and beverages!!

1. Mar Y Montana ($14): toasted bread with parma ham and sea urchin. It was a good start but wasn't as great compared to the rest 

2. Pulpo a la Parilla ($14): this grilled octopus with potato was one of my favorites! Octopus was so so so tendered and juicy!! A must try! 

3. Pluma ($38): wood-grilled pork shoulder with honey-chilled glaze. Holy moly this was my another favorite! The meat was super juicy and flavored; never imagined pork shoulder could be that soft when i've had pork shoulder so many times in my life. I'd also recommend other yelpers can try it without the sauce - still amazing!! Literally to die for. This dish also reminds me of thai pork shoulder! 

4. Paella ($45): Spanish rice with assorted seafood, lemon aioli and thyme. We ordered this at beginning of dinner, since it'd take 40 minutes. A little of dry side, but fresh seafood especially prawns. I guess the pork shoulder was too impressive and we were pretty full when paella came; i'd still recommend yelpers to give it a try - generous portion with fresh seafood! 

5. Beverage - Barca Gin-tonic ($13): recommended by the waitress. Light, refreshing with a hint of grapefruit and pine! I loved how light it was, so it wouldn't outshine delicious tapas and wood grilled food! My friend ordered sangria and she loved it too! 

It was a great dinner experience! I look forward to trying wood-grilled steak, toasted bagel with smoked salmon and truffle honey and beautiful skewers. I'll definitely come back with more friends!!
author: Lily M.

description:
We made a reservation 2 weeks in advance and had our table ready well in advance. The food was great and they had options for all dietary restrictions. We told them our preference and they genotype getting us amazing stuff until we told them we can't eat anymore.:)
Their small portion desserts are amazing so make sure you keep some room for that when you go.
author: Deepika K.

description: OK food, awful terrible rude staff. This opening sentence says it all. As well as being over priced the staff (particularly our waiter) would have you believe they're doing you a favour by serving you. We made a special effort of coming here because "it looked cute" but that's where any good ends. We deliberately didn't leave a tip which is a pity because surely there must be some half friendly, half decent staff there that missed out. I'm pretty sure I won't return.
author: Melissa W.

description: Changes in my life have made visiting the city a treat, so when I do visit I like to do something special. Coqueta had been on the list a long time. I am a sucker for tapas because it lets me really delve into a menu. That and all the cheese. I LOVE cheese. My experience started with a brief wait at the hostess stand. I was fortunate enough to catch an early BART train, but it meant I was a 1/2 hour early for the reservation. I was expecting to cool my heels in a very crowded bar. Instead, they seated me right away. As soon as I was situated, my server brought me water and asked if I wanted a drink while I waited. I have looked over the menu on line and was delighted to see it was current. I ordered the Sutter Smash which had caught my eye. Knowing I was alone for the moment, my server kept checking in with me. One of the things she asked was if there were any food restriction or allergies. I told here I didn't have any but that my friend was vegetarian. She promised to mark up a menu for her that highlighted t dishes that were already vegetarian or could easily be made so. When she delivered my cocktail, my waitress asked if I wanted to order a meat dish before my dinner companion arrived. Normally, I would wait, but sometimes I feel guilty eating meat with my veggies friends. The server recommended the chicken croquettes, which would be quick and (of course) delicious. I did, and they were. They were three, two bite bits of cheesy, fried,  chicken deliciousness that were served with slices of orange and slivers of pepper. Yum! Shortly after polishing them off my dish was whisked away and my friend arrived. Just based on that part of my experience, I would say that the service is worth 5 stars. The excellent service continued though out the dinner. Water was poured, new dishes were brought out (great pacing) and empty dishes were whisked away to make room.  Everything we tried (please check out the photos) was delicious. My only real disappointment was the asparagus dish (not sure of the official name).  The Romesco sauce and Manchego that were part of the dish were delicious. The micro greens and the vegetable itself were just OK. The Bikini (brioche a la plancha with caña de cabra, roasted eggplant and Quince Jalea) and Pan con tomate were both particularly good, I think in part because the bread was so wonderful. The dessert was good, but not amazing. I think that and the asparagus are why I can't give 5 stars. If I could I would lean to 4.25 or 4.5. I really wish I had tried the Gambas Negras and Setas al ajillo (sherry laced mushrooms). Both of those are tapas staples for me, but it would have been way too much food. Maybe next time. I also want to try the paella. I typically either go straight for that or have tapas, not both.  I was happy with the cocktails, but for a more traditional experience, go for the wine or one of the wine cocktails. The couple next two us tried two and they both looked really refreshing.
author: Nicole M.

description:
If you're looking for some crazy amazing good times, this place is where it's at, especially with large groups.

You know, it's one of those places that seem to just know what they're doing. From the wait staff, to the drinks, to the creative expressions of every dish, it's what exactly what SF represents when it comes to good food and vibes.

Okay, what to get. Well, nearly every category on their menu is impeccable, but let's try:

- Best drinks: I loved the gin and tonic cocktails. The margaritas are also a hit, with 'air' which basically means a foamy delicious margarita. 

- Best tapas: Do try the croqutas de pollo (a deep fried chicken pot pie in a stick), the pulpo a la parrilla (a wood-fired octopus cooked to perfection), duck and pork meatballs (so soft, so right), and the endives (this seems to be seasonal, but was stellar).

- Best dessert: We were totally into the bizcocho de arroz con leche, which was like a crispy cake with rice pudding in the middle, topped with ice cream. Stellar.

Bring a friend. Maybe a few, and enjoy one of the best places SF has to offer.
author: Anthony N.

description:
If you're looking for an intimate evening with friends or an amorous place to take your date, look no further...

Coqueta means flirt and infatuation in Spanish, so it's no surprise the place oozes just that. Fantastic tapas, tasty cocktails, lively ambience, and attentive service. 

And let's not forget the killer view of the Bay.

Recommendations:

- Salmon open faced sandwich...the truffle honey on top was out of this world! 
- Duck and pork meatballs...tender, juicy and flavorful
- Seafood Paella...great to share among 2-3 people.  
- Their cocktails are delicious, but go for one of their Spanish party pitchers. They pack a punch! 

Nice touch: if you ask for a doggy bag, they give you a ticket to pick it up at the hostess stand before you leave. 

Server gave us a desert on the house after they left us our check. Cheesecake cake pop coated in butterscotch...if that doesn't take you away, I don't know what will!
author: Kimly N.

description: Went here for a dinner while visiting a girlfriend in SF. We ordered a bunch of small plates and had a few delicious (and beautiful) drinks. Love the location and look of this place, both inside and outside. Food and views were good. Sitting at a high top made things casual and cool. Only thing a little odd was our waiter's mannerisms- he didn't speed us, but he was speedy (you know when you're like "do you need to write this down??") LOL. He told my friend he promised he would make her a better drink than the one she originally wanted to try (he told her she "didn't want that"). When she didn't like the one he ordered for her all that much, she regretted not getting what she requested from the start (we let him know but he still charged us). Don't think I would go here for a full dinner again- prob just for snacks and more fun cocktails. I would also say to skip the little fries/egg/shrimp dish at the end if offered- this really was nothing special.
author: Bella W.

description: Great food! Waiter was accommodating, knowledgeable and quick! Perfect place for date night or special occasion. And if you have a gluten allergy..omg you can enjoy every bite of delicious food here. And the Wine selection is amazing! Only one thing the pisco gets 86 quick so enjoy them while you can!
author: Lawanna N.

description: The ambiance is very nice and good for dates.  My first time eating at this restaurant. Good service throughout.   The menu is fairly large and has a very wide variety of food. I love Coqueta - Brady Bunte
author: Brady B.

description:
Been here twice, once three years ago and a couple months ago. 

Both times with a walk in or with a reservation I got trapped sitting at the bar and I hate bar seating. I"m not sure if you can request a regular table when making reservations. I also tried to go last Thursday but they said they were 100% booked for the whole night and the bar was packed so I ended up at La Mar instead. 

Their shrimp dishes here are solid. My favorite is the one with the fried egg. I would probably pass on their small bites next time because they are TINY and when you add up the prices it really doesn't make sense because if you get four small bites you can pretty much get a regular sized dish that isn't literally half a bite sized. 

Service is always nice here and its always popping. Great views, solid drinks. Perfect for date night! I love their sangria but honestly kind of pricey. Last time I came I spent more on the booze than the food and the food was not cheap.
author: Tiffany V.

description:
On a positive note, this restaurant is very cozy and charming. 

As for dinning experience, the food is overpriced and isn't worth it. The $60 steak wasn't a good cut and all the small plates are just that - small. 

Now the service. We had a waitress named Stephanie, who was very eager to sell. We asked to try 2 different red wines and she brought the tiniest drop for 3 of us to taste. Neither of the wine was what we wanted and we asked to try another red selection, but instead she was trying to push an expensive bottle of rose, which we weren't interested in.

We settled on the drinks and ordered a recommended amount of food, but I guess it wasn't enough for them because all they were concerned with is when we will be done and maybe 6 different employees including the hostess came up to our table, with food still there, asking if they can take it away. We were in the restaurant for under 2 hours and they had at least 4-5 tables open. 

Stephanie came (AGAIN) and asked us if we want to see a dessert menu, indicating that we only have 20 more minutes because of the following reservation. We asked for tea instead and after about 10 minutes the busboy came to take away our unfinished tea without even asking whether we are done. Mind you, we already paid the bill so they couldn't make anymore money.  

To summarize this place: meh.
author: Viktoriya G.

description:
Phenomenal food, slightly snobby service. Came to SF on a work trip, hubby flew down for the short weekend. We stopped here on the rave reviews of wonderful tapas bites. 

The reviews surely were not wrong! We had machego skewers, quail egg tasters, a LOT of tasty cocktails. I mean, everything was fantastic. The only reason why it wasn't 5 stars was the snobbery. So if you're reading this looking for excellent food, ignore the rest of this review; it's worth it! 

Alright, we're the average millennial couple. Well-off, but by no means in the typical SF way. We eat moderate portions and try to spend responsibly since we don't make millions. Well we made a late night reservation, came 15 min early, and as I was checking in, after noticing some empty seats, asked if there was a chance to be seated early. The waitress literally laughed in my face. "People don't cancel reservations here! Don't think you'll be seated early!" I will say, we didn't bring umbrellas, and it was pouring.. maybe our soaked jackets pointed to "POOR" status. 

Ok. Just asking! We can wait 15 minutes. Choked back a laugh when another waiter came up a few seconds later and was like, "some people cancelled; would you like to be seated a bit early at the bar?" Ha! The look they exchanged was horrific. 

So we're seated, ordered cocktails and about 7 tapas. Everything is fantastic, this new waiter was great! He asks if we want more drinks, we oblige. Fast forward to many tapas and 2 drinks later, he asks if we want another round or drinks (3rd), we decline. BAM. It was if a switch turned off. We couldn't flag him down for ANYTHING after that. No water refills, no more tapas orders. We still had 5 or more tapas to go through with no water. Had to get up to get the bill. Still paid over $150 for drinks and snacks.. I know people can drop thousands.. but being treated like the poor people was humiliating and put a sour note to the end of the night. The food was indeed fantastic though; and begrudgingly I would still go back despite the service since the food was that good. 

Maybe I'll be richer next time ;)
author: Allyson H.

description: The food was amazing! But that's not really why I'm writing lol the bartenders and the cocktails were AMAZING. We were visiting the area and our bartender (whose name I wish I could remember!!!) walked us through the menu, made suggestions and took our orders in a timely manner. Shortly after, he delivered our cocktails. I wanted to take a bath in that margarita. I want to run away with it and have it's baby. Because of that bartender, I would happily recommend this place to anyone!
author: Cristina V.

description:
A must try place! Awesome venue, awesome service, and most of all awesome food! 5/5! 
Make a reservation ahead of time. 
Also, parking is either street parking which is $3.25/hr before 7 pm or public parking lots for a flat rate the whole day.
author: Kriselle N.

description: Tourist trap. Mediocre food, expensive prices. Try to get you at every corner- one easy example: we ordered cheese, came with two crackers and we asked whether we could have a couple more. They brought out 3 more, stale. Charged us $3. F-ing Amazing.
author: Julio V.

description:
Having dined at Michael Chiarello's Bottega in Yountville, I was looking forward to experience his Spanish creations at Coqueta.  Located north of the Ferry Building along the Embarcadero, the restaurant has a bar and dining area in an outside covered patio.  The main dining room also has a bar counter in front of the open kitchen.  We were seated here and had a nice view of the kitchen staff preparing the various dishes.  

Our server welcomed us and since this was our first visit, he gave a run-down on how the dishes were laid out in the menu.  He happily answered our menu questions and opined on some of his favorites.  We tried to get a varied selection and ended with:

Jamon Iberico de Bellota.  What more can I say about Iberico Jamon? Had this is Spain and ever time dining at Spanish restaurants here. It's simply the tastiest cured meat. 

Croquetas de Pollo - 3 skewers of Chicharron crusted chicken and English pea croquetas with cured seasonal citrus. You complement the croqueta with the citrus.  It looked simple, but it was delicious.  

Patatas Bravas - 12 lightly smoked, crispy potatoes, bravas salsa and garlic aioli.   I love potatoes and this was an interesting creation.  They were lightly coated, fried and topped with a dap of aioli. I liked it without dipping it into the salsa. 

Salmon Ahumado - 2 smoked salmon, queso fresco and truffle honey on bread. Generous amount of salmon on each bread.  Though this might not appear t to be a Spanish dish, it was never the less, quite tasty.   

Pluma - acorn fed Spanish Iberico de Bellota pork shoulder loin with honey-chili glaze.  Wow! The Iberico was so moist and tasty.  I could have eaten a lot more of this.
