Would give it another shot but I'm a little skeptical.
author: Tara K.

description: By far the best sangria in the city - speaking as someone who has been to over 10 spanish restaurants in the city. Would recommend getting the Kalimoxto since it's 80% red wine sangria and Mexican coke. Sangria at Picaro was a second.
author: Anugrah V.

description: Can I give more than 5 stars?  we had a great time on a late Saturday night, enjoying small plates for my boyfriend's bday! The waitress was super - not only did she take our order, but she also gave precious advices to make the most of our dinner. Drinks are good, tapas are very well presented and staff really caring. Overall a top experience
author: Serena P.

description:
All I can say is that a random friday night drink and snack couldn't be better. The staff is super cheerful and warm. I got the Salmon Ahumado and it was heavenly. Just plain yummy! 

I had the Galleon which seemed like a popular drink there and was not disappointed. Castro was good as well. Red sangria however was the winner of it all! Probably going to become a regular here!
author: Mahak R.

description:
Classy tapas done right - Coqueta does not disappoint. Fantastic ambiance, delicious tapas and great cocktail/wine program. Good for dates and large parties.

Hands-down, paella stole the show - one of the best I've ever had, often a disappointment elsewhere. Savory and bursting with jamón serrano shrimp, clams, chorizo, carrots, pickled garlic scapes, lemon aioli in shellfish broth. Pricey at $45 but enough to split for 3-4.

Dedicated g&t menu - gin lovers rejoice! An unexpected but most welcome delight. 

TAPAS - Hot
- Kale salad with roasted squash, quince confitura, pomegranate, warm garbanzo dressing $13 - a nice contrast to the heaviness of the tapas to follow
- Sunny side-up huevo with shrimp, crispy potato and chorizo dressing $13 - simple, satisfying street food that packs a punch - loved the chorizo "dressing", tossed tableside
- Pulpo a la Plancha with fingerling potato, olive oil $14 - always one of my favorite tapas, and this version doesn't disappoint
- Brussels sprouts with yogurt & espelette pepper $9 - tasty, but would've preferred a roasted version instead of fried.
- Duck and pork meatballs with tart cherry-tempranillo salsa and crispy shallot $14

DESSERTS
Manchego cheesecake with caramel popcorn $4 - favorite of the desserts we unashamedly sampled. This is the perfect sweet-salty treat.
Churro with drinking chocolate and mixed berry powder $8 - who can resist a churro? Demi-sized to share, berry powder quite the novelty.
Flan with fennel-citrus glaze $8 - at this point we have over-ordered, or at the sweet tooth(s) among us have. Nonetheless, a rich, creamy flan as it's meant to be
Olive oil ice cream sandwich $4 - this was probably the most disappointing, didn't care for the soft cookie it was served on.

Overall, highly recommend. Kudos on tapas well done!
author: Elizabeth L.

description: Don't take someone here for their birthday!! I was really really really disappointed with their birthday efforts for our father.... We have fallen in love with this restaurant, my father is from Spain and we took him here for his birthday dinner. This was the only place he wanted to go. We spent over $350 dollars on our dinner bill and all they did was put a card on the table and a dinky candle on the dessert we ordered and paid for OURSELVES..... I couldn't believe it. My dad was truly disappointed. I  thought Coqueta was a little more classy than that after all the money people spend there! We didn't even get the dessert comp'd.m by our waiter...Little things like that go a long way and they put in no effort. I was looking forward to celebrating more birthdays here in the future but not after that...disappointing.
author: Amanda L.

description:
Not much to add to the more than 1k other reviews. Coqueta was and is one of San Francisco's best spots for tapas. 

Located right at the Embarcadero you'll get the best experience inside the spacious dining area, with lots of natural light. There is an overflow tent outside - also nice but it can't beat indoors.

Food - no questions asked. Pricey but delicious. Highlights:

PAELLA - with big-ass king shrimp ($45)

LUBINA A LA PLANCHA - whole Branzino with manzanilla olive and preserved meyer lemon
salsa ($32)

SALMON AHUMADO - smoked salmon, queso fresco and truffle honey ($8)

The drinks are delicious too - go for their foamy Margarita, or, two of them.
author: Sebastian F.

description:
I have been to Coqueta a few times for drinks, and lunch. I came back last week for a two and half hour decadent lunch with a buddy of mine, who's also a foodie. So it's time for a review.

The best way to go is to get a bunch of plates from the tapas list and share them, although we also shared an entree.

We started with the Mar y Montana, then proceeded with the Gambas Negras, the Pulpo a la Plancha, the Albonigas, and finished off with the Pluma (pulled pork shoulder).

Everything was phenomenal, I cannot recall being disappointed by any dish. I recall specifically the prawns and the meatball being out of this world. Seriously. 

We washed everything down with a bottle of red wine.

This meal was not cheap, but it was worth it.
author: Massimo M.

description:
HELLA FANCE.
I don't mind putting down the big dollas when it's worth it but MANN this place is PRICEEEEY. And it HURT.

I will say, you are paying for quality, service, and ambiance.
The interior decor is well thought out and everything is beautiful. Manly. Leather. Brown. Fancy mancave vibes. (Sorry that doesn't sound articulate, lol.. then again, I started my review with: HELLA FANCE. So there goes that.)

The only thing to note is that it's very loud in here. I don't know what it is with the acoustics but I felt like I was straining to hear my friend across the table from me.

Anyway, on to the food and drinks.

Cocktails start at about $14, typical of the area. High quality ingredients and beautifully garnished. I got the Barca Gintonic and my friend got the Sutter Splash. Both were very well balanced and it was worth the price tag.

FOOD.

HUEVOS NACIONAL $7 - 3 STARS - $7 for one whole egg? It's only two halves. $3.5 per bite. Even ignoring the price tag, I didn't feel like it was all that great?!?!? Maybe I'm just not a fan of deviled eggs, and PAYING that much for a deviled egg. The flavors were very complex with the bonito and the pickled saffron potato. I appreciated the complexity, but I was still sad that it cost seven freakin' dollars and it didn't rock my socks off.

ABONDIGAS, $14 - 4.5 STARS - 3 small meatballs. But, very rich. I cut my meatball into 4 pieces because it was that rich! This is something you want to savor and eat slow. Very rich in duck flavor, extremely soft & tender. Borderline almost falling apart even when moving it over to my plate! The cherry salsa and shallots on top were a perfect complement.

PLUMA, $38 - 3.5 STARS - Everyone RAVED about this, so I ordered it.. and yeah... it was good pork and very tender. BUT IT WAS ALSO ONLY LIKE 8 PIECES. I don't mean to compare with House of Prime Rib.. but it's $50 over there, for a full slab of meat, plus a second slice, AND sides, soo..... it was hard for me to justify this. The honey chili glaze was interesting, but I would have preferred a more savory/heavy sauce. Tasted a bit bland on its own but i guess they wanted the meat to speak for itself.

SETAS AL AJILLO (mushrooms), $10 - 5 STARS - SHIZ. Now these, I can justify paying more for. Perfectly roasted, extremely garlicky, and not too soft. I ate these with the pork shoulder and it made it 100% better, HIGHLY RECOMMEND.

Overall, I put down $125 after tax and tip for a satisfying meal.. 2x higher than I'd like but I guess I can check this place off the list since I had been curious about it for a while now.
Don't think I would return unless a friend picked this place and it was for an occasion!
author: Emily C.

description:
Coqueta has great drinks and food. We've had a private seating with the chef where everything was amazing. Recently went in for date night and were running a bit late. We called several times to let them know we would be 10 minutes late. Upon arrival, we were reminded by the greeter that we were late and would have to sit at the bar. 

We requested an open table for two and were initially declined. Once we provided feedback, the greeter redeemed herself. She changed us to a table with a view and ordered the salted caramel dessert for us which was pretty spectacular!! The strawberry dessert was also yum!!  Cheeseboard is crazy good. Would not recommend the sampler platter that looks really cool. I'm spacing on the name but it's a board with meats, deviled eggs etc for large groups... it's less than amazing.
author: Adriana S.

description:
It's all about the drinks here. And even if you don't do gin -which they specialize in which i thought was weird for a Spanish tapas place, but it's apparently a Spanish thing - this place has great non-gin drinks.

By way of food, the Branzino was amazing. It's hard to find semi-boneless whole fish. They do it well. It was cooked perfectly. Light crisp. So flavorful. 

Pro-tips: 
-if you get here before 5pm the menu is super limited. The tapas are just ok. 

-The views on the patio are worth the uncomfortable furniture. 

-if you do get here before 5 make sure you sit at the bar because the
author: Will L.

description: You know it's going to be good when they use copper cups for water. This place was great! We got the paella which was amazing, no addition to the octopus (pulpo a la parrilla) and duck and pork meatballs (albondigas a la feria)! Everything was fantastic! The paella is expensive but so good and so worth it, and it's a lot of food (just get it!). We also had a super cool drink that came in a traditional Spanish pitcher where one side allows you to pour it in someone's mouth, keeps dinner interesting ;) I would definitely come back here and you should definitely go here if you like Spanish tapas or seafood!
author: Tori Z.

description:
I was looking forward to eat here and was disappointed. Took an out of town visitor and unfortunately the experience fell flat and not live up to the hype.
My sister and law both have been to Spain and the had real tapas. The size of the tapas was a joke at this place . Our server warn us it's small size tapas so we ordered 2 of everything . He wasn't joking, this must be the world smallest tapas.
It's so small you can't taste the individual ingredient . The only saving grace is the Sangria.
author: Extrakimchi C.

description:
It's right at Embarcadero so you know prices will be high. 

I've been here twice: once for only cocktails and the most recent time was for dinner. 

I came here with a group of 4. Reservations were easy to get the day before. I tried: 

"Bikini" - SO GOOD. Talk about a delicious sandwich! 

Salmón Ahumado - the favorite of the night! The combination of smoked salmon and that truffle honey went well together. 

Patatas Bravas - it's hard to screw up fried potatoes, and they didn't. Savory and crunchy with a decent sauce. 

Pulpo a la Plancha - the octopus was incredibly tender and well seasoned!

There were some meat dishes that the rest of the table got that I didn't sample, but there were no complaints. 

Cocktails here are pretty!

Service was attentive and friendly. 

As other reviewers have mentioned, small portions and high prices. Having that in mind, Coqueta was good, but I'm not sure I'd go out of my way to come back here.
author: Noelle H.

description: Another unfinished review from Nov 2016. Came here to celebrate two birthdays and it was really beautiful inside with high ceilings and warm wooden interior.  Wait staff were super friendly. The food was great for sharing.  Kinda reminds me of European style dim sum.  There is a bar outside for bites and drinks.  Love this place.  Will return :)
author: Elaine Y.

description:
Coqueta is one my favorite spots in San Francisco. I've had dinner/lunch there countless times. Every single item on the menu is amazing. My favorite item would be the salmon ahumado. It is spectacular. The paella is pretty good as well. 
The place is a bit pricey but it's definitely worth it. Make sure to stop by for lunch or dinner at Coqueta if you are ever in San Francisco.
The place is really clean and not too noisy. The ambiance is pretty cool as well.
author: Elie A.

description: I've been here over a dozen or so times... birthdays, anniversaries, friends in town- this is a great spot.  I was never really a gin fan until I came here and tried their gin & tonic...it's now become my new favorite drink, thanks Coqueta.  Obviously their food is the big winner here, I've never been disappointed.  Tables can be a little tight, but it's SF so that's not too unusual.  Typically you'll need reservations weeks in advance for a decent time slot but be sure to ask about the chefs table (bar overlooking the kitchen) or the bar area adjacent to the restaurant if you're looking for a last minute reservation.
author: G L.

description:
As a huge fan of Spanish cuisine / tapas, I really enjoyed this restaurant and dining experience. I had some amazing mouth-watering bites that I would definitely go back for. All of their tapas are very small and ordering a few of these can really break the bank. For example, their skewers are delicious. My favorite was definitely the chorizo. However, when they came out..they were more so on toothpicks and the size of a quarter. Eh, definitely did not want to share that with my partner.

After trying their Salmon Ahumado, I had to immediately place another order. DELICIOUS! This smoke salmon had honey and truffle oil placed on top of baked bread. One of the best things to eat in San Francisco for sure. I also had their Jamon iberico as an appetizer. Nothing but good things to say about this meat. Not a lot in the portion but it was worth the high price tag of $29 or so. We also tried the Mar y Montana (uni with Jamon Iberico added on top of it) - 2 pieces for $14, Patatas Bravas (potatoes), the octopus, and duck & pork meatballs. I'm definitely a fan as the food did not take long to hit the table. Quickest was about 5 minutes for the skewers to be delivered.
author: Emily T.

description:
I absolutely love this place!! My boyfriend brought me here for Valentine's. He knows how much I love Spain and tapas, and how much I've been dying to go back, so this was a perfect date. 

It was packed when we got there on a Saturday night, but of course, we had a reservation. We sat at the bar and it was awesome because we could see the cooks in kitchen in our view. It would have been nice to see the view of the pier, but I love watching people make food too lol! 

We ordered 3 different tapas. Salmon ahumado, pan con tomate, y sunny side huevo. I loved the salmon ahumado, it's exactly like the salmon bagels you get in a cafe. My boyfriend is from Ecuador and always raves about pan con tomate, so I'm glad I got to try it. It was good!! The bread was nice and crunchy, while the tomate was a nice acidity and you could add sea salt to it. The sunny side huevo is what I didn't picture, because I didn't really enjoy it. It was too oily for my taste, but my boyfriend finished it all up.

We also ordered the paella and pluma. I've had paella in Spain, and it definitely doesn't compare- a little too dry, but still good flavors. The pluma was too die for!! My boyfriend and I literally fell in love. The sauce and tenderness were decadent. I can just think about how good it was and my mouth starts to salivate. 

I also had a yellow sangria, which was okay. I should've definitely just stuck to the red. 

We got the carajillo for dessert. Brandy ice cream with espresso poured over- so lovely! Perfect way to end our meal. 

Side note: you definitely want to be on the trendier side when dressed. Also, this is not a cheap place, but well worth the money.
author: Tryshna M.

description: Came here on a rainy Monday night.  Had reservations for 7PM, but there was plenty of room in the dining room.  You probably won't need a reservation unless you want to dine arount 8PM.  Their gin and tonic drinks are a must try.  They're both delicious and beautiful.  I'd recommend getting the Galleon (gin/tonic).  Between two people, we ate 4 tapas and an entree.  Note that a lot of the small plates came with 3 servings.  I wish they had a smaller steak.  The one on the menu stated 32oz, and there was no way we were going to finish a 32oz steak and 4 tapas.  The servers were very attentive, constantly busing dishes and bringing out our food.  There was a strangely long wait to get our churros for dessert though (~15-20 minutes).
author: Edward N.

description:
Make a reservation.
Wait a long time. 

Walk in, get seating in less than 3 mins.

Make a reservation.
Wait a long time. 

Walk in, get seating in less than 3 mins.

Make a reservation.
Wait a long time. 

Walk in, get seating in less than 3 mins.
author: Jaime J.

description:
Excellent bar which serves food. The potatoes, sea bass and the shrimp are super tasty. The cocktails looked good too. Slightly touristy in the drinks that are poured from high up, can get slightly irritating.

Service in the bar area can be scatter brained, as we were served by 3 different people during the lunch. But all of them be were super pleasant and helpful.
author: Anupam S.

description:
The restaurant has above average food, but the portions are pretty minuscule and for the price, it simply is not even close to worth it, especially for brunch.

The hubby and I came here after touring Super Bowl City (or Corporate Sponsorship City, as I call it) for a late brunch. I made a reservation for 2pm but showed up around 10 minutes early. The hostess were able to find us seats at the counter at the open kitchen, so that was nice.

The hubby ordered one cocktail, some pink girly looking thing, we we shared 5 items: 

* half size portion of the meat and cheese platter
* the fried potato balls
* the kale salad
* the octopus
* the meatballs

Of those 5, the potatoes were my favorite. I mean, how can you go wrong with fried potatoes topped with a dab of aioli? The meat and cheese platter was pretty good, too, but I didn't like the bread they provided, they had two overly crispy slices of bread and these little bread sticks. Wish they give you more stuff like honey or compote. The meat and cheese selection were very good, though, although highly over priced for the portion size.

The kale salad was just meh, the same for the meatballs, which tasted organ-y, although I liked the glaze on top. The octopus was a bit tough, which was disappointing. The best part of that octopus was the potatoes that came with it.

I asked for extra bread for the cheese and meat platter several times, and none came. The service is basically what you can expect from restaurants like these - sufficient and impersonal, basically a study in sufficiency. The total bill, including tip, came out to be around $110 for brunch with one drink. Definitely not what I was expecting.

This is the third time that I've been here and I have to say, I will only come back for drinks and a few apps. 

Food: 3.5
Service: 3
Venue: 4
Value: 2
author: Alice W.

description:
Didn't know that the chef was from top chef. Based on the food quality, I'm not surprised. 

Pros:
-most of the courses were delicious. In particular the sea bass was the best I've had 
-some of the dishes were fairly creative 
-nice setting right by the water and friendly service 

Cons:
-paella was terrible. Given that this is a Spanish place that really was unacceptable. It tasted fairly burnt. And the protein that they had added just didn't taste as good as the rest of the meal
-the steak had huge chunks of fat 
-quite expensive. Our party signed up for the option where the chef would pick our courses based upon our chosen entree (paella). We were told this would average around $70-80 per person including drinks and dessert. It ended up being closer to 110-120 a person. Oops
author: Angelo B.

description: My first time eating at this restaurant. I was blown away with the flavours.  This has become my new favorite restaurant in SF. Everything from drinks, to appetizers, to coffee was absolutely delicious! Our server was nice and the lighting is just perfect.
author: Pravina K.

description: After communicating with the restaurant, I wanted to update my review of the restaurant.  As a customer we always want to be treated well on our visits, but there's always the "we don't know what we don't know" factor.  The AGM reached out to me to apologize for the service and invited me back to the restaurant for another meal.  I'm not sure when I'll be back, but the fact that management reached out to try and correct a situation says a lot about the leadership of the organization.  I understand poor reviews are difficult to swallow as an organization and they could have taken another road, but decided to do the right thing by the customer.  I'll definitely try them again, and respect them for reaching out and trying to make the situation right.
author: Ben B.

description:
It was one of my friend's birthday and she made a reservation at this place. Our reservation was for 8 and only 2 of us get to the restaurant on time. But the restaurant was nice enough to seated us instead of crossing off our reservation. 

As we walked into the restaurant, we were not quite impressed by the decor and the environment. Because it was just not that special. But as we were seated, the waiter came right up to us (Even just 2 out of 8 people) he started to explained the menu and the drink to us. We were quite surprised and felt welcomed. As our group continued to walk into the door, we started to have a full table. Then the waiter explained the entire menu again to us. But guess what!!?? 8 people deciding what to order for tapas were not an easy thing to do. So we gave the waiter the full power to constructed the dinner menu for us. If I recalled correctly, we have about 12 course meals for that night.

1. We had 2 plates of Cheese plates with some meat (Sorry I cannot name the cheese and the meat, because i forgot what was the names LOL).
     There are 3 different types of cheese (Blue, Smoked Cheddar, and goat cheese?). I loved all 3 of these cheeses, but the blue cheese was too strong for me. The cheese itself have a really strong aroma the just spread through your entire palate. The strong creamy texture goes really well with the cracker provided with the cheese plate. Overall it kind of give you a mouth-gasm if you love cheese! As for the meat, I believed there are porchetta and 2 other types of meat that I don't remember. The meats were great, but not as memorable when compared to the Cheese. But if you LOVE CHEESE. Give the cheese plate a shot! 

2. Razor Clams & Chicken pot pie roll and grape fruit & Egg, Shrimp, Meat, fried potato thingy (Sorry I just don't remember what it called), Meatball
     a. The razor clams was simply served with sea salt and half of a lemon. You sprinkle the salt by yourself and add the lemon juice by yourself as well. To be honest, i believed it will be better if the clams were about the same size. Overall, the taste was fresh but then it's not really a memorable dish. Could give it a shot or not.

     b. It's basically a chicken pot pie inside a roll LOL... it was great but it's pretty much just a chicken pot pie inside the roll and that's pretty much it. The grape fruit slice was to help you to clean your palate.

     c. You basically can only taste the meat under the egg and the flavor from the shrimp. Otherwise it wasn't quite memorable at all

     d. The meat ball was only okay, it's really heavy and it's quite blend in my opinion. Wouldn't really recommend this dish to anyone.

3. Shrimp & Bread
     The grilled shrimps were fantastic! It's a bit spicy but the flavor was awesome. The plate looks a bit greasy, but you can't really feel the grease when you are eating this dish. The bread with the sauce on the plate was also a good combination!

4. Steak
     This is basically their "MAIN Course" The steak was tender and the seasoning was just right. The seasoned the steak with seasalt, but the salt was not overpowering the nature flavor of the steak! Overall, this is an amazing dish! WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS DISH

5. Paella
     This is a great disappointment in my opinion. Everything else are all flavorful and super good for your taste bud, but the Paella was a let down. The rice was not seasoned it was really blend and it was greasy. As you take a bite of the rice, it's super oily and heavy and I wouldn't really want to take a second bite. The shrimp was perfectly executed and the flavor was great. The clams were tiny but the taste was great as well. But the rice itself was a really big disappointment.... 

6. Grilled Octopus 
     This is another HIGHLY RECOMMENDED dish. It's small plate garnished with some potato. You will probably get 3 tentacles from this dish but the tentacles were pretty big. The seasoning was great and the octopus was not over cooked. It was not rubbery at all it was tender!! I'll highly rate this course. 

7. Dessert 
     The dessert was a small cheesecake wrapped by camel. If you don't like your dessert way too sweet. I wouldn't recommend this at all. But if you enjoy your dessert with lots of sugar! This is the plate to go. 

Overall, the experience was great! But Only the Steak and Octopus were the most memorable dishes. Not saying other dishes were bad, it was just not as memorable as these 2. If you want to try Paella (Spanish Rice with Seafood) I would not recommend this at all, since the rice was really blend and under seasoned. 

We gave the waiter the power to construct our menu and it was a great experience. But if you have a strict budget, I WOULD NOT recommend you to perform such act, cause it will hurt your wallet LOL....
author: Jeff H.

description:
Got caught in the rain and ended up taking shelter in here--best happy accident! On repeat trips we always end up coming back and unintentionally keep ordering the same beautifully presented tasty cocktails! Ricardo's (our favorite bartender) barmanship is fun to watch so I would recommend sitting at the bar so you can watch him work and enjoy views of the bay and passing sailboats. There's truly not a bad drink on the menu, but here are my tried and true suggestions:

Drinks:
Galleon (most popular drink--and rightfully so)
Barca Gintonic
Conquistador 

Food:
Albondigas a la Feria (is one order enough???)
Croquetas de Pollo
El Gran Plat Cap
El Plat Cap

Avoid:
The bite-size skewers (delicious BUT literally bite-sized and it's NOT worth ordering for the price when you consider how little food you get...way better items on the menu!)
author: Elizabeth C.

description: I rarely write Yelp reviews, never the less a bad one...but I think management should be aware of the events that happened tonight and take proper action. I really liked this restaurant (great food and ambiance) except for our server W. He is a ginger and avoid him at all costs. It was 5 girls and we ordered skewer platter, 8 appetizers, 3 pitchers of some kind of coke drink and a pallela which ended up being a $325 total. From the beginning W was a complete douche bag  He suggested we order the beef steak for another $88 and another pallela for the 5 of us...do we look fat??? Why r you trying to increase our tab??? Then when we tried to order 2 more octopus left appetizer, he said "no." Wtf??? He said he thought if we were asking if we had ordered those appetizer and he was answering  no we haven't ordered them...really??? He was very unprofessional and just seemed like he wanted to gtfo there. Maybe he had a bad day, maybe it was a long busy shift. But it doesn't give you any excuse to be unprofessional and a completely disassociated waiter. Toward the end, I think he got the clue that we were very unhappy with our service and tried to be "nice" but at that point the damage had already been done. This night was for one of our best friends who just had  baby few months ago  and hasn't  had a girls night out in forever. She is post partum, hormonal and didn't need a snatchy, snarky waiter to tell her to keep ordering  more food and drinks. To top it off, he charged us for 2 sangria pitchers which ended up being $76 dollars which we didn't order. The management was very nice and took this off our tab immediately. If you are dissatisfied with your job and want to make something better out of your life, please go and try to work on your life instead of trying to make other people's experience a less than an enjoyable one.
author: Jennie B.

description: Love this place! I brought my extended family here. Food was amazing. We were comfortably seated, nice service, amazing drinks! Definitely coming back
author: Wess X.

description: Great vibe and view. Definitely a spot to Take people from out of town for some Tapas and sangria. Took off a star because of the portion size and because I didn't find Some of the tapas very authentic. But still a great spot to go when you've got friends from out of town!
author: Pavan D.

description:
For my return visit, we decided to sit outside the bar area and have drinks/appetizers. 

The drinks were well made, visually appealing and overall a satisfying experience

For the appetizers, the patatas bravas uses small whole baby potatoes served with wonderful side of red sauce. I thought it was tasty and worth getting again. 

We also tried the fried brussel sprouts, they too were delicious and worth getting. Had the right toothy bite and well seasoned The sauce on the side added a rich creamy texture and a nice zip of acidity 

Overall Thoughts

Would gladly come back again for drinks
author: Eddie W.

description:
You MUST come here as a group so that you have the opportunity to sample a variety of dishes. You'll surely be infatuated by the delicious, beautifully presented Spanish tapas and cocktails. I have to confess that I only ordered the Barca Gintonic just because she looked pretty in photos. 

Highlights: 

+ Patatas Bravas: (crispy potatoes, bravas salsa and garlic alioli) One of my fave tapas to order.

+ Pulpo a la Plancha (mediterranean octopus, freshly dug fingerling potato and pimentón olive oil): I always love me some pulpo. I really appreciate the subtle smoky flavor and tender meat. 

+ Paella (bomba rice, jamón serrano-shellfish broth, Gulf shrimp, clams and chorizo with cauliflower and lemon alioli) It serves 2-3, but I thought it was sufficient for a group of 6. This is definitely a must in a larger group. The gulf shrimp that adorned the rice are huge and yummy. Hunger warning: Takes 30-45 minutes to prep. 

+ Pluma: (acorn fed, Spanish Ibérico de bellota pork shoulder loin with honey-chili glaze) the delicate meat is so savory. 

Don't forget about dessert.  I recommend the Manchego cheesecake pops with caramel popcorn--what a treat! 

Overall, a noteworthy experience for lunch or dinner. Get ready to spend a substantial amount of dough though, because all those little tapas you'll want to try will add up.
author: Merica S.

description: What a fabulous place to enjoy dinner to kick off Fleet Week! After having been dumped by Foreign Cinema, we decided to drown our sorrows at Coqueta and we were met with open arms and wonderfully accommodating staff. The effervescent beautiful cocktails led to refreshing rosé and a beautiful Tempranillo paired with out of this world tapas. This was an exceptional dining experience, but kudos to all the staff for making us feel welcome and appreciated. We will be back for sure to try other wine selections and other yummy tapas dishes
author: N B.

description:
One word: PHENOMENAL

I took my parents here and they were blown away. The flavors were exquisite and rich and it was a lot of fun to try a bunch of dishes since they were all kind of small and bite size.
author: Hanna S.

description: It's expensive for sure, but the quality of food cannot be beat. Also, how are you going to beat this ambiance? I can't say much about authenticity, but I can say that you will have some fine food. It did take them extra time to get out our order, as our waitress informed us that there was a problem with one of our plates, so what did she do? She created a skewer platter for us with over 40 skewers. Is that service, or what? The food here is amazing. Yes, the pluma pork loin is $38 for a small board of meat, but oh my goodness. That pork loin tastes better than most steaks I've eaten, and we've been around the block (Nick and Stef's, CUT, 5A5, ink., Gordon Ramsay, Aureole, etc.). Start with the charcuterie board (the bread is killer), move on to their own play on patatas bravas (whole, small roasted potatoes), and then have some of verduras (broccolini with pine nuts, garbanzo beans, and garlic) to go with that tender piece of perfectly cooked and cut meat. Will definitely be back.
author: Danny C.

description:
Love at the first sight!  Heard about this place from many ppl! We made a reservation for a Friday evening! Beautiful interior! Loved their chairs! 
Food: excellent! We tried about 10 dishes, everything was phenomenal and exceptional! The blend of flavors was extraordinary. 
Drinks: just perfect! I had a delicious greyhound, and my bf Castro, this one has a little kick in it!
Service: just great as everything else! Alisse G was our server! Very nice and polite, checked on us on point, don't like to much attention from servers! She was on point with everything! Great job! 

Definitely will go back! Such a great experience!!
author: Eugenia S.

description:
Great place for a night out, good drinks, good tapas. 

If you are looking for a nice fancy dinner place to take a girl/boy out to, Coqueta is a great date night destination.    Right off the Embarcadero at the end of the Financial District, you can meet said friend for a nice drink or dinner.   

Because it's tapas style, you don't necessary need a table to share a meal, but if you would prefer to do a sit down dig, make sure you make a reservation ahead of time as they are really busy and all their tables are filled most nights. 

They are known for their delicious Gin drinks, but they also make some great other varieties.  I picked up a very delicious Mojito and my partner in crime ordered basically their version of an espresso martini.  Their wine selections are also really good. 

Food wise, if you ignore the hype, it's fairly decent.  We did a tapas night and ordered the following: 

** Manchego Cheese Plate with Jamon   - Pretty good, though the cheese tasted stale.  Jamon was good. 

** Chicken croquettes - Creamy and delicious.  Each plate comes with 3. 

** Pork and Duck Meatballs - Falls apart a bit, but still tastes delicious.  Again comes with 3 per plate. 

** Roast assorted vegetables  - Delicious, I thought it would be actually more like turnips and stuff, but it was actually mostly greens like Mustard leaves. 

** Grilled octopus -  A little over cooked.  Not as awesome as their sister restaurant Bottega's version.   

** Flan with poached apples for desserts - F**king amazing.  I would come back here just for this. 

Overall, with drinks, our bill came to $111 for 2 people.  To be honest I could have kept eating.  I was still a little hungry at the end, but then again I think I eat a lot.   I think it's a fairly reasonable price of a fancy night out.  Wouldn't be something I'd do all the time.  But would definitely recommend to come here.
author: Maggie F.

description: One time I dropped $330 here with tip. On a date for 2. I eat a lot of food. This place gets you with a lot of micro transactions for their tapas. Be careful. Great food though!
author: Matt H.

description: One of my all time favorite San Francisco restaurants! Creative and delicious tapas.  I would recommend everything on their menu (charcutterie, octopus, paella, all of it!).
author: Leah W.

description: Some absolutely amazing food and service.  While our table was delayed by 30 minutes, the host was gracious enough to waive our corkage fee, offer free champagne, and offer a free round of appetizers.  The tapas are to kill for, and they have a knack of getting the cured meats just right.
author: David C.

description: Scrumptious and flavorful tapas. They are tapas so portions are obviously small unless you're eating by yourself. A bit pricey. Ordered the fried chicken pot pie, octopus, duck/pork meatballs and pork shoulder--I recommend all of them, especially the pork shoulder. Good customer service overall. Very busy, even on week nights it seems. I highly recommend booking a reservation via OpenTable ahead of time or else you'd probably have a very long wait (I was told it'd be a three hour wait at 6pm on a week night a couple months ago) unless you do open bar seating which gets really crowded so it may be hard to find seating as well.
author: Donna M.

description: Took my friend to this spot w/o a reservation . We were told there was no room in the main room but we didn't have much time since I had to return to work so we decided to look for another spot . While standing outside the manager came out and told us he had made some room for us to dine. This was awesome . The food was amazing we had hot tapas . My fav was the octopus and the chorizo with the egg. I can honestly say that the service we received was amazing . The staff went out of their way to provide a great service .
author: Beto P.

description:
The food here is fantastic! I came here yesterday for a team lunch and we tried all the pintxos, pan con tomate, croquetas de pollo, pulpo a la parilla, setas al ajillo, albondigas a la feria, 
patatas bravas, pluma. Of the aforementioned dishes, my favorites were the octopus and the pork shoulder (albeit a bit on the expensive side for the portion size). I would definitely come here again on a date.
author: Austin W.

description: The food can meet the needs of both meat and veg persons. Great drinks and the gin and tonic is gorgeous. The service was a bit slow.
author: Renata E.

description:
So, my wife and I went here when they first opened, years back... We just now tried them again after all that time. (Telling...) Forgettable food back then. Now years later we took a business friend there for dinner last night and unfortunately, it has not changed. Yes, it is in a cool location and seemed lively and popular. But, out of ordering a lot of food we could only come to one conclusion about them. NOT GOOD ENOUGH!
I am giving two stars because the waitress and service was very good. The food was for the most part very tasteless, or if it had any taste it was a disgusting, strange super hot oil soaking and ruining everything it was on.. Many things if not bland were too spicy (I love spicy but theirs was a bitter strange spicy.) They burned our plate of roasted mushrooms and they were soaked in hot bitter oil as well. (They did refund that one, which we appreciated.) They did not even bring back our two lamb ribs we had asked to bring home. (I probably would not have had them anyhow.) Even their churros at dessert were not great. Sorry guys! 

I cannot recommend the food here when our city has better choices.
author: Kirk M.

description:
This is my favorite spanich food restaurant in san Francisco.
One of my foodie friend took me here for my birthday.
I love it. Great paella and small dishes great to share.
Also they have great cocktail. I like so much that in two months
I have been there 4 times.
author: Jesus R.

description: I just love this restaurant on the water with a direct view of the Bay Bridge! Great dinner last Saturday night! Enjoyed their Paella
author: Michele O.

description:
Pricey but yummy.  Came here for my husband's birthday and enjoyed the drinks and food. Great lively atmosphere, water views, and perfect location for an after meal walk on the embarcadero.  We ordered a number of small plates and enjoyed most of them.  I would not come here if you're starving as that could be quite expensive if you tried the array of dishes we did but to enjoy some bites and drinks, it's perfect.  

Staff and service is good.  I would encourage the restaurant to not use copper cups for water since it distorts the taste.
author: Suz L.

description:
Coqueta was high on my list of bookmarks and it didn't disappoint. The place was crowded even on a rainy Sunday night. I felt a bit out of place because my denim was soaked and my boots were filled with water. Nonetheless, we sat at the chef's table, which is more or less a second bar area.  I actually enjoyed it because we got to see the sous chefs putting together a lot of the pastry dishes, which was cool. I can see how this type of seating arrangement might be a turn off to the more elegant crowd. But I'm one to rough it through.

We went by the waitress' recommendations and got 3 tapas and a main dish. Tapas arrived in this particular order; brussels sprouts, octopus, prawns.  I got the brussels sprouts mainly to have some veggies but they came deep fried and honestly tasted like potatoes and were presented similarly to the patatas bravas that I see so much on here.  This is a nice to have item.  The must have items are the octopus with fingerling potatoes and head-on prawns.  These were grilled and you could taste the smokey flavor.  With the prawns, you could suck on the head (that's what she said!) after you eat the meat to get some more value out of your money.  I decided against it because my friend would have judged me and left. 

Main dish was the Paella. A little pricey for rice and seafood but the presentation was pretty killer.  I think Coqueta's specialty is prawns because they I ended up eating like 6 of them throughout the night in various dishes.  There's also some salty pork goodness in there that reminded me of Chinese sausage.  However, the experience was worth it to me. Its shareable and I highly recommend for the couples out there looking for something to split. 

Get the gin and tonic if you're drinking. It's nice and fresh to start and looks great in Yelp photos!
author: Quoc N.

description:
This is a review for lunch. 

Food: 5 stars, come here for the food, it's amazing! 
Ambiance: 5 stars - beautiful rustic dining room.
Service: 3 stars, the waiter was a bit a snob; snooty comments were not very appropriate. It was my birthday lunch and but the server had no clue, until it as mentioned. 
Value: 3 start - it's very expensive to eat. The portion size was small for the price. Charging $2 for hot sauce, $5 for bread and charging for the birthday dessert was a bit excessive.
author: M L.

description: Swanky bar on embarcadero.  The drinks were delicious, I'm not a fan of the food menu, however. Went for lunch and ordered a bunch of apps, given the style of the menu. It was not very fulfilling, but cool bar nonetheless.
author: Shenna J.

description:
Really cute date spot along the waterfront (Pier 5) with amazing cocktails, if you're willing to shell out some clams (ba dum tsh).

Coqueta's divided into two areas: the posh, moodlit restaurant for a more formal occasion, and a smaller greenhouse-esque bar area with perimeter seating and a communal eating area in the center.  We just stopped in for drinks, so we went for the bar area, pleasantly shielded from the bitter cold of San Francisco at night.  We got the "Sun Never Sets," which was pleasantly sweet but mild, and the Beso de Barca, which I absolutely LOVED.  It was sweet, but balanced to start, then was followed by a kick of jalapeno sugar created surprising depth and a treat for my tongue.  We also picked up a few small tapas, the Patatas Bravas, a simple yet starchy treat of smoked new potatoes, garlic aioli, and salt (yum), and their Boquerones, white anchovies skewered with fresh fall vegetables, which went superbly with the sweet cocktails.

To be fair, everything was a bit on the pricey side, but what isn't these days in San Francisco?  I'm reserving a 5 star until I have their actual food, but their cocktails are already 5-star caliber.

---

sweet: delicious cocktails, cute venue
bitter: pricey, can be somewhat crowded
author: Mike P.

description:
Great Gin and Tonics. 
Terrible Hostess. 

We had an interaction with the hostess where she had a problem with our party and needed us to change tables, and while our party did grow more than expected, she let us know she wasn't pleased with that through her attitude.  Wow.  She was condescending.  She was rude.  Sorry, I guess you don't want all the extra money that we're spending.
author: Gary M.

description:
Fancy cocktails, tasty small bites and elaborate presentation at a significant price tag.  They definitely up the game on traditional Spanish tapas with some delightful spins.  It was a little uneven, but the highlights really make it worth the visit.

Patatas Bravas: Delicious! Little potatoes that were soft on the inside and crispy fried on the outside.  A nice dollop of aioli on top and tons of smoky pepper sauce to dip it in.  Much better than the unimaginative diced potatoes so many tapas places serve.

Albodingas: Duck and pork meatballs with a tart cherry salsa on top.  A lot less dense than typical meatballs.  They pretty much fall apart when you dig your fork in.  So tender!

Paella: It was good, but not great.  Kinda small for serving 2-3 people.  The rice was either burnt (like well beyond crispy) or a tad soggy.  I was really hoping for a nice layer of crispy (but not burnt) rice.  The shrimp probably could have been cooked a little more; it wasn't raw but it wasn't very firm either.  The chorizo was tasty and generously portioned, dominating most of the dish.  The clams were standard.

Churros: The mixed berry powder was AMAZING!  I've eaten a lot of desserts, but never had this before.  It's like fruit in cocaine form.  The chocolate was a little disappointing though.  It was thicker than hot cocoa but not as thick as European melted hot chocolate.  The churros themselves were fine.
author: Adam B.

description: The portions are TINY, even for tapas. We came here with a reservation and ended up waiting for 25 minutes--still no table. We ended up sitting at the bar area. Not a good beginning so we decided to order a couple of tapas to try before ordering more. The grilled octopus had 3 small cut-up segments of a thin tentacle--1"x0.5" pieces. Definitely not what the pictures you see from here. When I asked the waiter, he said the chef had extra pieces so he used them. So I'm paying for scraps!  The baby bagel with lox was small but tasted ok. No mas, so we went to the Ferry Building and ate there instead.
author: Peter T.

description:
I love Coqueta. They honestly have the BEST signature cocktail drinks there and very refreshing. The gin and tonic's there = delicious. It's not your typical cocktail so you should definitely order it.  I've been here a few times and this place never disappoints me. The food is always on point and the service is great.

If you want a table, I would suggest making reservations a week or so beforehand or you'll get a super late dinner ~9/10PM. Although, there's also a communal area/first come first serve at the bar as well. It's not bad and you can order drinks and food there too. Also great view as well. Note that this place is a tapas restaurant so it's great to share family style!

Things I Recommend: 
- Gambas Negras Olive oil poached head-on gulf prawns with black garlic and chili sauce 
- Salmón Ahumado Smoked w/ salmon, queso fresco and truffle honey (soo good) 
- Croquetas de Pollo Chicharron w/ crusted Chickenand English pea croquetas with cured seasonalcitrus
- Ensalada de Kale lacinato kale, roasted squash, quince confitura, pomegranate, warm Garbanzo dressing (best kale salad ever)
- Pulpo a la Plancha mediterranean octopus with freshly dug fingerling potato and pimentón olive oil 
- Albóndigas a la Feria duck and pork meatballs with tart cherry-tempranillo salsa and crispy shallot
author: Jenn L.

description:
Good food: check. 
Great service: check
Location: check

Came here for a lunch with coworkers and we really enjoyed it! Coquetta is a Spanish tapas place so expect to share dishes with your party. Each dish that we ordered was unique and very flavorful. I definitely recommend the deviled eggs, the smoked salmon, and the sunny side up huevo. We also LOVED the kale salad (I never thought I would say I love kale in this lifetime). I'd say if you were planning on coming here, make a reservation because the place seemed pretty full when we got there. The food comes out pretty quick but they space them out so that not all dishes come out at once. 

This restaurant is great for a casual lunch with friends or coworkers so I highly recommend it!
author: Tiffany E.

description:
Came here for lunch on a Tuesday and made reservations the week before. We were seated in a nice corner table and started with a bite size skewer ($2.50). With 3 of us, we ordered Paella ($45), "Sunny side-up" Huevo With Shrimp, crispy potato and chorizo dressing ($13), Pulpo a la Plancha mediterranean octopus, freshly dug fingerling potato and pimentón olive oil ($14), Coles de Bruselas crispy brussel sprouts, cremoso de yogurt & espelette pepper ($9), Pulpo a la Plancha mediterranean octopus, freshly dug fingerling potato and pimentón olive oil ($14), and a bite sized Manchego cheesecake with caramel popcorn ($4). I was very happy with everything that we ordered. Each dish was full of flavor. We were actually full before the Paella arrived (takes 40 min to make).

Our sever was very nice and always very accommodating. There are always people walking around cleaning your table off and willing to answer any questions/requests/additional orders.
author: Lauren K.

description:
We just had a fantastic lunch at Coqueta, SF.  What a great group of servers!  I think we had three - table of 17 at the Kings Table.  Our main server was Dennis - hope I have his name right.   He was incredibly on point, genuine and thoughtful.   Please let the owners know that they have an asset in someone who can work as hard as he does and make us feel at home and taken care of.   He made sure we were out on time, asked about food allergies and made sure our two vegetarians were well fed.   Really great - thank you Dennis!
 
The food was delicious - of course - always is!   I have never seen a more beautiful plate of paella - even our Spaniards were impressed. 
My compliments to the chef on each course.  It was fantastic.  Of course, the paella was my favorite but all was equally delicious and presented so beautifully.
 
We will be back soon!
author: Nyla P.

description: Get the Barça Gintonic.  Get two!  I hate gin.  Really....I really, really hate gin but I love this drink!  And you can't go wrong with anything on the menu.  Do make a reservation because it's always packed but certainly worth the wait.
author: Nancy S.

description: Somdra was hands down the best hostess EVER!  We were late for our reservations, but she made it possible for my husband and I to still have dinner and not be rushed.  Dinner and wine was out of this world - felt like I was on top of the world!  Every bite was wow!!! Can't wait to go back!  Thank you again Sondra
author: Anjali K.

description:
I came here for dinner with a group of friends on a busy Saturday night:
Food:
Must eat/highly recommended- rib eye, paella, pork and duck meatballs, olives, churros. These were all unbelievably delicious! Especially the rib eye.

The branzino fish was just okay.  The sautéed mushrooms were tasty but not super memorable.

The flan dessert was not good. It had a weird almost gamey flavor to it that I did not enjoy and would definitely not recommend this dessert.

Restaurant/decor: the restaurant location and the decor is beautiful. 

Customer service: the only issue we had was with the Maitre d who had a very off putting, unwelcoming, and sarcastic attitude.  Other than that the servers were very helpful and friendly.

Overall my group enjoyed our dining experience here and I would recommend this restaurant if you have not been here before.
author: Michelle K.

description: Loved this place. The attention to detail was like none other. We came here on a company trip and these guys went beyond expectations to accommodate on of our guys who had several food allergies. Drinks were excellent--especially the sangria. Oh my goodness those meatballs just melt in your mouth. The prawns were delightful. And the manchego cheesecake was wonderful. The place to go if you want a chill yet fancy place for dinner!
author: Benjamin M.

description: Sitting at the chef's bar provides a view of the beautiful platters of food assembled based on each table's order. Everything we ordered was excellent, and the staff seemed to all be experts in what they were serving.
author: Cory D.

description:
Nice vibe with good music's and equally delicious tapas.
A little on the sweater side, the cocktails are so refreshing and a must try.
Go crazy with Manchego!
author: Auroshikha R.

description:
When I went to Coqueta twice a couple years ago during my birthday week, I had thought that I tried a good sampling of their menu.  But with my recent couple of visits, I realized that what food I had there before barely even scratched the surface.  I got try a bunch of stuff I didn't have, and they were some of the best items on their menu.

One thing to note is that their bar is pretty cool.  I never actually hung out there before, but when I had dinner there with a few friends, I arrived early to try their famous Barça Gintonic.

Barça Gintonic -- http://bit.ly/1KzsPZL
Bloom London dry gin, Fever Tree tonic with grapefruit and pine.
A very fragrant, refreshing cocktail that's visually appealing.  Okay it looks like a fish bowl, but still looks awesome.  I'd surely order this again.

It's also good to know that when you're at the bar, you can also order anything on the menu.  So you can enjoy a few small plates and pair it with some wine or a fancy cocktail.  I still think my favorite drink there is their Porron Kalimotxo that I had before.

When it came to dinner time, even though I had been there before, we pretty let our waiter decide what to get on their menu for the most part.  And he hit it out of the park with all his selections.  Here are some of my favorite highlights from our dinner:

Gambas al Negro -- http://bit.ly/1FQNqHP
Olive oil poached head-on gulf prawns with black garlic and chili sauce.
Nicely cooked prawns and the garlic flavor was pretty strong.

Salmon Ahumado -- http://bit.ly/1Jlagdh
Smoked salmon, queso fresco, truffle honey
These were like little fancy lox bagels.  The truffle honey really made them super rich and delicious.  I actually liked these better than their Mar y Montana, but they're not that far off.

Pluma -- http://bit.ly/1GTMAfF
Iberico de Belotta Pork Shoulder Loin with Honey Chili Glaze
My favorite item of the night.  I think out of all the things I wanted to try, this was my most anticipated.  The pork was so tender, moist, and flavorful, that it really didn't need the Honey Chili Glaze, but the glaze was a great sweet flavor enhancement when drizzled on.  This is a must order!

Paella -- http://bit.ly/1BEIXnH
Bomba rice, Jamon Serrano-Shellfish broth, gulf shrimp, clams, chorizo, cauliflower and lemon aioli.
This Paella is awesome!  Visually and substantially!  You'd think that even though you're at a fancy restaurant, the portion would be small, but this was a perfectly portioned paella for my group.  It came with huge shrimp and was loaded everything listed above.  Why didn't I order this before???

Overall the dinner was a great experience.  Everyone at the table enjoyed our waiter's personal selections.  When I came back again with another group of friends about a month later for lunch, we pretty much ordered the same things above, plus a few things I had from my past visits like their Duck and Pork Albondigas and Patatas Bravas.  All was good and they didn't miss a beat with any of this things we ordered.

After having dinner and lunch here again, it's no wonder why Coqueta is still one of my favorite places to dine in the city.  So much variety on their menu, a great place to dine with group of friends or dining solo, and their bar is a great spot to hangout.  Still highly recommended!!
author: Rodney H.

description: Chef Michael chiarello is one of my favorite chefs. He never disappoints both of his restaurants are amazing. They use fresh farm vegetables and the meat is perfectly cooked. The churros are a must.
author: Isaiah G.

description:
I came here for one reason and one reason only, to give my favorite Gin + Tonic in San Francisco 5 stars!

Do not mess up, when you are here, you must get the Barca Gin + Tonic. It comes with flowers and you can adjust the level of gin you add to your drink. Beautiful, refreshing, you'll order more than one!
author: Ellie J.

description:
Sooooo good. My boyfriend and I shared the salmon ahumado (smoked salmon, queso fresco, and truffle honey), the albondigas a la feria (duck and pork meatballs), the pulpo a la parrilla (octopus), the patatas bravas (potatoes with garlic aioli), and the sunny side up egg with shrimp.  For drinks, I had their version of a gin and tonic and he had some kind of drink with bourbon in it, I think. Drinks were great. 

Only downside to this place is how early in advance you have to make reservations. I made mine a few months ago. When we got there, the hostess sat us at the bar and explained that we would only be there until our table finished up. Our waiter ended up waiting on us at the bar, but we explained that we were waiting for a table. Sitting at the bar also requires reservations, but we didn't realize that the tables and the bar reservations were interchangeable. I was kinda disappointed but wasn't gonna complain because they were very nice about it. At the end of our meal, our waiter brought us their cheesecake dish on the house, for the misunderstanding. It was really nice of him. We loved it and definitely wanna go back.
author: Carli V.

description: GUYS, I FOUND MY FAVORITE RESTAURANT IN THE CITY!! Oh my goodness, I don't even know where to begin. Their decor is amazing. I don't know where they got their plates from, but I am in love. And I asked the servers about them, and they were so excited to talk about just plates. Literally just the plates itself! And our server Anele (like Chanel) was the best. She was super sweet and friendly and definitely made the whole experience so memorable. And then the food. OMG the food. Sunny Side Up Huevo was like heaven in my mouth.. I'm having dreams about this dish. Patatas Bravas, best potatoes ever. And I love that their sauce is not overpowering - even if you completely coat your potato. All their open face sandwiches are amazing.. especially the one with uni. But the salmon with truffle honey was also breathtaking. Basically everything we ordered here was completely mindblowing and I am in love. Can't wait to come back!!
author: Athena L.

description: I stopped by a few weeks ago & was completely blown away by Food & service. I sat at the Bar & was served by Carlos. What a perfect personality to have behind the bar. Extremely professional & attentive.I started off with a Estrella beer & Boquerones Pintxos . Delicious White Anchovies , Campo Olive, Pearl onion &  Piparra Pepper. Next was the Jamon Pintxos with Manchego cheese & Apricot Sherry Conserve. Again a burst of flavors & textures. After another round of Beers, I took Carlos's suggestion & ordered the Salmon Ahumado : House smoked Salmon, Queso Fresco & drizzled with Truffle Honey. Most incredible Salmon dish I have ever had. I really wanted to try the Pulpo a la Parrilla : Wood grilled Octopus with fingerling Potatoes & Olive oil but was not served till 5:00. Next time I will have it!!!! To round out my awesome dining experience, Carlos let me taste the Nolets Gin which is a $110 a shot . A top 10 Culinary destination of mine. Please try them & say Hi to Carlos. Thank you Everyone for your attention to detail & fine work. Steven Carter
author: Steven C.

description:
Wonderful experience and service - and the food was amazing too. 

The charcuterie and cheese plate was a great way to start. We had the 
all of which were delicious. I would highly recommend the Patatas Bravas, Croquetas de Pollo, and the Gambas Negras. All were fantastic and quite filling. There were so many other options I wanted to try, but will have to wait till we come back!
author: Derek S.

description:
I love everything about this place!  Great waterfront venue on the Embarcadero Pier with delicious food and beautiful cocktails.   Reservations are a must here and they are usually booked weeks in advance.  I got lucky and was able to call in and snag a same day reservation.

Coqueta is know for their tapas.  I really wanted to try the open face sandwiches but they were out of the sandwiches that night.   The pintxos platter is beautiful and you can grab as many skewers as you want off of there for $2.50 each.  

Gambas- prawns in olive oil & garlic- so yummy!  Must get!
Patatas Bravas were ok.  
Sunnyside up Huevo- very good when you mixed the egg, shrimp, & crispy potato all together.   
Albondigas a la Feria- duck and pork meatballs were filling. Must get!
"Bikini" brioche- eggplant in a bun- who knew cheese & eggplant would go together so well?
Croquetas de Pollo- tasty- kinda like mini chicken pot pie
I would pass on the doughnut dessert with the chocolate dipping sauce.

I definitely want to come back to try the larger dishes such as the paella or steak as they look pretty darn amazing!
author: Melanie N.

description:
a bit expensive, especially for lunch. but great service and fresh, tapas-style plates. 

waiters are really helpful with the choices, not pushing to order more food than you need

recommendations: chef's choice cheese and charcuterie, padron peppers and ham and branzino. we had a couple other plates too, everything was great. 

it's bigger inside than you will notice from the street. don't let the small bar setting facing Embarcadero fool you. there's another large room with tables

it's definitely more of an expense-account meal than a casual lunch, but worth it if you want to splurge.
author: Bob U.

description: It should be a  table with a view...But the window was painted yesterday...The food is awesome. the service is great. The desert is not as good as expected...And the space is too narrow...But it is by the sea area...What's more can you ask? Lol
author: Yifei W.

description: Try the salmon sandwich for lunch with the green salad and the prawns shrimp appetizer.  This establishment brings a fresh new look tied with old-world San Francisco wood leather and tile with one of the best blues in the city front.
author: Mike A.

description:
It's a must try. Try their bikini :) their cocktails are amazing too. 
You can walk up to the bar with no reservation. It can be crowded on weekends but you can find seats inside or outsides. 

Their warm plates aren't available until 5 p.m. So the best time to go there is around 4 IMO.
author: Ghazal P.

description: I went to this restaurant based off a recommendation and it was so totally worth going. We started off with the cured meats and the smoke salmon open face sandwich. Then we had the duck and pork meat balls, octopus and the pork shoulder which was all delicious as well. The waitress was so nice to ask if anyone from our party had any allergies and since one did. Since we were a large party, she did give us warning about how long we could be there for. She was super nice about it too. Everyone enjoyed the drinks. I can't even remember all the drinks but you can't go wrong with what you choose. Dessert was delicious too. We had their churro. You have to go here and I will definitely go back!
author: Cynthia L.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here for date night (highly recommend making reservations). We arrived a little earlier than our slotted time, so we sat at the bar outside of the restaurant and got some drinks. I got the Galleon and it was super tasty! I would definitely recommend if you're into gin/tonic and some fruitiness. I liked the atmosphere of the bar and the service was outstanding!

When we got seated, we sat in front of the kitchen/bar table. We were originally supposed to sit at a table, but the party in front of us took longer than expected. It was fine, there's no control over that. The only drawback about sitting at the bar tables were the chairs. It was uncomfortable and there wasn't much space for our food... Bummer.

We ordered:

- Albondigas
- Gaucho
- Patatas Bravas
- Pluma

EVERYTHING was absolutely delicious! There is nothing bad to say about the food, the presentation of the food or the atmosphere of the restaurant. However, the service inside the restaurant was extremely slow. I understand it is busy, but I also wish service could have been more sincere, as well. The individual we had was not very helpful when it came to making suggestions and more often than not, we felt rushed... I would still come back for the food and drinks, I just hope next time service will improve or mimic the service we had at the bar.
author: Julia L.

description: Coqueta was fun and tasty.  The staff was respectful and let us have a great time for our bday celebration. Thx for the wonderful cheesecake desert!!
author: Patricia O.

description:
Love this place.  Great sangria and great drinks. Love the Galeon a delicious tonic. They have a great set of tonic drinks all good. And their tapas are delicious.  Try the fried sprouts and croqueta.   Especially when you get great seating the the bar house adjacent to the restaurant.  It's hard to get reservations so call ahead and be on time.  
Service is great.
author: David C.

description: Absolutely loved this place. The decor was beautifully rustic, the wait staff was amazing and the food was delicious. We tried every beer on the menu and had 3 tapas and the paella. I have had paella at other places and this was definitely in the top 3. We will definitely be back.
author: Maricela O.

description:
Came here for dinner after my brother had recommended it.  It's a pretty small restaurant, thus reservations are recommended.  The menu is pretty large, with some meat/cheese appetizers.  They have a few salads and hot appetizers.  We ordered a few items and one of the highlights was the paella, which is really amazing here and cooked well with lots of flavor.  It's had some shrimp, clams and feeds probably 4-6 people.  The octopus dish was also really tasty, nice flavor.  The meat/cheese platter was really yummy, had some amazing tasting blue cheeses and meats, went amazingly with my wine.  We also got the pork which was very good, so juicy and marinated well, definitely highly recommended.  The kale salad was refreshing and tasty as well.

The desserts were ok, we got the hot chocolate cake, which was a little to cakey for me, I would've liked it to be more moist.  We also tried the cheesecake that they gave my dad for his birthday dessert, which was pretty sweet, but yummy.

The service here was really good.  They did a great job of recommending some good wine and dishes.  The food came out fast as well.  There are a few parking lots nearby for parking.  Definitely a great find and great food.
author: Jenn T.

description:
It was fortuitous that I booked Coqueta, a restaurant on The Embarcadero, on one of the hottest weekends in history.  I really needed a break from my non-airconditioned, tiny hovel in San Jose and a tasty dinner on the bay was just the ticket.  

At Coqueta, celebrity chef Michael Chiarello, showcases his take on Spanish tapas with a nod to bountiful California produce.  The food was fresh and care had been taken in the preparation, but they don't waste time of making it look fancy.  

Definitely start with a cocktail here, the gin and tonics are amazing and this is coming from a self confessed gin hater!  I started with The Flaca, which had gin, lemon tonic and hard cider. It was a refreshing and served in a champagne glass.  Just what I needed to start with on a hot night. 

Being housed in an old ferry building, gives the place high, beautiful ceilings with large windows for letting that bay breeze inside to cool things down.  They also have a small outside patio and a bar that is enclosed, that is first come first served if you don't have a reservation, a nice thing to know if you show up with out reseses.  

We started with the meat and cheese plate and how can you go wrong with freshly shaved Iberico ham and Serrano.  Yum!  From there we split a 4-5 tapas, which was perfect for our group of 4.  We stayed away from the three large plates, opting to sample more variety than waste money on an expensive main course.    The stand outs were the Patatas Bravas, perfectly salty crispy tiny round potatoes with garlic aioli.  Duck and pork meatballs were also a favorite, with the tangy sweet cherry salsa.  Definitely have 1 or 5 of the skewers, I especially loved the pickled quail egg with serrano.  Mmm, serrano.  

The star of dessert time was the Carajillo, a Spanish brandy ice cream with hot espresso poured on top.  Wow!

Definitely recommend this one to friends, would be best in a small group, so you can try more things.  
Parking is sometimes expensive in this very touristy park of SF, but we found street parking a few blocks away, so check the meters before you spring for a lot, especially if you don't mind a stroll!
author: Sharon W.

description:
5 stars for service unfortunately can't make up for the complete lack of flavor in almost everything we ate, and a few inedible dishes due to over spice and/or burnt flavoring. We tried nearly everything on the menu, and was disappointed from the charcuterie to the churros, and everything in between. This was our second outing and our last. 
And we should have known better. We have the same feeling about every restaurant he owns. 
We'll stick with Contigo for the best tapas in SF.
author: Nancy R.

description:
Spanish tapas + gin = Game changer.

Plums is a must.
Croquetas De polla is a must.
Salmon ahumado is a must.
Mushrooms is a must.
Barca chronic is a must.

Enjoy.
author: Alex T.

description:
Loved this place! I came here for a friend's birthday dinner and everything was amazing! I loved the decor and the ambiance was great. Our server was friendly and very helpful since it was many of our first times. Most items on the menu are tapa style (smalls dishes) so since we had a group of 8 we ordered about 2-3 of each item. 

My favorites/recommendations:
- The Mar y montaña, sea and mountain if you love uni
- The Salmon Ahumado if you love raw fish
- The Paella- this is a hefty portion and delicious!
- The Barça Gintonic, prettiest and tastiest gin and tonic I've ever had!

Overall, everyone had a great time and we loved the food. Reservations are highly recommended and don't drive here, parking will suck because it's along the Embarcadero.
author: Lynn T.

description:
Delicious Spanish restaurant on the SF pier! 

Red sangria, Mon Mar Montana, ensalada special, gaucho, paella, croqueta, octopus , sunny huevo, patatas bravas, cheesecake, bizcocho dearroz, churro fantasy, tres , sorbete Del dia, & Helado Del dia.

GREAT service & amazing food! Thank you!!
author: FoodieJulie S.

description:
The food was amazing we ordered the octopus, potatoes, loch bites and paella. The octopus was incredible the seasoning and the sauce was very flavorful and not too much, it was perfect. The potatoes were given to us on the house,  it was my tied for my favorite dish of the night. It was marvelous light fried giving the potatoes a crunch with a soft inside and the aioli droplet added to the flavor. The tomato based sauce one the middle just gave it the savory flavor I wanted. The loch bites were more on the sweet side than savory but were tied with the potatoes for my favorite. The smoked salmon on top had a sweet honey glaze over them which was tremendous. The bagel bites that salmon was resting in was toasted to perfection, giving it a crunch to the softness of the salmon. The paella was admirable the chorizo was flavorful and had a small kick. The shrimp was heavenly. However it was burnt on the bottom which made it not as enjoyable as it could have been. The food overall the spectacular and I would definitely come back for the food. The drinks were amazing and very exotic. 

The service was impeccable! They were quick to pick up our empty cups and dirty dishes and bring out our next round of food or drinks. They were exceedingly friendly and nice. You couple obviously see them working together and as a unified unit. The ambience was very modern and a step up from casual, about collard shirt dressing. I would definitely recommend them to everyone. I have no complaints on their service, presentation, or cuisine.
author: Matthew S.

description:
I began my Coqueta experience by ordering the Marrasquino cocktail and a dish of almonds to nibble. I figured wine, fruit juice, not too potent. Turns out the cocktail was not as innocent as I thought, and I developed a sneaking suspicion I had consumed it too quickly. 

They brought three tiny bites on a plate, tortilla, manchego cheese with quince paste and I forget the other one (was it the cocktail?), but all were good. Asparagus had not been on line but was on menu with romescu sauce, I ordered as a starter, dropped some sauce onto the table and then dipped a corner of the magazine I was reading into it. (Memo to self: water is for quenching thirst, cocktails for sipping). They had a couple of specials that both sounded good (clams, sausage); I ordered the sausage along with the meatballs. 

Asparagus was great. Sausage good but not really special. Meatballs really good, could have eaten twice as much. A lot of things on menu look good, the group next to me seem to have ordered nearly everything!

Tres chocolates for dessert and manchego cheesecake bites. The bites were great, I'd love to see a full-sized serving added to dessert menu. Tres chocolates good, although mousse was more chocolate cream than mousse. 

Astonishing how the bill adds up - have to agree with those who said pricy. But plan to return with a friend to try more things.

Good service throughout. 

Restroom, thankfully, does not have those ghastly perfume sprayers. Dropped a roll of toilet paper, which unrolled itself merrily across the floor. Is it OK to blame the cocktail?
author: Carol S.

description: Great drinks, great spreads for a nice relaxing Sunday. As expected it's a little pricey but well worth it with a waterfront view.
author: Jessi W.

description:
I don't remember much. I was a blur of excellent food, drink, and company. I get flashes of:
+The excellent house gin & tonic
+How odd and yet so satisfying the salmon, honey, cream cheese was
+How we savagely devoured the meat and cheese platter
+The tasty, tasty octopus
+The mouth-wateringly spicy peppers

I desperately try to recall dessert, but only get glimpses of sigh-worthy churro and manchego cheese bites. Pass.

I'm going back for more of that G&T and that platter of goodness.
author: Adena B.

description: Very expensive and very tiny portions. Of course it's tapas restaurant but still!! Customer service was not that great, and very rushed
author: Dorys P.

description:
Service:
- spilled oil on us and our dresses/ purses and they did nothing 

Decor
- eclectic and cramped but fun

Food:
- patatas bravas great
-gambas negras a little fishy but good flavor otherwise 

Drinks
- Barca gin tonic: strong but served with tonic on the side to dilute it 
-Galleno
author: Cameron M.

description:
Everything here is absolutely delicious! Best tapas I've had here in SF.  We ordered Pintxos, cheese and Jamon platter, Pulpo a la Parilla, gaucho Bistec, branzino a la Parilla, Gambas Ajillo, Sunny side up with shrimp in chorizo dressing- everything is Muy Delicioso!! 
And the staff are just wonderful, they explain every dish and are attentive to your needs. 
Im not a dessert lover but the caramelized Manchego cheese is divine. Interior decor and open kitchen concept is amazing. 
I would highly recommend this place for a wonderful and heartwarming meal.
author: Jen O.

description: A bit pricey, but otherwise it's an amazing dining experience. The menu is fairly large and has a very wide variety of food. Similarly, the cocktail and wine menus have a huge variety of drinks. Everything our group of 8 had was excellent: squid, shrimp, potatoes, paella, peppers, anchovies, pork shoulder, and meat & cheese plate. Manchego is my favorite kind of cheese and the one of the cheese plate was one of the best I've had in the world. The food was all made from super fresh and flavorful ingredients and was just some of the tastiest and most unique flavors I've ever experienced. The service was great and it was just an excellent dining experience. It did end up being a bit pricey at the end, but I still feel that I got my money's worth with such great food and drink.
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
Amazing location and potential for an amazing experience... ours was ... meh...

Waiter wasn't sure if they had whiskey - when I pointed to the bottle of Knob Creek he indicated that it wasn't whiskey... well, ok yes but my point was they had a related cousin... a distant aunt... a step-mother, if you will. 

Incredibly expensive and poor service make it a three star for us.
author: A X.

description:
Went for Brunch on a Sunday at Noon.  Not busy at all but it quickly filled in so I am glad we got a reservation.  

The interior is beautiful with high ceilings and exposed beams, overlooking the water.  Great for a fancy occasion or to impress your visiting Mother.

We started with the bites, which were served to us on toothpicks placed in a tray and it was a self selection with each bite priced at $2.75.  All of them were delicious but it was weird that they brought over the same tray that was seemingly used at other tables...not exactly the most hygienic way of serving high end appetizers, I would think, but it didn't bother me the way it did my hypochondriac Brother.

Highlights were definitely the Pork and the Kale Salad.  Both of which we got 2 orders (since they were way too small for 6) and delicious.  The Paella was very good but also pretty small.

I think the Sangria was delicious, we had 3-4 "pitchers" of it so somebody definitely liked it.  Our bill came in around $375 + tip so it wasn't crazy expensive, especially for the given the exceptional service and quality of the dishes.  

I would definitely go back but not with more than 4 people.  The place isn't setup for large groups.  A great place for a day date I imagine.
author: Lee S.

description:
Well - you won't be getting drunk here.
The Mezcal I ordered was literately 1/4" of liquid at the bottom of the glass.
Pinchinest shot of liquor I've ever had - 4 sips max.

The food we ended up with was mostly sweet and salt based.
Yeah - one can make cat droppings taste OK with enough salt 'n sugar.

Croquetas de pollo (hot and crispy with a rich, creamy filling) with chicken bones.
I suppose the diva chef wanted to add some crunch.

The cheesecake on a stick was so sweet the GF couldn't eat it.
The polite server inquired how it was and she gave it to her straight.
Kudos for not charging us for it - that was nice.
Still $160 for 3 "drinks", 2 beers and a few tapas.
