Went with low expectations - TV personality place, waterfront location, no reservation (well, that's my fault) - yet we had a very pleasant dinner. The host worked hard to get us a seat, the staff made us comfortable, and the food was fresh and interesting. An especially nice touch - the kitchen was backed up, but the waitress let us know what was going on, and the kitchen circulated free appetizers to everyone in the restaurant.
author: Ron O.

description:
The city sounds. The romantic sights.
A lighted bridge and beautiful nights.
One lucky man.  The lovely date.
Coqueta charm illuminates.
Sittin' on the dock of the bay...
Otis surely came here to play.
A perfect start... their gin and tonic.
Floral, artful, flavors harmonic.
A glass or two so warm so fuzzy.
Her soft creamy skin flushed n rosy.
Octo. Calamari. Top two musts.
Razor clams retired... my secret lust.
Love, life, laughter, we're medicated.
Not authentic, Paella overrated.
Ribeye med rare. Juicy perfection.
Skewers so cute but skip the selection.
Colorful sippins. Seductive nibbles.
Cozy date night? An easy riddle...
Deep into her eyes... she captivates.
Intimate, lively... Coqueta awaits.
author: Colin M.

description: Came here with a co worker after work on a Thursday to unwind. The food was delicious and the atmosphere was very laid back. Our waiter was attentive and had great suggestions on what to order. My favorites among what we ordered was the lox bagel, strawberry gin and tonic, sunny side huevo, and manchego cheesecake. Tip: make sure you have reservations because this place gets pretty packed. You can walk in without reservations and find a seat at the bar area but from the look of it there were no seats available.
author: Lorraine N.

description:
Food was good but the service was subpar at best. The waitress was nice but she brought some of our drinks, we had to ask her again for two of our drinks and when we asked for a second it was never brought.
We order six or seven small dishes to share. The food it took 30  minutes to get only two of our dishes. The couple next to us that were seated after us got all of their food and left before we got two more of our dishes. We had to ask where our other dishes were to finally get them 15 minutes after that. It took a total of about 2 hour to finally get all of our food. A party that came in 45 minutes after us got many if the same dishes we did and before ours arrived.
The food was excellent but the service needed help. There are many excellent restaurants in SF so I will most likely not return.
author: Amy A.

description: On business travel I arrived early to find a more or less empty restaurant. That said I was told the restaurant was savings the seats for parties of at least two, including the bar. Hence I never was able to enjoy, or not, the food at Coqueta.
author: R S.

description: Nestled on Pier 5, Coquetta provides an unforgettable experience from the atmosphere of the restaurant, surrounding views, and tantalizing offers. I came here with a group of friends after one of them couldn't stop raving about their Gin drinks. Unfortunately we were only here for the drinks so I'll have to stop in for food another time. The bar was surrounded in glass with views of the Pier and Embarcadero. They had an extensive cocktail, beer, and wine menu that showed they were nothin short of an amazing list. If you're a gin or cava fan you've arrived at the right place. I ordered the the guys ordered bourbon and whiskey drinks while the girls and I ordered their version of gin and tonic and Tarif (Ham infused gin with apricot, orange, and Cava). The presentation of the drinks was beautiful and the Tarif was the showstopper. Don't let the ham infused gin turn you away! I'll definitely be back here.
author: Carly H.

description:
Summing it up - just not my cup of tea. 

My husband and I and our 4.5 yr old daughter went for lunch. Ordered 1) open face uni sandwich, 2) potatoes, 3) watermelon salad, 4) chorizo and shrimp, and 5) pork shoulder. And bread with olive oil which they charge $2 for "Bread Service"
Sounds like slot but the portions were small - tapas. 

Decor is nice. Food is professionally cooked, I.e, I could not replicate it at home. Flavor is ok but I wasn't loving it. The pork shoulder were cooked perfectly and it was so tender that you could cut it with a fork. But there were 6 pieces, each a 1.5 biter size and it cost $38. I don't think I have ever had pork that expensive. Total bill was $101 pre tip and we were still hungry. My daughter only liked the bread and afterwards, she ate a whole onigrilly by herself which we got at the Embarcadero center. 

Service was barely cutting it. Nobody served us water and our server did not come up greet us. I had no idea who our server was so I didn't know who to flag down. There were lots of servers and the restaurant was 75% full but nobody gave us attention until I flagged my arms up in the air like a crazy woman. 

I won't be going back only because I don't think it was worth the price.
author: Sylvia C.

description: This review should have been written some time ago, so I do apologize for the late post.  Coqueta is Michael Chiarello's sister restaurant from the spectacular Bottega in Yountville.  Coqueta offers a great and modern tapas style cuisine which was perfect for our party of 8.  Our margaritas were so delicious and the creativity placed in all the dishes and drinks were flavorful, delicious and fun.  The desserts were also unique in their presentation and left a lasting dining impression.  The Michael Chiarello family has added a beautiful addition to the city as well in wine country.  Thank you to our Gary Danko family for being able to have us experience yet another amazing restaurant by coordinating our visit here.
author: Lan N.

description:
I'm not a big tapas fan, but figured I had to dine at Coqueta based on all the rave reviews I've seen. My friend called in exactly a month ahead of time and was able to secure much coveted reservations for a party of 3 at 8pm on a Saturday. Unfortunately, we were running late, and although we called ahead, they had to give away our table so we had to wait another 25 minutes once we arrived at the restaurant. The worst part about having to wait for a table was that the bar area is small (slightly smaller than the restaurant side), and they also have people dining there, so there really isn't much room to sit or stand around. Also, one of the servers dropped a tray full of drinks on the floor and splashed my friends leg, and they apologized quickly but didn't bring a towel for her leg like they said. Once we were finally sat, we ordered:

-Championship "Policy" (JW Black, Carpano Antica, Barrel Aged Bitters, Casa Piena Barrel Smoke, $13, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/coqueta-san-francisco?select=FKmGFahRhf_zt3vx1Mjgaw#LVBEG4qozVIgJO_SVTZxRg): I hated the barrel smoke, but my friends enjoyed this drink.
-Modern Mojito ($12, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/coqueta-san-francisco?select=FKmGFahRhf_zt3vx1Mjgaw#KG0eMS-BwHMPNn4XwKOoew): Pretty good, actually, and I'm not a big mixed drink fan.
-Pintxos/Bite-Size Skewers (House Cured Boquerones, Chorizo, Jamon Serrano, Tortilla de Espinancas, Huevos de Corniz, $2.50/ea, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/coqueta-san-francisco?select=FKmGFahRhf_zt3vx1Mjgaw#FKmGFahRhf_zt3vx1Mjgaw): We tried the Chorizo (Roasted Artichokes, Piquillo Peppers), Jamon Serrano (Manchego, Apricot-Sherry Conserva), and Huevos de Codorniz (Quails Egg "Diablo", Pickled Mustard Seed, Jamon Serrano), and the quails egg was definitely my favorite. The egg was cooked perfectly and went well with the other ingredients. The chorizo was really hard to chew, and was also on the salty side like the manchego. I wouldn't get either again.
-Mar y Montana/Sea & Mountain (Ibercio Lardo Gently Melted Over Sea Urchin w/Lomo Iberico, $14, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/coqueta-san-francisco?select=FKmGFahRhf_zt3vx1Mjgaw#7nTxEi7qt_RBSSzGo4Bn5Q): Delicious, and one of favorite dishes, although I wished there was enough uni to cover the entire cracker.
-Pan Con Tomate (Iconic Cristal Bread & Tomato Sofrito, $5, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/coqueta-san-francisco?select=FKmGFahRhf_zt3vx1Mjgaw#sMjWKLWkJTwKXoV1-4nlmg): So-so, the bread was too toasted/hard- skip!
-Croquetas de Pollo (Chicharon Crusted Chicken & English Pea Croquetas w/Cured Cara Cara Orange, $9, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/coqueta-san-francisco?select=FKmGFahRhf_zt3vx1Mjgaw#7YjlrIZZmhpWLqy4aTjAfQ): Delicious, and a must order! I loved the crispy exterior and flavors of this dish.
-Paella (Bomba Rice, Jamon Serrano-Shellfish Broth, Gulf Shrimp, Clams, Chorizo, Broccolini, Asparagus, Lemon Aioli, $45, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/coqueta-san-francisco?select=FKmGFahRhf_zt3vx1Mjgaw#HcbQiZU1V13XykUDhQ-9_Q):  This dish serves 2-3, but will take 30-40 minutes to prepare. I thought it was ok for a paella, and liked that it didn't have a ton of saffron. However, some of the seafood was overcooked, and it wasn't so amazing that I would order it again.
-Pulpo a la Parilla (Wood-Grilled Octopus, Fingerling Potatoes, Pimenton Olive Oil, $14, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/coqueta-san-francisco?select=FKmGFahRhf_zt3vx1Mjgaw#f6lN_Z-PlQ3Xr-qWkcUiSA): Just ok- the octopus was slightly overcooked and a bit chewy- skip.
-Trio de Salchichas (Grilled Sausages Glazed w/Isastegi Cider, Fresh Cherries, Mojo Verde, $14, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/coqueta-san-francisco?select=FKmGFahRhf_zt3vx1Mjgaw#6YXa0rpoeFfB1lrKSRUtYg): We had a blood sausage, and I can't remember what the other two were, but none were very good.
-Albondigas a la Feria (Grilled Duck & Pork Meatballs w/Tart Cherry & Tempranillo Salsa, Crispy Shallots, $14, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/coqueta-san-francisco?select=FKmGFahRhf_zt3vx1Mjgaw#FQsk6YVpQWVK8BiSBlPZqg): Ok, but nothing special. Skip!
-Churro "Fantasia" (Crispy Spanish Doughnuts w/Drinking Chocolate, Mixed Berry Powder, $8, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/coqueta-san-francisco?select=FKmGFahRhf_zt3vx1Mjgaw#ZEjAfXXdtSpYUXO3UiZMcg): The churros were good, but I wasn't a fan of the drinking chocolate. 
-Manchego Cheesecake w/Caramel Popcorn ($4, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/coqueta-san-francisco?select=FKmGFahRhf_zt3vx1Mjgaw#Cc2maG1NIl1gCC0YW3CIPg): I didn't like this much- the manchego flavor was really strong/salty, and the combination didn't work for me although my friends liked it.

Our server was ok and friendly, but she took almost 10 minutes to greet us once we were sat since I think she was stretched too thin amongst tables. At least our food came quickly once we ordered. Overall, I wasn't that impressed by the dishes we had, and enjoyed my dining experience at his other restaurant much more (Bottega in Yountville).
author: Amy D.

description: YUM! Classy, bustling atmosphere. Wait staff couldn't have been nicer! Had appetizers our first visit then came back again for dinner a couple nights later (Black Friday). Interesting/tasty drinks. Tapas were all great & we splurged on the bone in rib eye -- 32oz of Heaven! Octopus dish was amazing, too. And the duck/pork meatballs were fought over!  Will DEFINITELY be back!!
author: Donna S.

description:
My second time having lunch at this restaurant today.  Five stars doesn't do any justice! The food was amazing (again!) and the service was impeccable (again)! We tried several dishes and they were all delicious!  

Highly recommended!!
author: Cathy D.

description:
After getting some fresh oysters at Hog Island, just a few minutes walk away, came to Coqueta for dinner with bf to celebrate something special. We were about 30 minutes early for our reservation but the hostess was ready for us anyway.

The ambiance was lively, and the location prime.

We ordered:
Drinks:
1. Magnolia IPA
2. The famous Barca Gintonic (worth ordering!)

Food:
1. Salmon Ahumado - if i had a choice, i would order 1000 of them
2. Bikini - Soooooo yummyyyy
3. Sunny Side Up Huevo - a little too salty for me but presentation was great!
4. Albondigas a la Feria (duck and pork meatballs)

Everything was so delicious, I have to come back for more (especially to see what other cool drink presentations the bartenders come up with).

Also at the bottom of the menu, you will see that a * means it is what Chef Michael is eating, and if you are indecisive or just open to trying new foods, pick whatever he is eating!

And to be honest, for a restaurant on the Embarcadero, the bill did not break our pockets, so this is a fabulous place to reunite with old friends or celebrate a birthday, anniversary, promotion, etc. and feel great about it!
author: Elisha Y.

description: Many negative reviews state that the food is not good enough for the price. To be honest most of the tapas we had (and we did order all the Yelpers' favorites based on the positive reviews I read) were not good at any price. They were just tasteless (or tasted like sugar, had bad texture, or were just simply bad). I can only believe that people who say this place is similar to Barcelona have never actually been there.  Service was lackluster as well. And the sangria was the worst I have ever had in my life. Will never be back.
author: Katya F.

description: I picked up this restaurant because it was right by the bay and it looks beautiful.   the thing that I don't like about  this restaurant they brought out one meal first and then the second meal came out15 minutes later. and  for the price they charge you shouldn't  have that kind of issue.  that's why I'm writing this review. The food was delicious, but our server never came back to check on us we were sitting near bar area, and the bar smelled like it needed a good clean. Doubt we will ever be back
author: Jose G.

description:
Michael Chiarello really did a number on this tapas restaurant and I loved everything that I had here from the drinks to the food. I ordered their version of a gin and tonic, since it was highly recommended by our server. The drink itself was aesthetically pretty with an orchid and berries floating around in it, but it also tasted great (and this is coming from a girl that rarely drinks gin). 

The first dish up, pulpo a la plancha was super tender grilled octopus with a perfect char on the outside. The pluma (pork shoulder) was up next and was paired with an order of the setas al ajillo (wild mushrooms). The pork shoulder came with these interesting chili twig-like bits for spice, but I was indifferent to the honey-chili glaze that came with it. The mushrooms were cooked and seasoned perfectly. The paella came last and was legit. Loved the flavors and seafood on top. 

Overall, I was highly impressed with the quality of food and service at Coqueta and I have added it to my list of favorite restaurants in SF. I can't wait to come back and try even more of the tapas.
author: Elissa S.

description:
Best churros I've had in San Francisco. 
The deviled eggs with tuna isn't that great. Tasted like tunas in a can. The cauliflower steak was good. The albondigas...really good. The croquettes de pollo were also delicious. Pretty pricey for a tapas bar though. Service was fast and great. Had a great time.
author: Pam Y.

description: Terrible service, mediocre food at inflated prices. It was busy but we lucked out and found a seat. Ordered some tapas that were extremely ordinary. Prices on the high side so expected much more. Waiter forgot to bring drinks and food arrived before the drinks.  Waiter then disappeared for 20 minutes while he waited on other tables even though we had told him we would want to order more food so come back soon... he never came back.   Also ordered a glass of house wine and the waiter brought a $20 glass of wine. Looked at menu later and there was no house wine listed.  Very bad experience.
author: John M.

description:
Cutesy quaint.  The exact place I picture when I want to catchup with a friend with guaranteed tapas and beverages.  

Barca Gintonic: 5/5
The Sun Never Sets: 6/5 **Thought it was going to be too sweet and DAMN it hit the spot.
Chorizo: 5/5
Jamon Serrano: 5/5
Patatas Bravas: 5/5
Croquetas de Pollo: 5/5
Albondigas a la Feria: 5/5
Coliflor con Romescu: 7/5 **i'm a condiment lovvvah, and this coal roasted romescu sauce will change your life.  I would have licked the sauce bowl but I'm sure I would have been judged harshly.
Ensalada de Kale: 3/5** underwhelming
author: Noey A.

description:
Coqueta was a very tasty, solid meal.  Found myself smiling at certain points without anything to say.  Sat facing the kitchen and that was fascinating. Cooks, preps, servers, expeditor, suits, all working hard and together...it was nice to see. My 2 favorites (though I did enjoy everything)...

*Black Garlic Shrimp:  sweet and savory. drink up that sauce. shrimp perfectly cooked. why we only got 3 shrimp while the twosome next to us received 4... not sure. maybe they weigh it, but I could eat 50 of these.  50.  Suck the heads and eat em too. Yup.

*Sunny Side Up: remember those Pik-Nik potato stick in a can? It's the grown up, real potato version with chorizo, sunny egg and well cooked shrimp.  Mix it all up. I woke up craving it for breakfast. 

Will come by another time and plan to stay longer to get the paella.  Two of us ordered 5 plates (+ octopus, croquettes, brussels).  Pace of service was on the slower side but if you aren't limited to an hour it's nice not to be rushed.  

Service was great and the gentleman was engaging. BUT one thing...it would be nice if they had coat service.  It is SF after all and sitting at the bar people are trying to keep their coats on their laps or sitting on them. I noticed I wasn't the only one awkwardly shifting.  I know it's not that type of restaurant but it was one thing I wish I was free of so I could enjoy my meal even more.  The seating at the bar is tight and stools a little rickety but once I got settled in  and used to the patron next to me bumping into me it was fine.
author: Eileen A.

description:
Amazing. Perfect for a small group of 2-6. Not good for children. 

First things first-- get the Barca Gintonic. Don't eat the flower they put in it. Do savor the 0 hint of alcohol in the (fairly strong) gin&tonic.

Pintxos: Bite-sized skewers ($2.50 each)
I loved the Chorizo and Jamon Serrano. The staff comes around with the pintxos on a tray, and you can grab whichever ones your want. 

Montaditos: Open face sandwiches
We tried the Salmon Ahumado. I'd never think to eat salmon with truffle honey, but now that I've tried it, I can't stop thinking about it. Amazing combination. Favorite #1. 

Tapas Calientes: Hot tapas
Croquetas de pollo was my other favorite dish. The cara cara orange compliments the croquetas perfectly. Favorite #2.

Pulpo a la Parilla, or grilled octopus, was nothing special. A little dry; I can pass on this next time.

Albondigas a la Feria - Duck and pork meatball. Exactly as you'd expect. The tart cherry-tempranillo salsa adds a nice touch. 

Raciones y venduras: Larger, family style (plates)
Pluma acorn - Pork shoulder. The plate made this restaurant for me. Soft, juicy, and extremely tender. The pork shoulder was cooked to perfection.  The dry chili flakes were great. Favorite #3.

Arroz & Paella: Paella. Get the Paella. It's so good, it even has its section header. Favorite #4. 

Postre: Desserts
Churro "Fantasia" - Berry powder added a sprinkle of sour to the sweet, crispy churros. Favorite #5.

Manchego cheesecake - Not a favorite. The cheesecake was a little too overwhelming for me, but I found the caramel popcorn delightful.

With so many favorite dishes, I will definitely be back. Very soon.
author: Jessica W.

description:
I came here with a couple friends for a "tapas brunch." This place got so packed on Sunday around noon. Fortunately, my friend made a reservation so we were seated promptly as soon as everyone in the party arrived. 

My favorites here:
-Mar y montaña: Sea and mountain Ibérico lardo gently melted over sea urchin with lomo ibérico. This is my favorite!! I am a big fan of uni and the combination of the Iberico fat melting on the sea urchin is just so gooddddd.

-Gin & Tonic: this is easily the most beautiful and romantic Gin & Tonic with all the flowers they decorate it with. And it actually tastes good! It is on the mild side though, so for those of you who want a strong one, this might not be for you

-Jamón Ibérico de Bellota: this is similar to a charcuterie plate. It's a good one to order to share with more people. 

Since it's a tapas restaurant, the portion of each dish is definitely on a smaller side, so if you have a large party, make sure you adjust your order accordingly. We had a party of 6 so we had to order two to three of each to get a full tummy. When in doubt, you can ask your server. 

I will definitely come back to try the dinner or just drinks after work. This place is a great spot for first date since it's not too quiet/loud and you can stroll along the bay after an enjoyable meal ;)

Tips: Make a reservation and request a table outside so you can enjoy the bay view.
author: Kally C.

description: Great food for Spanish tapas. Service was alert and attentive. We luckily got in with a last minute reservation. We had the prawns which were cooked perfectly served with heads on! Uni toast was good, octopus was good, the paella was good, chicken meatballs was ok.
author: Lawrence R.

description: I ate here for lunch today and it was amazing. The atmosphere of the restaurant and the fact that it was right on the pier made it ideal. We ordered several tapas to share for our table of 2 as well as the pitcher of white sangria. The sangria was amazing and my favorite tapa was the deviled eggs with the sunny side in second place. It's a tad pricy but totally worth it.
author: Tricia G.

description:
Very lively !! Loved the mood over there.
Good and typical appetizers, better wines ( better than the food )
I think the beat here is the location, the staff that work here is  great, I would
Like to come back for drinks. With that said, would be nice if they were open until later at night .
author: Rocio S.

description:
I've had my eye on this restaurant for a while.  Finally made it here.

Like the feel of the inside of the restaurant.  Right on the water obviously, but the inside is nicely decorated.  High ceiling, comfortable and clean. Server was friendly, knowledgeable and efficient.

Here's the rundown:

SUNNY SIDE UP EGGS WITH CHORIZO, SHRIMP AND MORE - My favorite dish, although slightly over salted. Even with the saltiness, I liked it.  If I were the chef, I would serve this dish over some seriously crispy fried rice.  It needed more starch for balance.  Would have been perfect with crispy fried rice!  Inspired to do this at home! 

PORK SHOULDER - Served pretty rare for pork, even though I know pork can be eaten this way, still made me a little nervous.  But it was good, and I understand that many reviews think this is the bomb, but it just wasn't my thing.

ENGLISH PEA RISOTTO - Nicely done.  My wife and daughter said this was their favorite, calling it "light and refreshing".  I thought it was good too, but again, not GREAT.

WILD MUSHROOM SAUTEE - Wow.  This dish shouldn't be on the menu. Overcooked, over seasoned, over caramelized (slightly burnt).  Undersized portion.  I've done wild mushroom sautés at home that outshine this by a mile.  That's not good news for the chef in a Michael Chiardello restaurant.

CRISPY ROUND POTATOES - Nice idea.  Crispy round little potato bites.  Wish the sauce was something more.  It was neither here nor there.

GRILLED OCTOPUS - Decent, but nothing to ooh about.

KALE SALAD - Just OK, nothing special.

And that's pretty much the theme of this review...Just OK, nothing special.

I didn't LOVE any of these dishes.  In fact the only one I *might* order again is the SUNNY SIDE UP egg dish.  

In closing, I will say the cocktail (Gin and Tonic) was very good.  Really liked the look of that drink, with this floating flower in it.  Very cool.

I might come back to explore other things on the menu, but with a huge list of bookmarked restaurants, I don't think I'll be back.  But I would say you should try this place for yourself.  Who knows?  You might disagree with me and find it fabulous.  Stranger things have happened!
author: Darien R.

description:
What I love about Coqueta is the ambiance. You're on Embarcadero, interior is beautiful with a grand bar you can't miss. 

Favorite dish were the prawns. They wowed me and my friend (foody from NYC) in presentation, deliciousness and execution! The octopus was good and I would order it again.

Here is why it deserves a 3. We ordered the iberica pork- it was chewy and we sent it back- no apology, did not take off bill (regardless of the fact it was sent back untouched except two pieces). This should never happen especially at a restaurant with a chef whose name is this well known.

Deviled eggs were mediocre and would not order again.
author: Sarah K.

description: Thought this would be a great tapas restaurant I can visit often but it turned out to be the kind that serves overpriced small portion tapas.  I mean I know tapas is small but for the price, it appears more like mini-tapas.  Though tasty, I just can't justify the price I paid for the amount of food I got.  Service also was mediocre.  Two stars for the food quality.
author: Shirley H.

description: I have lived in SF almost my whole life and Coqueta is by far, one of, if not the best restaurant in the city. One of the main reasons is their bartender Louis, he is absolutely incredible! Certainly the most amazing and iconic drinks I've ever had in SF!
author: krista g.

description:
Love it. The gin and tonic was delish and so was the food.
Can't wait ti come back.
author: P D.

description:
Omg, this place is off the chains!!!


Fairly priced, delicious, orgasmic jamon iberico is a must have as well as the octupus.

They make a hellofa drink as well.

Thanx!!
author: Neil S.

description:
KenScale: 8.0/10

Coqueta is a Spanish restaurant from chef Michael Chiarello. Since its opening, it has been considered one of the best newcomers, with authentic Spanish cuisine that had North California touch. I went on a Sunday brunch and agree that Coqueta is a very solid restaurant.

Any meal at Coqueta should start with pintxos, or bite-size skewers with various ingredients. I sampled all of the pintxos available, and all of them were tasty with a variety of ingredients from chorizo to anchovie to quails egg to pepper. You could tell that the North California focus on freshness of ingredients is also reflected in each bite. I proceeded to order a couple of tapas. "Sunny side-up" huevo with shrimp, crispy potato and chorizo dressing was a delicious dish that could work pretty well for brunch as well. I wished duck and pork meatballs were slightly less sweet, but there was nothing wrong with the absolutely crispy yellow cauliflower steak a la plancha accompanied by coal roasted romesco sauce. For the main dish, I had to try paella (serving 2-3 persons) that came with a variety of seafood, chorizo and broccolini. I was a fan of the hearty dish, with fresh shrimp and clams going very well with the bomba rice in jamon Serrano-shellfish broth. For dessert, apple pie with blue cheese ice cream, despite its intriguing combination, somewhat felt flat, but I liked the skewer of manchego cheesecake with caramel popcorn.

The restaurant, located nearby Pier 5, is a perfect place for a brunch on a nice sunny day, with a casual dining area where you can look at the open kitchen in action while also enjoying the view of the bay. I don't know how crowded the restaurant gets during dinner time, but getting a reservation for brunch wasn't too difficult. The restaurant has a full bar menu, and for brunch a glass of sangria is probably the way to go. Coqueta is definitely a worth place visiting for a taste of Spanish cuisine in the Bay Area.
author: Ken S.

description: Amazing food. Amazing barça gin n tonic. I didn't know I loved gin until I had drinks here. Every dish is delish and requires a 2week plus ahead of time reservation
author: Natalia G.

description:
Made reservations here last minute.  I tried open table and it said there were no reservations left...decided to try and give them a call and luckily they had one for 9 pm.  It was later than we wanted but decided to stick it out.  We arrived quite early because we wanted to have some cocktails at the bar.  The gin and tonic was AMAZING!!!  I would get that again and again.  I typically do not like gin but this was delicious.  I have no idea what they put in their gin- flower oranges and some spices, but whatever it is it makes it amazing!!My husband tried a couple other cocktails all of which were yummy. 

Once we were finally seated I was kind of disappointed, we were sitting at bar stools in the smallest table possible.  I could understand if there were 2 of us, but there were 3 and it made it uncomfortable and the table had barley any room for anything.  We ordered ALOT of food.  I cant remember it all but heres some of the stand outs:

Salmon, honey, bread- Very tasty and a great way to start the meal.  The salmon is delicious and the cheese on the bread goes great with it.

Land and Sea- Sea urchin and ham...YUM!!! I really loved this dish, again quite small portion but a great way to start out a meal.

Chicken croquettes- Really delicious, I cant explain it, but somehow they make chicken amazing.  You only get a few in an order though.

Watermelon salad- this was quite a surprise, they put like a ham/bacon garnish on it that is totally out of this world!  I would get it again.

Octopus- least favorite dish of the night, very bland

Black garlic shrimp-2nd least favorite dish of the night...this was boring and kinda gross, the sauce on here was awful.

pork shoulder (main entrée)- AMAZING!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Best dish of the night and maybe the best pork of my life.  I mean this was soooooo delicious.  I could not even tell it was pork it was beautifully cooked and the sauce was out of this world.  If you take anything from my review GET THIS!

Blue cheese ice cream & apple pie dessert- oh man was this delicious!! Blue cheese ice cream may be my new favorite thing!!

We ordered a couple more dishes than that, but those were my favorite and least favorite.  I will be back to this place, although some dishes were total misses and our tables and chairs were uncomfortable some of the plates were out of this world and enough to get me to come back.  I look forward to trying some new items and getting that delicious pork shoulder again!
author: Kate F.

description: The waitstaff were prompt but somewhat rude. They abruptly answered that they are Spanish food in response to any question I asked. Meet and cheese tray way good but food was otherwise totally overhyped. PASS.
author: Adrianne W.

description: Love the food and drinks here!  Everything I've ever ordered here has been delicious.  They have a nice dining area but also a cute walk-in / bar area with outdoor seating as well.  Great place for happy hour / tapas but also a nice date night place.
author: Roberta V.

description:
Visited Coqueta for the first time today for lunch.  While it's not for everyone, the menu has a lot of interesting choices.  

The selection is off the beaten path with cold & hot tapas and unique Spanish fare.  If you're a picky eater, this place isn't for you.  

Very cool atmosphere with a lot of wood columns and a cool open kitchen/bar area.  Located at Pier 5 so you're in a cool area as well.  

Good service and a friendly staff.  

Mid-range pricing.  

It was a bit difficult to find the main entrance.  It's on the furthest left point of the Pier 5 building.  

Looks like a cool place for a Happy Hour.
author: Alanna R.

description: We were here for appetizers after an event and shared some small tapas - they were fantastic. One of the best tapas I've ever had.
author: Prescott B.

description:
Extremely unassuming from the outside.  Main dining room is just lovely w high ceilings.  Food portions were tapas and just right. We had the chef's selection of cheese and jamón serrano...delish. The tapas of trio de salchicas was just a tad bit too heavy..maybe cuz we ordered a tad bit much. Croqueta de pollo had the perfect crunch to it. The lubina ala brasa was perfect..with the right amount of presentation.  Arroz cremoso was awesome.
Overall,  dinner was at a slower pace..which I can't complain about since it was my BFF bday. 
Would I go again. .yes!! The service was top notch.  Drinks were delightful.  Price for two full meals... $$$. But worth it. Well done, Michael Chiarello group
author: Littleone P.

description: Pros: modern and lively ambience. Menu very unique twist on typical tapas. Location. Cons: service was spotty and selective. Recommend for groups, with lots of time to enjoy tapas.
author: Elizabeth N.

description: One of the best restaurants in SF. The ambiance is way cool and their drink menu is exceptional; hands down the gnarliest G&T I've ever had (I would have had 5 but I figured that wouldn't turn out well). The food is on-point, and it's a great place for both small or large groups.
author: Bradley C.

description: Nice place! Salmon with bread was really good, I like the service! pork with duck really good, I also ordered steak, just ok
author: Tony S.

description:
Hmmm..

Now, I'm not usually one to knock a free meal. And for the record, I'm not "knocking" Coqueta, I'm just knocking two stars off my initial review. The past two times I've gone have been extremely lackluster, so I'm beginning to think that maybe I'm doing it wrong?

Yet another company lunch from my loving and generous boss. Well, in fact, this was the third time she's treated us to Coqueta since my first review back in September. And I will also say that I'm not the only one from my team who thought things were not up to par, or at least not as good at the first time we went as a group. Something has definitely changed in the kitchen, and it's showing. 

Back to the matter at hand: I walked down to the restaurant around 1:30PM and my party was sitting at the middle long table in the main dining room. Our waitress was helpful and attentive, wishing me a happy birthday since my boss had told everyone of my upcoming day of birth. 

I had the Engine Co. #5 for my cocktail which was tart and strong, just how I like it. 

We ordered three of the *El Gran Plat Cap* (assorted meats / nuts / cheeses) - this is always a good choice as there's a lot of variety and it's cured meats and great cheeses, you can't eff this up


~Some of our Tapas~
 
*Pimientos de Padron* - a favorite and also difficult to eff up, roasted peppers with Jamon Serrano, sherry vinegar, and coarse sea salt

*Albondigas a la Feria* - meh, these duck / pork meatballs were super oniony, with crunchy onions inside and more caramelized on top. Also I got a tendon kind of texture that ruined the meatball for me, I took one bite and didn't have any more

*Patatas Bravas* - ugh, I was so disappointed in the little fried potatoes both last time and this time getting them. In September they were heavenly: light and crispy. But each time since then, they've been oily and dense

*Croquettes de Pollo* - another let down, and sadly so, as they were a favorite in the past. The filling of chicken and peas had a curdled texture and an overly oniony after taste and was not hot inside the breaded casings

*Salmon Ahumado* - little open-faced salmon sandwiches. Sooo fishy. And way too cheesy. The Queso Fresca was piled high and the salmon was slimy and gooey with truffle honey. The bread it was served on reminded me of an old toasted Bagel Bite and was a harsh pairing for the softer ingredients matched with it

We had other Tapas too, but they were nothing to say much about, good or bad.

~Our Entrées~

*Paella* - I was very excited to try this as it's a classic dish, and supposedly one of the star plates at Coqueta. Unfortunately it was not as good as it could have been, and I can honestly say that my friend's mother who has little cooking experience makes a better paella

*Pluma* - I thought this was a tender and delicious pork shoulder cut, I have no complaints about it

Most of our desserts were fine, my favorite is the mini churro with dipping chocolate and berry powder. I had a bite of the apple pie with blue cheese ice cream and was not enthused by the bitter, moldy taste. 

I hope we go again so Coqueta can get out of this slump and show us all that same great food we experienced just a few months ago.
author: Crystal C.

description:
Beautiful food; great ambience and beautiful restaurant. We sat at the counter facing the kitchen and saw all the great looking food being sent out. 

Already know that I want to go back and what I want to get. 

The bar stools are not comfortable however and when you make a reservation you could be seated at a table or kitchen counter. We were so enamored with the food coming out of the kitchen that we didn't move despite being offered a table midway through our meal. 

All in all a 5 star dinner.
author: Rohit R.

description: Amazing dry aged steak. Tapas are good. Paella used to be one of the best in the city, but recipe has changed. The chef decided to skimp on the saffron and overload it with tomato sauce. Don't get me wrong. The seafood topping is very good, but the paella is more about the rice than the topping. If you are looking for the best authentic paella, skip this place. If you want solid flavorful steak, definitely come here.
author: Helen L.

description:
AMAZING AMAZING AMAZING

Perfectly crafted tapas with wonderful flavors.  My favs were the "Sunny side-up" Huevo with shrimp, crispy potato and chorizo dressing and the PLUMA (Acorn fed Ibérico de bellota pork shoulder loin with honey-chili glaze).  The Pluma was unbelievable.

ORDER ONE OF EVERYTHING AND THANK ME LATER.
author: Josie A.

description:
4.5 Stars

3 hour dinner with friends = perfect Sunday 

We shared: Octopus, Potatoes, Meatballs, Warm Salad, Croquets, Brussel sprouts, Pork Shoulder, and the most amazing desserts and cocktails. 

I cannot wait to return!
author: Darin E.

description:
Best margarita in my life!  If I lived in the city I'd be there every day!
Food is outstanding, inventive, delicious.
Michael Chiarello definitely earned his praise.
author: Laura B.

description: We visited this place as a part of our 1st wedding anniversary special. They were very kind to give us the cheesecake dessert on the house. The food was lovely. Our dinner comprised only of vegetarian meals but it tasted really good. The options for vegetarian food is limited but very flavorful !!! The ambience is very lively and everyone is extremely attentive and helpful in suggesting the best dishes. We had a lovely experience and would surely recommend people to go here especially for their special occasions.
author: Ayushi P.

description: Maybe the best Spanish restaurant I've eaten at lately. Tapas were very good. The salami and the grilled octopus with fingerling potatoes. The tapas skewer tray was kind of unique but fun. About 5 different bite size tapas on skewers and you pay by the skewer. Paella was excellent. Ate at Bellota a couple of weeks ago and thought this paella was far better much more authentic.  Good wine list. Will be going back.
author: Bob M.

description:
The hubby and I got late night reservations to Coqueta on a Sunday night. I've been wanting to eat here because the food selection reminded me of our honeymoon in Barcelona. A last minute reservation is hard to come by, so I definitely suggest reserving more than a week in a advance.

There really wasn't anything that disappointed us, overall the food, drink, atmosphere, service, were all fantastic; the hubby and I really enjoyed ourselves. If I were to be really picky, the only thing that would probably bother me is the size of the pintxos; they were much smaller than we were expecting for $2.50 each. They were more like a nibble than a bite. I'd also like to point out that don't expect authentic spanish tapas, the dishes were definitely elevated but nonetheless very delicious.

For a about $120 we actually ate A LOT of food!

WHAT WE DRANK:
Barca Gintonic
Glass of Red

WHAT WE ATE:
Boquerones (olives)
Pintxos: 1 Boquerones, 1 Cohrizo, 2 Huevos de Codorniz
Pan con Tomato (bread with tomato)
Huevos Nacional (deviled eggs)
Pimientos de Padron (roasted peppers topped with jamon)
Pulpo a la Parilla (grilled octopus with potatos)
Trio de Salchichas (grilled sausages)
Verduras a la Catalana (greens with raisins and pine nuts)

DESSERT:
Manchego Cheesecake dessert bites

So we started off with with drinks! The Barca Gintonic was definitely the highlight, it was gorgeous! It's a must have when you go there!

The hubby's highlight were the roasted peppers, they had a lot of flavor especially with the slivers of jamon on top. The octopus was nice and soft and the grilled sausages were also very flavorful; I especially enjoyed the blood sausage. Believe it or not my most favorite thing to eat were the greens, they came in a nice bown and were bitter, yet sweet; they went well with everything.

Now, I'm a big coffee and dessert person but by the end of our meal we were the last ones in the restaurant and I could tell the staff were preparing to close. I got shy and didn't end up ordering dessert even though our server suggested we still could. The reason for the five stars is that she ended up bringing us dessert anyway which were the cheesecake bites! I was so delighted that I got my little dessert at the end of the meal; for free! HUGE thank you to our waitress for that!

Again, a solid great place to eat with a menu I honestly haven't experienced anywhere in the bay area. The atmosphere was eclectic and the energy was great! I'll definitely be heading back to try their bigger plates, dessert and the uni open sandwich that they were out of by the end of the night!
author: April B.

description:
Have you ever looked at a puddle in the street where you can't see the bottom?  You assume it's not a big deal, so you cross the street and you get a big surprise.

It's a big pot hole and your foot is wet up to past your ankle.

That's the feeling I got when a Tariff Gin Tonic was ordered for me.  I saw the fruity colors, I saw the garnish, I saw...well I saw that I was in for a "slam it down and order another" drink.  I was wrong...I fell into that pot hole and could not escape it.  Water for the rest of the evening for me.

The tapas concept is a great one; you order a lot of small plates and share.  My favorite was the Tortilla de Camaron, which is a chickpea flour pancake stuffed with pieces of shrimp.   I'll pass on the Arroz de Primavera, which I thought was supposed to be more paella and less risotto, but I was wrong.  Oh well...at least I didn't have to order another drink.

Great for people watching and daydreaming with the big bay windows.
author: Ron L.

description: The food was good, and the portions are small.  There was nothing I would return for and the service was severely lacking. There is no air con and I had to ask for water and ice 5 times throughout the night. There was a heat wave tonight and so should u not just bring the water? And ice? Is this too much to ask? And the waiter, Wes was grumpy and impersonable.  He did not earn 15% tip but he had to tip out the busboys so we paid it.   If you want to go some where and over pay for good food with small portions in a noisy place with bad service this is it. This was a birthday dinner we could have spent elsewhere.  The service is better at macdonalds .
author: Joice T.

description:
My friend, D, is tenacious.  She's charged with making reservations for an annual birthday dinner for four and once location has been decided upon she's on it like a pit bull on a turkey leg.  For dinner at Coqueta she was up at the crack of dawn to be the first to secure reservations the moment they supposedly became available.  And then.  Well.  Things didn't go as planned.  Despite more than adequate prep work, D found that there were no reservations to be had and I'm understating it when I say that she had a problem with that.  

Being resourceful and forceful D called Coqueta directly to lodge her complaint.  When a restaurant says that reservations open for a particular date on a particular date and you phone the moment those reservations supposedly open up there oughta be some reservations available.  That's essentially what she told the hostess then the manager then, I don't know, Michael Chiarello?  Anyhow, she made her point: she'd played by the rules, they had not, and we got our Saturday evening reservations for 4 as we should have without having had to take extraordinary steps.  

Some might assume that such a tactic would result in a stink-eye greeting and food that's been sauced by generally inedible bodily fluids.  As far as I could discern, this didn't happen.  When we walked in the hostess greeted us with such cordial familiarity that I turned to D and asked "Do you know her?".  It was truly a GREETING.  Maybe word had gotten out not to mess with this party or maybe this hostess is always this enthusiastic.  Whatever; it was wonderful. 

Michael Chiarello restaurants are always beautiful.  It's a given.  Sometimes I've not cared as much for the food as I do for the interior (Tra Vigne), but such wasn't the case at Coqueta.  The menu was as gorgeous as the decor which was ridiculously special.  The illuminated Bay Bridge sits outside the windows, bone-in jamon sits drying on countertops (ala Barcelona), and the place just zings with energy.  Patrons here are having fun.  You can feel it in the electric air.  

Our beautiful server reminded me of Project Runway winner Anya Ayoung Chee in both voice and looks.  It turns out she was from Mexico, not Trinidad, but was no less lovely as a result.  Her service was gracious and professional and helpful and warm.  What a special place.

Coqueta has the type of interesting menu that makes me eager to try as many offerings as possible, making it an especially excellent place to come with a small group of people who don't mind sharing.  We'd brought our own wine (which our server helpfully decanted), but that didn't keep us from beginning with cocktails as this is something in which Coqueta specializes.  Four uniquely different offerings were chosen, all epically named, and passed around like appetizers for each of us to sample from.  Don't miss the cocktails here.

We moved onto a wide assortment of menu offerings including a variety of "bite-sized skewers", cold tapas, hot tapas, sliced cured meats, Iberian cheeses, and a shared paella which was the best I've ever sampled.  We had studied Michael Bauer's review in advance of our meal and ordered well, based on many of his recommendations, even avoiding the open-faced sandwiches which he'd not found too special.  

We closed out with a variety of desserts including the crazily creative "gazpacho" which sent dry ice skirting across the table.  A wow-moment indeed, and a creative and fun way to close out a perfect meal.  

Despite a dubious reservation experience, I found Coqueta to be first class from the moment I walked in until the moment I left.  There aren't a whole lot of high-end restaurants that I'm eager to go back to.  Coqueta is one I'd return to in an instant.  Here's hoping I can land a reservation.
author: Tracey A.

description:
Came last night for a dinner date with my girlfriend around 6pm. We didn't have reservations so we were directed to the bar area which was moderately full. After finding seats, I decided to talk to the hostess about a table in the dining room and to my surprise they were able to give us a table! 

All of our dishes were tasty and nicely presented, but the highlights were:
Salmon Ahumado - salmon was soft and smoky. That with honey and cheese was so savory.
Sunny side-up Huevo - mix the egg, shrimp, and potato crisps together for a delicious hash-like salad.
Pulpo a la Parilla - never had octopus this soft! Nice kick to it.
Croquetas de Pollo - well made, softness was just right.

Definitely try one of the gin and tonics! They are so refreshing and aromatic you'll want to keep your nose over the glass the entire night.

The decor reminds of a cross between Napa and a lodge because of the wood accents and high ceilings. One drawback was seeing the shadows of the gnats/flies hovering above our table. Also, one of the wine bottles being used as a centerpiece had some tagging on it... wasn't tasteful to see that. Friendly staff and our server was nice and attentive. Yes, this place is on the pricier side, but considering the location and quality, it was a satisfying experience.
author: Josh L.

description:
The food and drinks here are extremely good but comes in anorexic portions that costs about an arm and a leg. And with any tapas restaurant, you will leave either hungry or just perfectly content. But I assure you that you will not leave feeling overly full -- and if you do, your wallet will feel empty.

I came here for a large group dinner (~12 people) and we got to sit in the bar w/ the nice big open windows. I think it should be noted that this place is extremely cramped, bordering claustrophobia! The main restaurant is not much bigger, but at least it has high ceilings.

So the picture I am describing is not really an exciting one: small portions, big prices, cramped space-- so why would anyone want to eat here?! Because the food is really really good. And that is why Coqueta is one of the most the most sought after restaurant in SF.

This is one place you should NOT come hungry or you will literally PAY for it. ;)
author: Stephanie B.

description: So fun -- highly recommend for dinner with friends, as long as you don't mind a busy, bustling spot!  The tapas as soooo good, makes me yearn for Barcelona!  mmmmm  I've had many, but I'm not a meat eater so can only say that the vegee and seafood/fish plates didn't disappoint.  Service is excellent, not too pushy, aware of you, your water, your wine, etc.  I also have serious food allergies and they took them seriously.  I'm a fan, yep!
author: Katherine E.

description:
I've been here twice now and first time was better than the second.

Second time we came service was not so great, granted our waitress was pregnant, but I think the restaurant may have given her too many tables to handle =(. Having to wave your waiter(waitress) down everytime you need or want something probably means service can use improving.

Now let's go through the dishes - 

1. Kale salad: First time I had it, it was DELICIOUS.  I loved the different textures of kale especially the crispy pieces (kind of like a seawead crunchy texture). Second time, it was okay.  There were only maybe two pieces of the crispy textured kale, then for some odd reason some of the fruit seasoning paste was stuck to the bottom of the bowl.  I think they may have tossed the salad (haha) incorrectly.  Kind of a bummer because we didn't get the full effect of the salad untilt he end.  Overall there's a pretty tart taste to this salad, so something to keep in mind.

2. Chicken Coqueta: YUM! I looveeed this dish. It's very delicious and I would highly recommend it.

3. The meat dish with the sunny side egg on top (forgot the name): This is tasty too.  I liked this one, BUT it's quite oily. 

4. Churros: OVERRATED.  The churros are deep fried with not enough sugar to cover it so it literally tastes like a bland deep friend batter.  The two sauces it comes with .. really? I don't get it.  One is a coffee/chocolate sauce - more bitter than sweet I would sad.  The other is a pink powdered VERY tart textured dipping thing lol.  I didn't like either =(

Pros of the place - there is some outdoor seating, it's right at the water which is nice.
author: Jess T.

description:
Our group had dinner here tonight - walked in without a reservation, so we couldn't get a table in the main dining room, but did manage to snag nice seats at the bar. Ambience was nice, and service was decent. Food was satisfying as a whole, but some dishes didn't seem worth the price. The bill came up to $132 excluding tip for 3 people, so it was pretty pricey.

We got: 

- Pulpo a la Parilla Wood-grilled octopus, fingerling potato and pimentón olive oil $14 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/coqueta-san-francisco?select=6Rvy0egPa9cf1ZgLKAv_Sg#8eGuADk5bTmwkGmZPdfe0Q): Best hot tapas amongst our dishes, in my opinion. The octopus was tender and really meaty. Highly recommend!

- "Sunny side-up" Huevo With Shrimp, crispy potato and chorizo dressing $13 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/coqueta-san-francisco?select=6Rvy0egPa9cf1ZgLKAv_Sg#6Rvy0egPa9cf1ZgLKAv_Sg): This was really tasty, but really greasy too. Would have preferred this with less oil

- Gambas al Negro Olive oil poached head-on gulf prawns with black garlic and chili sauce $14 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/coqueta-san-francisco?select=6Rvy0egPa9cf1ZgLKAv_Sg#6V__x7cx8nQ-UbqvZla7qA): We'd had higher expectations of this.. especially with the $14 price tag

- Paella $45 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/coqueta-san-francisco?select=6Rvy0egPa9cf1ZgLKAv_Sg#MrtYnhuyXYQ49fHUcXH5Zg): This serves 2-3 people. I'm usually not a fan of paella, but I really enjoyed Coqueta's rendition. The aioli went perfectly with the rice, and the seafood was juicy. Loved the colors that the chorizo and broccolini provided too. Highly recommend!

- Albondigas a la Feria - duck and pork meatballs $14 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/coqueta-san-francisco?select=6Rvy0egPa9cf1ZgLKAv_Sg#01ItbfKs8KOnBCq4nKVSOQ): This was pretty good, though at $14 for 3, it was pretty expensive..

- Churros $8 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/coqueta-san-francisco?select=6Rvy0egPa9cf1ZgLKAv_Sg#yi7IVv1W1apKs5aR_TlyUA): Freshly made, so they came warm and fluffy. Loved that the chocolate wasn't cloyingly sweet too. The berry powder on the side did make for an interesting touch.

- Warm Pimenton Chocolate Cake with tamarind crema and candied marcona almonds $10 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/coqueta-san-francisco?select=6Rvy0egPa9cf1ZgLKAv_Sg#zsV7zh_wm8bhjRoiddiPOw): Also made fresh, after a 20 min wait. Decent. It was molten inside.

Overall an enjoyable dinner, and good food on the whole, just not a place I would frequent because of the price. Good place for special occasions though!
author: Casatrina L.

description:
We had a reservation for 5 for a special occasion. It was our girlfriend's birthday and she was moving so we wanted to have a good experience. Let me first say that I have eaten at Coqueta several other times in the past and generally it was a nice time. Good food and service was fine. 
One of the girls arrived early and wanted to sample a few bottles of rose/sparkling wine before committing to a bottle. She tipped well and didn't intend for it to set a precedent but normally this naturally would. Below I will describe some of the bad service we experienced during our dinner.

-Once everyone had arrived and we were deciding what to order we asked for some help in recommending top items as the menu housed a lot of options. Our waiter was no help and said "everything is good". After someone else asked a third time he then pointed out a few things. 
-We asked to try the sangria because often it is on the sweeter side and he said no its not sugary. We asked again to sample so he said "fine" and brought it over. It in fact was way too sweet to we didn't order and he made a face.
-After ordering the payaya he said "okay but you can't order anything after that. It takes a long time to prepare and I have a party after yours I need to seat."
-We were chatting how some places in SF charge for every extra, such as chips and salsa. He chimed in on our convo and said yes you have to pay for bread here too.
-They brought a dessert and it had no candle so we asked another waiter if we could get one for the occasion and he left with the desert. Our waiter came back with it and said, no we don't have any candles. 

We still tipped because we aren't jerks even though our waiter was and he deserved nothing. I wish we had gotten his name but he was hispanic, shorter, has slick back longer hair and works Wednesday dinner shift in the dining room. We had a corner table at 5:30pm.

The food was not as great this time either so probably will not ever go back. Really upsetting.
author: Kristen N.

description:
Our bill came out to $150! Yup pretty expensive BUT well worth every penny!! I rarely come across a restaurant where I love every single dish. The Patatas Bravas  were made to perfection, El Plat Cap de Queso was the perfect mixture of cheeses, bread, nuts and so much more and the #1 to die for dish here is the Gambas Al Negro!! 

The signature drinks here are the Gintonics. They had such a variety of them! The Barca Gintonic was so refreshingly good here! Gintonic isn't one of my favorite alcohol beverages but because it was their specialty, I had to order one! And boy was I not disappointed!

The customer service here is beyond amazing!!!! Our waitress was well attentive to us even though the restaurant was crazy busy! She took the time to tell us the specials, her advice on how to order and advice on making reservations if we come for dinner in the future (which I will definitely be back for!). 

TIP#1: Order 2-3 Tapas plates per person

TIP#2: If you are planning to eat here for dinner, make reservations at least a month in advance.
author: Emily P.

description: Amazing experience!  Service was impeccable and the food was unbelievable.  I will definitely be coming back soon.
author: J d.

description:
This place is beautiful - right on the water with a glass greenhouse type of structure that houses the bar.  The drinks are creative and lovely, mainly focusing on tequila, gin, and sherry.  

We ordered two potato dishes and I much preferred the patatas bravas (smokey potatoes with garlic aioli and tomato sauce) to the patatas xips (house made potato chips with smokey paprika, manchego, and vinegar).

The chicken and pea croquettes were delicious - creamy on the inside, crispy fried on the outside, with a little piece of orange to brighten it up.  And so were the Albóndigas - duck and pork meatballs with tart cherry and tempranillo pureé and crispy shallots.

The sea and mountain open-faced sandwich (sea urchin and iberico ham) was just okay - the bread was too hard and the flavors were muddled.  I was expecting so much more.  The octopus was also just okay (I think Nostos has ruined me for life).  There was also a sunny side up egg that I don't remember much about.

We ordered one larger dish to to share - the iberico pork shoulder with chili-honey glaze.  This was very impressive - perfectly cooked, lots of flavor, it tasted more like a medium rare steak than pork.

Lovely, with unique drinks and yummy small bites - this is a perfect place for a group outing or girls night.
author: Sarah C.

description:
What an amazing location with amazing food. I still talk about my night out here. Sure it was another lifetime ago, with a companion that is history, but Coqueta will have to stay a part of my life! I'll definitely revisit to try the amazing tapas again that were recommended by my most amazing waitress. All paired off with an amazing choice of sangria and cocktails and I was hooked!

I'll definitely come back for just the bar experience if anything and would add Coqueta as a must visit dining experience in this amazing culinary city.
author: Joseph L.

description:
I've been to Coqueta twice now.  If I was writing this review based on the first visit, I'd give Coqueta 5 stars.  Unfortunately, the second visit wasn't as amazing.

The first visit...
We strolled in there w/no reservations around 1 PM on a wknd.  Of course we had to sit at the bar, even though there were open spots in the dining area.  OK, we get it, no reservations = no table.  Any who, we were lucky enough to snag seats at the bar, in front of the bartenders.  

Bartenders were super friendly and provided great suggestions.  Our meal consisted of:
*  RED SANGRIA :: 5/5 stars, 2nd best sangria I've had (next to julian serrano's)

*  BITE SIZE SKEWERS :: 3/5 stars, you only got one of each (3 total) and they were TINY!  the definitely succeeded in the bite size portion.  these are also given to VIP guests at no charge. IMHO, it should provided to all patrons as an amuse bouche.

*  PATATAS BRAVAS :: 5/5 stars, crispy on the outside, yummy on the inside and garlic alioli had so much flavor.  I wanted to lick it up!

*  SUNNY SIDE UP :: 5/5 party in my mouth flavor!  love the different textures and who doesn't love a perfectly cooked sunny side egg?  bartender prepared this for us.  some guest may think this dish is too salty, but it worked for me.

*  PLUMA (pork shoulder loin) :: 5/5 stars, loved loved this dish!  I think I had dreams about it for several nights afterwards.  Just the right amount of salt and cooked perfectly.  It was sooooo tender!  Can't remember what the little red spicy things were (they look like longer saffron strings), surprisingly they had decent flavor and spice kick.  Glaze was a bit sweet for me, so I didn't dip again.  I tried making a reservation for the following wknd, because of this dish.... but of course i got side tracked and didn't make the reservations.


Second trip to Coqueta
*  We had reservations = we had a table = yay
-  We had to share the table with this really pretentious couple = boo
order included:
*  RED SANGRIA :: 3/5 stars, this time there was a funky metallic taste to it, after we were done with the pitcher we ordered a bottle of wine (can't recall which one we ordered, it wasn't memorable enough to make an effort to remember)

*  ENSALADA DE KALE :: 3/5 stars, it was ok.  perhaps i was expecting too much?  my sister highly recommended it, telling me about how fresh it was and how it had crispy pieces of kale on top, etc... I didn't have any crispy kale, at least it wasn't crispy when it arrived at our table.  I also didn't prefer the cheese, too strong IMO for a salad

*  SUNNY SIDE UP :: 5/5 still a party in my mouth and still salty

*  PLUMA (pork shoulder loin) :: 3.5/5 stars, not even close to how good it was last time.  This time the pork was too sweet.  The waitress said they must have put too much sauce on it.  We didn't even pour any on!  Additionally, it seemed way too rare, which wasn't that big of a deal.  Pork was still tender though.

*  GAUCHO BISTEC :: 4/5 stars, good but not OMG great.  It did have a good char on it... something I miss from our cooking, since we're not allowed to have grill at our place.  sorry big green egg, you will be in use again some day! Menu states it serves 4 ppl, Coqueta does reserve smaller portions but quantities are limited, ask your server for availability 

service wasn't as good the second time around.

happy eating!
author: Tina F.

description:
Sexy Luis took great care of me at his bar. He knew the perfect recommendations for my late afternoon meal, and was quite the show behind the bar creating his craft cocktails. Beautiful views of the water and great Spanish tapas choices. Everything about this place was beautiful. 

Sit at his bar, ask for his #SexyLuis and enjoy the great atmosphere!
author: Clark D.

description:
I have mixed fillings about this restaurant... I've been waiting to go there for the longest time, finally, my friend and I made reservations (about 10 days prior to the actual visit). We arrived on time, and were escorted to the bar. I asked, why the bar, since we had a reservation made, and the hosted told us that since the reservation was made recently (again, 10 (ten!!!) days prior to the event), all of their tables were already reserved! 
We started with a cocktail (gin and peach with tonic) and a glass of wine. The drinks were wonderful, but this is where the "good part" ended...
Tapas: Shrimp - tasted too "fishy", octopus (too rubbery), chicken croquet (tasted like a fast food deep fried appetizer), mushrooms (was OK, nothing special, kind of fungy), cheese plate (seriously, for $16 3, only 3 kinds of cheese, totaling about 2 oz, and the cheese was nothing special as well), jamon and cheese screwer, bite size, which was ok, but you can barely see jamon in it, it was sliced way too thinly. Open face salmon sandwich was ok, and the eggplant and goat cheese tapas was ok, again very small portion, and the eggplant slice is too thin.
Overall, we had enough food for 2 people, but spending $180 (including tip) is way too much for food we did not enjoy.
author: Alla S.

description:
Like most places on the bay, you are definitely paying for the view/location. However, since it was cold and windy and we were outside we didn't really enjoy the location. 

Hubby and I only ordered two tapas and 2 drinks. Based on this, I would have to say the place is mediocre. 

Croqueta de pollo - had chicharones on the skin, couldn't tell. The filling was smooth but lackluster. 

Pulpo a la parilla was decent. The texture was a little too soft with no chew. The potatoes were bland. 

I won't be back.
author: Hae A.

description:
One of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco! I am obsessed. I have been missing tapas style dining ever since I came back from Spain and I finally found a restaurant that serves them.  Great spot to take visiting friends, going on dates, or catching up with co-workers, etc. 

Though pricey, they have a wide selection of dishes that are all meticulously put together and presented beautifully.  If you have eyes bigger than your stomach...but then your stomach is kind of small.... this place is perfect.  You get to try multiple dishes that are pretty small so that you can have a bite of each.  Its great for sampling a variety of things.  I suggest going with a lot of people so you can try more!  

We got the sunnyside up huevo, octopus, potatas bravas, churros and chocolate. 

Everything was good.  The churros and chocolate aren't as traditional as I would've wished.  The chocolate isn't thick or dark enough like it is in Spain....but its still yummy! 

Someone please help me find a cheaper tapas place.
author: Kristin C.

description: Really good food. But pricey!! For two people and only trying 4 dishes (that are small) it was $90 after tip. We also got two drinks that were pretty good (mojito and sangria). I would say the sangria is worth it because my friend got druunk off one drink. We got the meatballs, cauliflowers, wild mushroom plate and the sunny side egg dish. Side note about service: The server forgot about our mushrooms and was ready to clear our plates..so we got them pretty late and by that time the food started to settle. Food wise- Everything was really good but my favorite was the meatballs or egg dish! The server came by to give us some free skewers because our food was taking long to come out which was nice.. so we did get to try that. Would totally recommend the quail egg skewer or olive one!! Didn't think I would like it just based off of how it sounded, and even how it looked..but after I tried it I really enjoyed them!
author: Emily C.

description: Seriously overhyped! I'm an SF native and this tapas spot was super disappointing. They're in a prime location, but the food was not par for the course. On top of that, the hostess was rude upon check in. I made a reservation for my Mom and I a week before. When we arrived, she said I wasn't on the reservation list even after I showed her the confirmation email. She was able to seat us but tell us we only had an hour to eat because of other guests. It was obviously their mistake, but they didn't care. I will definitely not be returning nor will I ever recommend this place to friends and family. Over priced and very little portions.
author: Christabel M.

description: Giving this standby 5 stars simply because I always have a good time when I come here for post-work or post-run drinks with friends. The eats have never let me down, though I'd love to see more tapas options. The location can't be beat.
author: Kim S.

description:
Friendly service.  Interesting loft-looking space. 

Made for a lovely evening out with friends.  We really enjoyed the Gran Plat Cap (meat & cheese platter) for appetizer -- very nice selection of meats and cheeses.  Paella is one of the best I've had!  Octopus was very nicely done.  Food is creative and presentation is impeccable!

A few misses were: Patatas Bravas (basically just fresh made potato chips) and more controversially the Sangria & Jamon (watermelon salad).  It was absolutely beautiful and some dining companions loved it, but I felt it was just watermelon with some garnish.

The gin & tonic cocktails and sangria lean toward the medicinal flavor spectrum.  Pairs well with the food.  

Skipping the misses, Coqueta has a wonderfully warm ambiance and some wonderful food creations!
author: Kathryn C.

description:
I was very disappointed with my lunch here. I had heard good things from Coqueta, and it had 4 stars, but to be honest, I have had better spanish food in the worst tourist traps in Spain than here.

Chef Dominick Maietta clearly has no idea about spanish cuisine, and as a spaniard I found some of the food in this place culturally offensive.

I should have known better when I saw what they consider "paella". The moment you see chorizo as a paella ingredient you know that you are not in the right place, but in one of those that thinks that yellow rice with multiple meats and seafoods is paella. However, I thought that if I avoided the paella and just order tapas it would be ok. I was mistaken.

The pintxos are what I would call a scam. If chef Dominick Maietta has never tried them at least he could google them, and he would see that they are served over bread. $2.5 for a boiled quail egg and a piece of pepper without bread, is not just a scam, is simply disgusting. If he had ever visited a restaurant in Spain he would also know that the moment you sit down, there should be bread on the table.

The "house cured" serrano ham gives bad name to what serrano ham should be. It was really bland, with not enough taste and the texture was too soft. By the way, you do not put pepper on serrano ham.

One of the most surprising failures in the menu was the Pan con tomate. This is a traditional snack that even as a little children I could prepare by myself. You take a piece of bread, toast it, you rub half a tomato into it, add olive oil and salt, and you got it. Simple, cheap and delicious!... apparently even that is too complicated for the chef. His concept of pan con tomate is bringing a piece of toasted bread and a little bowl of what looks like a can tomato sauce.

The octopus was ok, slightly overcooked, and way too small for a $14 tapa, but given the previous failures I was happy to have something decent.

The bikini was good, again a bit too small, but tasty and warm. I did enjoy it while it lasted.

The sangria is decent, I like them a bit more juicy but it was good, and I recommend it given that this place does not seem to know what kalimotxo is. Again, if the chef has not tried it himself, at least he could google it.

The service was nice, and the building and decor are great.

I would have to get my spanish food fix somewhere else.
author: Pablo M.

description: This meal was amazing. Our waitress was attentive and the staff was helpful. Holy cow did the foot come out fast. Would recommend the Smoked Salmon open face sandwich, the papas bravas and the cheese platter. DELICIOUS. Stick to the smaller desserts and definitely order an espresso
author: Coley S.

description:
LOVE!  LOVE!  LOVE!  I wish I could afford to eat here all the time.  The food is so thoughtful and delicious.  The cocktails are beautiful, delicious, and innovative.  I was with one other person so we tried about 5 dishes - it would be fun to go with more people so you can taste lots of different dishes.  Every single dish was outstanding - do yourself a favor and treat yourself to Coqueta at least once!

Our waiter gave us the perfect amount of attentiveness - not so much that we wished he would go away but anytime we might need something - he was there.  The restaurant is small and they are always packed (It is a Michael Chiarello restaurant!).
author: Colleen L.

description:
After being turned away rudely by the host at La Mar down the road, we came over to Coqueta even though we didn't expect to get a table and have to wait till the 9pm reservation we literally just made on opentable as we walked over from La Mar.

But when we arrived we were promptly seated at the lovely bar overlooking their kitchen, my favorite type of seating whenever coming to an open kitchen type of place.

The ambience of the place is lovely, the hostess and all the server/bus staff were all very friendly and helpful.  Despite having to wait a bit for our initial food order and our 2nd round of drinks because of some sort of problem with their mixer, the way the staff handled themselves just made these little hiccups irrelevant.

The food was excellent over all.  The little skewers were lovely accompaniments to the cocktails (The Castro) we ordered.  The Castro was awesome, I finished my first one in no time at all.

We got the duck/pork meatball, the octopus and the brussel sprouts and they were all delicious.  At first I was a little hesitant about the duck/pork combination, but they worked great!  The octopus was definitely one of the better versions I have had, fork tender but not mushy, with just right amount of char that I love.

And those little open sandwich thing with Uni and lardo, oh my!

The only thing that wasn't as well executed was the Paella.  The rice was just slight bit under done than the way I like it and there was none of the crust I love.  But still it was very well seasoned and tasty.

Over all an excellent experience and highly recommend.
author: Yi S.

description: It's nice place with good ambiance. Their tapas cold and warm are good and well prepared but I'll never again order their paella. On their menu it says this dish is enough for 2 or 3. It's not. It's the size of a regular plate. Our paella was extremely salty and the only seafood in it consisted of some small clams and 4 shrimps. The worst paella I've ever had.
author: Faaro M.

description:
Finally got a chance to dine here. If you have had a challenge to get reservation, because they are always full, I will explain why. 

This place is AMAZING!!! Food, service and ambiance? Check, check, check....triple check;) Yep, it's on here! 

Okay let me walk through my dining experience. I came for lunch with a co-worker, and we wanted to discuss strategy outside of the office, and simply enjoy it. Oh my Yelp friends, we did exactly that.

We sat down and right away we were asked what we wanted to drink. If it wasn't for that fact I need to get back to the office later that day, I would have order one of their drinks. They all looked so intriguing and delicous. I will back to try those some time soon. I will side track for a second and talk about the bar, they have a really nice bar in the middle of the restaurant. Very welcoming bar and atmosphere. Love how it was central point, to give point of welcome for all! 

As for the food, we order the patatas bravas, wood grilled octopus, gelatin gazapacho and heirloom tomatoes. They were all devine, but the octopus was so delicous, perfectly grilled, and tender, loved it. Must try!

Then on to the dessert. We got the flan and the fruit gelato gapacho. Amazing. Getting those two and sharing were great combo. The flan was right amount of rich, and the fruit gazapacho was a great refreshing send off, especially how they presented the dessert (get it and you will see, I won't "spoil" it for you, lol!) 

If you read my other reviews, I don't usually go back to the same place, as there are so many great eats in SF....but oh yes, I will be back here. Yep, you heard me;) Now go enjoy this amazing place....oh, and yeah make sure you plan out a few weeks at least in advance to eat here, especially for dinner, their reservations fill up, and now you know why!
author: Sonia A.

description:
Love the dinning experience with my bff here.  Gin n tonic, OMG!

I just can't forget their gin n tonic.  The BEST!!!!!!!!  It has been a while since I dined there, and I was so impressed by their gin n tonic.  Of course, food was super delicious too!  Very unbeatable experience!  I will definitely come again!
author: Brandy C.

description: Had lunch here with family today. This is a tapas restaurant with an excellent ambience and fantastic menu. We enjoyed everything we tried. Hard to get a reservation though. So plan in advance!
author: Gretchen L.

description: One of my favorite dining experiences s in Napa so far has been michael chiarello's bottega so I definitely wanted to try coqueta. We made reservations for 4 on a Saturday night well over 3 weeks in advance. The restaurant is beautiful and sexy for a date night but also great for a fun group outing. We tried everything from the paella to the prawn dishes. Would definitely recommend especially with a small group so you can have a taste of everything!
author: Betty C.

description: Service is awfull for the price, takes hours to get anything even when half tables are empty.
author: Simon T.

description: Location is great.  Drinks and food are very overpriced though. Wine by the glass options are the most limited I have ever seen on a menu. We had the sunny side up huevo and it was good. Service was also a little slow. I probably would not return here.
author: Brenda M.

description:
I think I would've liked Coqueta for dinner. For lunch, though, it failed to wow. I'm a Michael Chiarello fan (yay Top Chef Masters!) so I was looking forward to finally trying this place. 

We sat in the patio/bar area. It took 40 minutes for food to arrive, and the waitress sent us a cheese plate to make up for it. It was a gesture I appreciated, but I definitely would far preferred getting my food in a timely manner.  

The chorizo sandwich had a great crunchy bread. Tasted like Acme. It was a bit too tomatoey for my liking. I wouldn't order that again. The patatas bravas were tasty and adorable - the sauce was neatly smeared on top of each individual potato bite. Not the best I've had but very solid. Lastly, the duck and pork meatballs had a nice balanced taste but the texture was akin to that of raw meat -- it didn't hold together and just sort of all fell apart. Not very appealing. 

I'll come back for dinner at some point and hopefully be able to bump up the stars.
author: Erika C.

description:
This place is super cute, right on the water, and delicious food.

Atmosphere: Such a great location, right on the water. The ambiance of the restaurant is really cool and trendy. It was SUPER crowded and hard to get a reservation, which you know means it's good! Went here on a date night and it was such a great date night place.

Wine: Their wine is pretty expensive. We picked a random Spanish red that was only $44 because that was my price range. It was pretty good, but not as deep as I usually like my reds. It was kind of light and spicy, but I still enjoyed it.

Food: We started with the sea urchin open faced sandwich (Mar y montaña, "sea and mountain" ). It was good, but honestly nothing special. It didn't have much of a flavor, and was $14, so I wouldn't order it again (3/5). Then we got the "Sunny side-up" Huevo which was AMAZING (5/5).
