The meatballs were the tastiest and moistest meatballs we've had. And the paella was well worth waiting 40 minutes for. We had the churros with Mexican chocolate and Manchego cheesecake bites. Perfect for the little amount of space left after a wonderful meal!
author: NJ A.

description: Great ambiance all around. Sit outside on a warm Sam Francisco night and enjoy craft cocktails and appetizers.
author: Shannon R.

description:
Warm, chic, "hearty" space (wood panels, nice fire for grilling, beautiful windows out to the bay). We sat at the chef's counter which was a fun experience (although we wanted to taste every single dish that was prepared in front of us). Will definitely be returning.

LOVED (in priority order):
- Sunny-side up egg (we DEVOURED this - perfect hangover food - but just hearty and delicious - do not miss this one!)
- Pluma (perfectly cooked, fantastic sea salt, amazing glaze - they'll give you extra glaze if you ask, a little on the expensive side per bite, but would definitely order again)
- Pan con Chocolate (olive oil + sea salt ice cream sandwich - unique and wonderful!)
- Ensalade Resorte (I don't know what made this particular cold appetizer so enjoyable, but I would definitely order it again - all the flavors came together well, and I especially loved the ham chip)

Liked, but may not order again:
- "Mar y Montana" open face uni sandwich (not a huge fan of uni, but this was good)
- Quail Egg Pintxos (the egg itself was good, but I wish there had been a bit more mustard seed and perhaps a touch of salt)
- Patatas Bravas (really tasty for tater tots - which I love - but that's what they are - wish there had been a little more ham)
- Arroz Cremosa (soup-y rice with scallops - the scallops were fantastic, but the sauce wasn't what I had hoped for)
- Asparagus (very well cooked, and the sangria aioli was tasty, but it wasn't as memorable as some of the other dishes)
- Manchego Cheesecake Pops (best combination of a cheese cart and dessert I've ever tried, very creamy, very strong flavor - but very strange after something else sweet)

Next time I really want to try:
- The chef's choice of cheese / charcuterie platter (it looked divine and quite filling)
- The open face smoked salmon sandwich (how could I have said no to truffle honey?)

The service was great and they were especially accommodating with our birthday party requests (they put together a beautiful display of the cupcakes we had brought on a platter).

Can't wait to return :)

*******
Returned on 7.21.2013:
- Open face smoked salmon sandwich with truffle honey is an ABSOLUTE MUST!
- Cheese / charcuterie platter is good, not as fantastic as Uva Enoteca, though
- Loved the churros (with the berry dust and the super creamy chocolate sauce)

I've attached a few pictures :)

Looking forward to my next visit!!
author: Helen D.

description:
I love Michael Chiarello's restaurant Bottega in Yountville, so I had really high expectations for Coqueta. 

We decided to come here on a whim, and called for a reservation an hour before arriving. Amazingly they had a table for 3 available. Score! However, when we got there, they seated us at a table with 2 other people. It would make sense if the restaurant was packed, but there were many empty tables all around us. 

The food was just okay. Their food is supposed to be a modern twist on Spanish tapas, but nothing tasted quite right. All the flavors were toned down, maybe to appeal to a wider audience? Not to mention that their portions were TINY. I know that tapas are supposed to be small, but these were literally bite-sized. The best dish that I had was their wood-fired octopus. 

I also ordered sangria, and it was very sour and cinnamon-y tasting. Bleh. The waitress said they are known for having great sangria, but I will politely disagree.

Skip this place, go to Bottega instead!
author: Diana C.

description:
For MONTHS I heard amazing things about Coqueta and desperately tried to get a decent reservation on a weekend night. The time finally came and I was beyond excited to check it out. 

Sadly, given the amount of praise I had heard and the wait time for prime reservations, it was one of the most underwhelming meals I've had in SF. 

Perhaps I don't know good Spanish food when it comes my way, but having visited Spain, I felt I had some base and was hard pressed to find something at the table that was mind-blowing.

Here's what we got:

-Patatas Xips - just okay. they will reco the vinegar sauce to top it, but the difference is incremental. 
-Huevos Nacional (deviled eggs) - these were by far the tastiest dinner dish we had. 
-Patatas Bravas - great presentation, but other than that, nothing special from past patatas bravas.
-Croquetas de Pollo - see patatas bravas.
-Pimientos de Padron - dislike. Literally sautéed peppers.
-Calamares a la Pancha - these were pretty tasty
-Pulpo a la Parilla - may have been good, but not a fan of the texture of octopus.

Beyond the mediocre dinner, the drinks and dessert were pretty amazing. Highly recommend the gin & tonic and manchego cheesecake. The service is also top notch.
author: Nadine H.

description: Visiting SF from out of town and saw the great reviews on Yelp. So glad we went! Everything was amazing. Definitely get the pork and the potatoes!!!
author: Katie B.

description:
My fiance and I grabbed a quick bite here, and either I ordered wrong, or this place sucks. I ordered the following, all of which ranged from bad to mediocre:

-Patatas Bravas (seriously, how do you mess up such a common Spanish dish?). These were super bland and not at all crispy.
-Verduras a la Catalana (undercooked)
Setas al Ajillo (way too salty)

It's also just straight up overpriced. 

Based on the other Yelp reviews, seems like this place is better for drinks?
author: Shreya O.

description:
The "bar" is actually a tented area with a circle bar table w about 20 bar stools. We walked in at 7 on Sat night and was able to grab two spots at the bar immediately. Cocktails are inventive, the food is excellent and well priced, and servers are great though a bit overwhelmed. 
Highly reommended:  gazpacho, fingerling potatoes
author: Tia G.

description: I thought this place was awesome. Cocktails are really good so try something unique. Food we terrific, Brussels sprouts, kale saled potato chips and piaella sooo good
author: Brad M.

description: Rude service. Over priced food. Very disappointing. Plenty of better, reasonably priced options nearby.
author: Brinda D.

description:
What more is there to say about Coqueta that many others have not said? Probably not much with so many who've already been raving about this place, but here's my two cents: 

I've been to Coqueta twice,lunch & dinner, and I have enjoyed both visits immensely.  Although the menus aren't different at either times, you'll find that the dishes are delicious whether the sun is up or down.

Coqueta is well known for their Gin Tonics, so I had to try the Barca Gin Tonic, and as pretty as it looked, it was just as tasty!  I've also had the chance to try the Kalimotxo, a Coca-cola Sangria mix, for the very first time, I'm so glad someone in the group suggested it - very interesting and very delicious!  And onto the main attraction, the food!  As Coqueta is a tapas restaurant, a majority of the food at the table will be shared.  Both times, we started out with the meats and & cheeses plate, never the wrong route to go down (unless you're lactose intolerant or vegetarian), and it was great, our server explained what was going on on our plate, but pretty sure no one remembered as we dug right into it - lots of delicious vvarities.  And after that starter, there was a blur of: octopus, razor clams, smoked salmon, duck & pork meatballs, chicken croquettes, "Brave Potatoes", and you get the picture... But the stand out dishes for me were definitely the wood-grilled octopus, smoked salmon with queso fresco & truffle honey, and the CHURROS. Goodness, do NOT forget the dessert here - both the churros and flan I had were incredible!

And the atmosphere here is great as well, whether at the tables or at the bar watching the magic happen.  Walking in, you'll see that Happy Hour is where it's at. Can't wait for my next visit! And for those large meat plates - watching them past by, that was my only regret about this place...
author: Cindy L.

description:
Currently my favorite restaurants, came back twice within a week and half.  The food is delicious!  Some portions are on the small side,  but this just means I can order a large variety of dishes! Highlights include:
-Mar y Montana: a must if you are an UNI lover
-Smoke Salmon with queso fresco & truffle honey
-Grilled Squid
-Grilled Octopus
-Manchego Cheesecake bites
-Churros
author: Lisa S.

description: Great Spanish Tapas restaurant with excellent service as well! We have the meat and cheese plate, the patatas bravas, the meatballs, the prawns, and paella. All were very good...flavorful and perfectly cooked. We finished off with the churros and machenga cheese cake pops. Great lunch and again worth mentioning that the hostess, server and all staff were excellent!
author: Jeff F.

description: We had a fantastic dinner here several weeks ago, prior to seeing The Book of Mormons. Everything was excellent & this place has a very friendly, fun vibe. Loved the Pluma Pork Shoulder Loin, the Jamon Iberico de Bellota & several other tapas, before our paella arrived. As a Spaniard, although very tasty, I was disappointed the only seafood in the paella were gulf shrimp & clams--should have Many other items. Highly recommend the delicious Manchego Cheesecake with Caramel Popcorn for dessert (think 2 very small cake pops). Just be aware, the portions are on the smaller side for the price. The dessert was 1 bite size of delicious decadence! I'll definitely return, especially since trying some very delicious items. You can't find the Bellota jamon at most places. Great wine list & cocktail choices.
author: Michelle M.

description:
You can't argue with the quality of the food. It's really top notch. The service was exceptional- friendly, patient and knowledgeable. 

What bothered me was what I will call the "preciousness" of the tapas. Yes, tapas are supposed to be small plates but this was more like dainty hors d'oeuvres on skewers.
I've been to Spain and one of the great things about the food is the heartiness of it.
That being said, I've also been to Valencia where paella was supposedly invented and Coqueta's was better than anything I had there.

My biggest qualm was with the nightclub atmosphere that is so prevalent in trendy restaurants now. You can't hear the music OR the people you are talking to. All you hear is bass and drums. I guess if you're out to party and yell a lot at your date this is a nice spot.
author: Sarah S.

description:
This used to be one of my absolute favorite restaurants in SF but it has gone downhill recently.

In the plus column are the meatballs and the salmon sandwiches. I also really enjoy the gin and tonics and cheese and meat plate.

The rest of the food lately has been hit or miss. The last two times I was there the toast was not well cooked and the vegetables luke warm. 

The service is extremely slow. At lunch last month we got our first two entrees in five minutes and then the rest came half an hour later after we asked for it.
author: Alissa D.

description: Best tapas in the city! Seriously, everything is so delicious. Special highlights for the pork shoulder entre and the smoked salmon open face sandwich. What a beautiful setting too! I'll go back in a heartbeat
author: Naomi L.

description:
Everything is delicious. So, so delicious. The deviled eggs were divine! We also had the shrimp and hashbrowns, so nicely crunchy and salty. 
The meatballs were just okay, a touch sweet for our liking... But we still ate them all, so there's that.
author: Margaret M.

description: Good food, but long wait, had reservation at 7pm, did not get seated until 7:45pm. It took a while to get food, very busy even on the weekdays .
author: Caroline C.

description: In a word Amazing!  You cannot go wrong with anything.  The creativity behind the drink menu was something I have never seen before.  Food was superb!
author: Jeff P.

description:
Had a great experience at a friend's dinner party here. We had a group of about six that had never eaten there before. So we ordered a little of what we knew and a few staff recommendations. The seafood paella was really flavorful and a lot of food. The patatas bravas were great, soft and crispy, especially with the side sauces; sunny side up huevo was really good chorizo and the ensalada de kale was delicious and helped to balance the other dishes. Good selection of white and red wine.

Really good service - the staff did a great job of being friendly, spending time to explain the menu and being attentive. Goes without saying that the setting and atmosphere is really nice, modern and cool. Price was expected for a nice dinner; we each paid around $60.
author: Anna L.

description:
If you're into spanish tapas, then you'll like Coqueta.  I wasn't blown away but I did have a very nice meal here.  We ordered the paella, a couple shrimp dishes, calamari, brussels sprouts and a salad.  It's quality delicious food.  I don't have any complaints.  The service was great, the host was very accommodating and the cocktails were fun.

If you haven't tried it and you're looking for something new, definitely go for it.
author: Becca L.

description:
I've only been able to get in for lunch, but what a meal! staff was super-accommodating of our request to sit outside with our dogs -- they're not just dog-friendly, they're Dog Lovers.

the sunny-side up egg was spectacular. we ordered bread just to scrape up every molecule of the chorizo oil at the bottom of the dish. must make room for the mar y montana, which, albeit tiny, is delicious. and I am so up to here with kale salad, but this version was quite good, although it perhaps suffers from one or 2 too many ingredients.

will definitely be back, if I can get a resi.
author: Sasha R.

description:
Really wanted to like this as I think Bottega is awesome, but felt our dinner was pretty flat and very expensive for that. Really 2.5 stars because the primavera rice was really good, though not particularly spanish.

Atmosphere/Service: Did not feel sophisticated. When the server started with "Welcome to Coqueta, we offer a Spanish menu..." we maybe should have know something was up, like this was going to be the TGI Friday's of something. Sitting at the bar facing the kitchen is great because you get to see the food come out. It loses some of that shine because the server always comes up from behind and startles you or has to reach around with dishes/flatware/water/etc. while the food comes from in front. Would be much better if there was just a server behind the bar taking orders, which might be a little tight but much better experience.

Food: The pintxos were good, but slicing manchego and chorizo for $2.50 each isn't a big accomplishment. The blue cow cheese was good. The salads we tried were very bland and I'm not sure I've seen a kale salad with strawberries and chunks of cheese masquerading as butter in spain before. Shrimp were a bit dry but ok, could use a little bit of sauce. As noted earlier the rice was good, with asparagus and peas, and again, more italian summer than spanish. The paella looked good but we were dissuaded by the 30-40 min wait.

Desserts looked great but the apple pie with blue cheese ice cream was a bit too much after the food we had.

Overall, maybe a bit too much anticipation based on past Bottega experiences but not in a real hurry to go back. The scene was a bit confusing between tourists clearly struggling to understand the menu and some bro-whatevers getting pretty drunk. Odd that many of the dishes didn't evoke much of Spain.
author: A K.

description:
This is my wife Tracey & mine favorite restaurant to stop by for lunch during our daughter Emma's afternoon stroller walks.

Two thumbs up for the deviled eggs, kale salad, patatas bravas, croquestas de pollo, and albondigas a la feria. 

Good service, nice ambiance, and we'll have to try this place for dinner when she gets a little older.
author: Francis M.

description:
I was a bit hesitant about going to a restaurant on the Embarcadero. Boy was I wrong. 

This place is perfect if you just want to go somewhere and eat a bunch of appetizers. For me, many times that's the best part of the menu anyway. 

Downside is that I went on a rainy day and as they are set away from the street, we got drenched. A breeze way or awning would have been nice. 

As this is a Chiarello restaurant you can expect great food and thoughtful presentation. 

Definitely will be back.
author: Kraygg Y.

description:
I have finally found my FAVORITE TAPAS place.
I love to share the dishes with my friends casually over a joyful conversation and some wine, and Tapas is my kind of food!

Coqueta is a FANTASTIC place for a group, girls night out and casual date. 
It has everything needed for those occasions.  Cool set up, great vibe, fabulous drinks and well balanced awesome food.
You must try fresh seafood dishes such as grilled octopus and Paella, and of course you cannot miss Jamón Ibérico de Bellota.
A wine person will definitely appreciate Coqueta especially since all the dishes go well with wine.

I am 100% sure you will have a wonderful time here!
author: Tomomi K.

description: This place was delicious. Got to celebrate a friend's birthday here and indulged on various dishes. Try everything! A bit pricey since as most tapas usually are, but the view is great, service was good and food was yum yum. Can't even pick a specific dish because everything was good. Refer to photo for ideas!
author: Becky C.

description: Bland sangria mixture with coke and a very dangerous, cracked, sharp instrument/pitcher was used to hold our sangria.  We ordered another glass of red wine to add some alcohol intensity since the sangria was just lacking in flavor.  We also got the Deviled eggs with bonito and there again nothing amazing about the mixture.  $80 later and just underwhelmed.  Also, this business had my photos taken down of the devilred eggs with bonito.  I guess the business realizes how bad the food looks too.
author: D B.

description: Excellent Paella, as good as the best ones that we had in Spain.  The coqueta chicken was also very good.  The only slight negative is that the food was overly salty.  Service was professional and courteous.
author: Eric T.

description:
All I can say about this place is... WOW!!
This is the first time I've ever gotten tapas and I was blown away by how delicious all the food was here. I was lucky enough to go with my boyfriend's family so we ordered a ton of dishes which I got to try.

Sangria - delicious, I'm not much of a wine connoisseur but it tasted so delicious! Everyone at my table also loved the sangria as well.
Salmon Ahumado - SO DELICIOUS! If you like smoked salmon, you have to order this! The portions are small, and almost bagel bite sized, but the smoked salmon went perfectly with the truffle honey and queso fresco flavors, my mouth is salivating just thinking about this.
Sunny side-up Huevo: ALSO AMAZING!! Delicious sunny side up egg cracked on top of these crispy crunchy things, with shrimp and chorizo dressing. It was very unique, I've never had anything like it. Presentationw as great as well!
Albondigas a la Feria - These were meatballs that came with a delicious sauce, everything had wonderful flavor and was cooked deliciously.
Trio de Salchichas - This was a trio of sausages, everything was really good and such an interesting experience getting to taste all the different flavors of these sausages, they all tasted really unique.
Paella - I've been dying to try paella and this was a great first experience! It takes them about 40 minutes to make it so if you want it make sure you order it in the beginning. The rice was delicious and they were very generous with the seafood, at this point everyone was so stuffed that we could only get through about half of it but it was still so amazing.

Overall, every dish was absolutely delicious. Although it was a bit pricey, and some people complain about the sizes but that's what tapas are - small dishes!
Fantastic service, fantastic food, great architecture and ambience, I cannot wait to get back to San Francisco and try this place again.
author: Karen C.

description: Nice--but pricey--tapas place at the Embarcadero. Had the sparkling lemonade (just right, with a sprig of rosemary, savory and crisp, not sweet or tart), an order of Serrano ham (medium quality, too lean, just ok), some deviled eggs (fish based filling, again just ok) some olives (mostly the blander varieties), roasted almonds, albondigas (a little bland) and greens a la Catalana (really nice, seasoned perfectly). Apple tarts with blue cheese ice cream (meh) for dessert. The food mostly lacked flavor. The venue, vibe, and. Staff were friendly and relaxed. Wasn't worth $75 for dinner... Would probably try another option next time I'm in town.
author: Andrew W.

description: Took my daughters to Coquetta Friday night before  show at golden gate theatre.  We had a terrific server who knew we had 2 hours to dine.  He made excellent recommendations starting with the charcuterie platter and following through on the small plates and delicious desserts - don't forget the out of this world gin drinks!  I am not a gin drinker ever but the Galleon has won my heart - you've got to order this!  From the croquettes to the squid to the meatballs to the egg and crispy noodle dish - oh my gosh out of this world!  We finished off with the sorbet and of course the churro - also a must have!  This dinner wasn't cheap but the over the top service and the quality of our meal made for a great dining experience.  I will be back - soon!
author: Sue R.

description:
2 stars for the sole reason that the drinks they serve are perfectly made. I walked im here after I decided to treat myself to a delicious cocktail after a long week at work and law school applications. I ordered the pan con tomate with the jamón serrano on the side and I was not disappointed. The serving sizes are small but I'm not shocked given the food scene in my home town. I sat at the first come, first serve area under the canopy and I can honestly say that I would have ordered 4 more drinks had I felt more valued as a client. I was checked on one time by my server and a few times by another person refilling water in the hour and a half time I was there. This was a major bummer because I really wanted to like this place. I meet with a number of clients from out of town and I would have happily recommended this place if I had had a better experience. I guess I'll recommend Coqueta but with a fair warning about the service. I have no issue paying premium price for a product when the service matches it's expectation but this was definitely not the case. I hate to think this was the case because I am Latina and it may be assumed that my voice does not matter but if this is the case then maybe employees need some additional training on diversity and fair treatment. That type of mindset isn't cool and it especially doesnt have a place in a city as diverse as San Francisco.

The ONLY reason I would come back is because Sexy Luis came up to me and checked in with me. Another gentleman also checked in with me, his name is Marcos. Luis is a bartender and yet he left his position after noticing me and asking me how I was feeling and how my experience had been thus far. He has such a positive energy to him that totally rubbed off and pulled me to the bar. I had been waiting on my boyfriend to finish up meeting with a client and I asked him to meet up with me here. I want nothing to do with my server, who happens to be Latina (my peeps, wtf?) but I will happily come back to see and be served by Luis. He is attentive, high energy, and funny. I don't know much about the business but I am certain he is a major reason why the business has loyal clients. Gracias Luis.
author: Astrid C.

description: Nice atmosphere, the decor is killer. It's also a nice perk being along the water. The food is delicious with lots of flavor. Plates are very small, if you are starving this is not the place.
author: Terese O.

description:
In response to Kris S. from Watsonville...

I took my fit, sexy lady here for drinks on date night. The portion sizes of the drinks were perfect. Got her nice and drunk. Then I took her home for some sweet love-making.

Nice location. Perfect for an after-dinner/drinks walk along the embarcadero. Decent view of the bay and bay bridge. Nice decor.

Someday I will eat here. And then I will be back with another review.

Thank you and good day. #tipsthecapandwalksout
author: Barry B.

description: Where do I start,... so on a Friday night my husband  made dinner reservations for us and as hard as we tried to make our 5:15 time slot, we missed it due to heavy traffic. We arrived at 5:45 and were immediately able to be seated at the bar, which is our favorite place because we get to overlook everything in the kitchen. We immediately noticed a happy, efficient kitchen crew and were greeted by our knowledgeable waitress. We were all to happy to admit we knew absolutely nothing about tapas and needed her assistance. She was very helpful in making drink recommendations that were deliciously smooth and paired well with our meal. The head Chef was all too eager to introduce himself to us and sent us a few items on the house to ensure we had an excellent Coqueta dining experience! We started off with the large cheese board and loved the salted smoked meets as well as their yummy house made jams that made everything pop in your mouth. We also had the crispy kale salad, which will make you dream of this yumminess for days. It's not just any Kale salad! We had the roasted potato aioli and the Paella. Their paella is spot on with the creamy clams & mouth watering prawns! Everything tastes so fresh and nothing overpowered each other in this signature dish. Of course we had desert and we asked our waitress to surprise us! She brought out the most delicious ginger cake that was plated with a huckleberry sauce and topped with a vanilla ice cream. Soooooo gooood! We loved our dining experience and so appreciate the friendly staff that talks with you! Thank you Coqueta for a memorable experience! We look forward to visiting again soon
author: Amy F.

description:
We are big fans of Michael Chiarello (Tre Vigne in St Helena still serves many of the dishes he put together years ago, and Bottega is easily one of our fav restaurants in Yountville). When we heard he's opening a Spanish restaurant we knew we had to try it.

It is unfortunate that there's a dearth of good tapas restaurants in N California. Thank you Michael for opening Coqueta! The restaurant offers what I would consider "nouvelle tapas" - with its non-traditional menu items. We love the chef's inventiveness - the sunny-side up huevo seems so simple but the execution and taste were impeccable (let the waiter mix it for you at the table). Anything with padron peppers - when they are in season - is delicious. I think the wood-grilled octopus has become a signature dish as I now see it on the menu everytime.

The first few times we ate at Coqueta we were so enamored by their cocktails we completely overlooked their wines. Big mistake! They carry many unique wines - I don't know much about Spanish reds but our waiter expertly guided us through the selections.

The service is always quick and efficient. On the weekends when the place is super busy we bypass the crowd by coming in for a late lunch.
author: Patrick W.

description:
Everything is absolutely delicious! 
So delicious that we ordered too much and paid way too much too haha but it's definitely worth it!
I was with a friend and we got very lucky to wait only 10 min before finding a place outside, on one of those rare sunny warm day of a summer in San Francisco :)
author: Carole P.

description: Loved it. Fabulous food, fabulous wine list. The paella was delicious and interior is beautiful.
author: l c.

description: this is our first  time !  the onbionce was really great very hip! drinks were good and balance. the food was great! the only thing that bother me was the service and how we were handled!   our waiter michael!!! i found him to be very rude with a soft voice. so we are in the process of ordering our food and we placed our order " his comment was did you eat before coming" as if our order 1. was not a large amount $$$$. or 2. we were to fat we felt very offend..... it seem to me that the large the order the  bigger $$$ gradatuite.  and to top it all of the server who brought the food explained everything about the food to us. which michael the waiter could not when we placed the order....how rude......
author: Laura G.

description: Great location, ambiance, food and craft cocktails. Make reservations as it will fill up fast.
author: John G.

description:
Nestled on the northern end of Pier 5, Coqueta--Chef Michael Chiarello's latest Bay Area endeavor--sits on the waterfront with a modern rustic charm that's both inviting and new world fresh. You enter the restaurant through the bar where you can check in with the host and grab a drink if you'd like.

I enjoyed the most beautiful gin and tonic I've ever had. It's called the Barça Gintonic which is Bloom London Dry Gin, Fever Tree Tonic and a wedge of grapefruit. Served in a large stemless wine glass it's stunning to look at, and I found myself staring at its beauty with each sip.

There was a private event in the bar that night, and they asked everyone waiting to be seated to "stay out," which was hard to do with trays heaping with cheese and prosciutto flew past us hungry guests writhing with anticipation. It was painful to say the least, but all was forgotten once seated.

We'd been hearing only good things about the food at Coqueta, all of which is a subtle twist on traditional Spanish cuisine. Staying true to flavors of Spain, Coqueta brings a San Francisco locavore's breath of fresh air into the true flavors of Iberian cuisine, all within a restaurant that feels like a giant jewel box of floor-to-ceiling windows, thick wood support beams, and hearty cast iron accents, fixtures, moldings, nuts, and bolts. 

My only complaint is with the service. It was non-existent at times, and our waiter didn't seem to know the menu as well as he should for the caliber experience the price-point and media blitz eluded us to. Come to think of it, the entire restaurant staff's timing felt off that night, but I'm assuming it was all just "new restaurant kinks" that have been ironed out by now.

you can see photos of all the food we ordered on our food and travel website at the following URL:

http://eatsporkjew.com/restaurants/coqueta-san-francisco-hoa/
author: Philip H.

description: We've been to coqueta for multiple times. Five star for their food and presentation, however, this time they made us wait for almost 50 min.... their Bikini brioche is our favorite. cheese cake lolly pop never disappoints us.
author: Fay F.

description:
I came here months ago and didn't realize I never wrote a review. Make sure you make reservations because this place gets packed fast. Even though I had a reservation, they put me at the bar top. Those stools are so uncomfortable and there is no backing. I am only 5 feet and those stools were way too tall. I asked to have a table instead and good thing they were willing to accommodate. Make sure you get a table. 

The food was delicious!!! I love all of Michael Chiarello's restaurants.

El Gran Plat Cap" Chef's Grand Selection of cured meats and cheeses-really good meats and the cheeses went well with it

Skewers-Chorizo, roasted artichokes, and piquillo peppers and Jamón Serrano, Manchego, and apricot-sherry conserva-as if we didn't have enough meat already, but this was just as good

Sunny side-up egg with shrimp, crispy potato, and chorizo dressing-my favorite dish of the night. Super yummy.

Grilled razor clams with salsa verde and meyer lemon-need I say more? Drool!!!

Paella the classic, made with bomba rice, jamónserrano-shellfish broth, caramelized rootvegetables,chorizo, gulf prawns, clams,and lemon alioli-not a huge fan of paella because most places don't make it that great. There's always something missing. However, this was one of my favorite paellas so far. They do not skimp on the seafood. The shrimp and clams are huge. I love that they give you a side of peppers and alioli to add to it and it makes the paella that much more flavorful. It's huge and heats up well for leftovers. 

Would love to come back and try more!
author: Karen H.

description: This is our favorite tapas place in the city! We love taking friends and family here. The food is delightful and every single dish we have had has been wonderful every time. The only drawback is that it is so popular, it is often difficult to get a reservation. However, they do have walk-in service in the bar area if you don't mind waiting a bit.
author: Rosa V.

description: Drink is good. But service sucks. Interior looks super nice. We seated outside but no one comes. My server is Asian woman. What was bad is her work is little bit unprofessional. She didn't bring what we orders. But drink and food are good.
author: Takuya N.

description: The restaurant itself has a very cute ambiance and is in an awesome location. The food/wine is decent but definitely overpriced. My main reason for the 2 stars was the service - I made reservations for 2 at 8 PM, and upon arrival, was told that I would actually have to wait a long time for a table and could sit at the bar instead. Excuse me? I made a reservation for a reason. There was an available 3 person table that was empty for a while, but they refused to seat us there because "that's only for 3 people, not 2". SO ridiculous. I won't be returning. There's much better food/service/prices elsewhere.
author: Snigdha G.

description:
What a great restaurant. Love the food, the place and the service (except the flies when you come in but nothing you can do, these flies are so hard to get rid off).

We were a group of 6 people for lunch and we had a great time. We had the Calamari, the octopus, the duck and pork balls, gambas, cheese and charcuterie plate...
Everything is meant to be shared and it was so delicious. The only thing was the gambas were too salty.

The service was great from the hostess to our server Allison to the manager (who speaks French). They make you feel welcome. The busboys were very kind too. 

The restaurant is beautiful and by the water. The design and the open kitchen is great. 

I will be back and I believe this is a great spot to bring people from out of town.

PS: one thing that was weird is that they charged 1 dollar for extra grilled bread. For a spanish restaurant bread is part of the culture, don't be cheap by charging a dollar.
author: G R.

description: On a typical San Francisco foggy day, this is a great place to grab a bar stool and dine on tapas with friend. The atmosphere is cozy and dark inside with a wood fired oven (there is also protected outside dining for prettier days) and the food was fun and inventive. Our tapas were very good (although the last time I was at Bottega the food was simply excellent, so I suppose on the day I visited it wasn't quite up to other examples of Michael Chiarello's food but I enjoyed it and would still recommend it). Its location just down the street from the Ferry Building and the Exploratorium makes it great place to stop for a bite if you're ambling around the waterfront taking in the pleasures of beautiful San Francisco.
author: BettyLou H.

description:
I've been to chef Chiarello's restaurant in Yountville, Bottega numerous times; it is actually my family's go to restaurant every time we visit Napa. Seeing as we always enjoy ourselves at Bottega I couldn't wait to try out Coqueta! And it being his take on tapas was a major plus as I've been to Spain and absolutely adore Spanish cuisine. My friend was leaving for Cabo that weekend so we decided to have lunch before she left. I made reservations for 3 through opentable for a late lunch at 2:00pm on Friday the 28th of February. 
We arrived just before 2 and stood around awkwardly for about 4 minutes. We didn't know if we should ask the at least 4 people who walked by if there was anyone who could seat us. I understand it's not a server's job to seat customers but it would have been nice if one of them would have let someone know there were people waiting in the front. At last, a man came and uninvitingly asked if he could help I said yes I had reservations. He immediately found my name on his computer and I confirmed that was us. He told us he'd check if our table was set up yet. We waited a while longer and we're then lead to a table and given menus. Now comes the most uncomfortable part. We sat there for about 8 mins without ANYONE coming to our table to greet us, ask if we had questions, wanted anything to drink and I kept track because it just got plain old ridiculous. We all sat there in amazement as servers, hosts, and MANAGERS walked past us and just had to laugh because what else can you really do without getting angry and ruining what was supposed to be a great lunch with friends. I understand we look young and we are but really, is it acceptable for a restaurant of such stature to be treating customers like this? There was a server who was helping a table RIGHT next to us (the tables are very close together so its not like he didn't see us) and he wouldn't even look at us as he brought out a plate for his table, came back to take their dessert order, AND bring them a to go box. Now I've worked at a restaurant before and usually everyone helps each other out. If a server doesn't realize they've got a new table or forgets about a table another will help them out and at least let them know. A runner came over and peered into my glass, seeing that it was empty he asks confused if I wanted water. Oh finally someone realizes we exist! Yes, thank you. Some time later our waitress (Sara G., I only know because it says on my receipt) arrives and doesn't even apologize, which is fine, it wasn't like she was helping the table to our left, the whole time or anything! She asks if we've ever been here before and we all say no and she starts to explain to us what tapas is and by this point my friend is very annoyed and was like why is she talking to us like that, acting like we don't know what tapas is! She was very unenthusiastic and you could tell she wasn't thrilled she had us as a table. Anyways we ordered the jamón serrano and manchego skewers, roasted Padron peppers, calamari, wood-grilled octopus and the chorizo sandwiches as well as the Castro and another cocktail with cava in it to drink. Standouts were the calamari and octopus. My bf never eats seafood but we convinced him to try the octopus and he was shocked at how good it was . Everything else was alright. My friend liked her drink and mine was fine but I had seen pictures of it before on yelp served with a skewer of colorful fruit but it arrived with a limp carrot slice in it which visually was unappetizing (honestly, we all laughed at how gross it looked). My friend ordered the croquetas because she saw the group next to us get them and had to have them. She didn't know what they were called and I couldn't see what she was pointing to to help her out and the waitress annoyingly said they were the chicken and pea croquetas as if my friend should have known. jamón croquetas were my favorite tapas in Barcelona so I knew these would not live up to them, and of course they did not. By this time my friend wanted to order another drink and we knew they are known for their gin and tonics so she was waiting for our waitress to come by to order the barca. She made herself scarce and after failing to flag her down my friend eventually asked the guy pouring our water "can I just order a drink from you?" Yeah, we had to from the bus boy. We ordered dessert, mine was whatever but my friend kept raving about the manchego cheesecake pops saying they were THE best thing she had ever tasted. The bill came out to just under $120 after both taxes and we left undeserving Sara a $20 tip with hopes that she will treat everyone with the respect they deserve and not discriminate based on age.
I'm giving Coqueta one star because I have been a loyal customer to chef Chiarello's restaurants and the way we were treated was absolutely unacceptable! We felt belittled and ignored beginning to end and I refuse to be treated like that again. I will not be returning.
author: Sarah S.

description: I was invited to hang with a couple of friends at Coqueta and it was a great place to have drinks and appetizers after a long day. Beautiful scenery with floor-to-ceiling glass windows overlooking the Bay. Nice, lively ambience, especially in the early evening hours.
author: Steven C.

description: Quite disappointed by the place. The dishes are very small. For instance, 3 small slices of serrano ham for 10$. You have also to make your own dishes. The pan con tomate is 2 toasted breads on top of which you have to put the tomato spread. More or less same operation is needed with the patatas bravas. I have been to a lot of tapas restaurants in Spain and outside of Spain. This one wouldn't survive very long elsewhere.
author: Abd D.

description: If you are Spanish like I am then STAY AWAY. Don't come here if you want flavor. No one in the kitchen is familiar with salt. Bland does not even begin to describe the dishes we had. If I could demand a refund for the entire meal I would.
author: Patricia P.

description:
Great drinks and beautiful location and......that's about it. My partner is from Spain and we love eating all types of Spanish food from traditional to fusion. From the reviews I was really excited about this place but all the food was bland and missed the Spanish mark from the bravas that were small and lacked flavor to the pan con tomate (never thought you could mess up bread with tomato but they put this weird tomato jelly on top....wahwah).

Also the pinchos were so tiny and bland. We tried many different tapas and were disappointed in them all.

I have never written a bad review before but we were so disappointed I felt obligated to say something.
author: Kathryn H.

description: Really great food and service.  With the open table and website advisory, which were very up front as well as some yelp laments about comfort....I was a little terrified that we'd be seated at the counter because my friend and I wanted to discuss some things, but the hostess accommodated us and we had a great and memorable meal and discussion.  I would return and stand up for that great food again!
author: Victor S.

description:
Went for a Friday evening drinks and tapas with coworker.

Nice decor inside main dining room.

Fashionable cocktails, and cute mini skewers!

Definitely interesting culinary experience.

Wish the prices are more reasonable... : (
author: Sunny S.

description:
The food was totally delicious but the service was lacking I was a single person eating the bar . It took forever to get a drink after ordering and I barely got any attention 
I had to wave the server down to get a second drink
I would return because everything I ate was out of this world but they really need to improve on the service
The same thing happened when I ate here the first time just to get a drink took forever
author: Bonnie M.

description:
I have mixed emotions about Coqueta. On one hand, I loved the atmosphere and ambiance, fun drinks, decor and the fact that it's nestled right on the Bay with beautiful views. On the other hand, there were some disappointing downfalls.

They sat us at the kitchen bar and this wouldn't necessarily have been a bad thing had we been on the other side of the kitchen bar - the side not right in front of their burning hot oven. I was sweating from the second I sat down. I had moments of forgetting about it but for the most part, was uncomfortably hot. I needed to push away from the counter a few times just to get some air. They offered to move us towards the end of our meal while we were eating dessert but at that point we just wanted to leave.

The short ribs were not worth ordering. They were tasteless, actually, and tough.

We asked for a glass of wine to go with the cheese we ordered and our server suggested a Tempranillo. We thought it sounded great. In retrospect, we should have asked, "How much is it for a glass," but call me crazy, I would never have imagined that our server would have offered a $19/a glass selection without saying something. When we got the bill we were both floored that we had spent nearly $40 for two glasses of wine. 

The kale salad was amazing. I'd go back just to eat that. Their cheese selections were delightful. The rest wasn't as memorable as I would have liked, given we spent $190 for two people.
author: Julia N.

description:
Denis M was our server (per receipt).  Super friendly and helpful.  We (party of 2) were clearly struggling with what to order, and he suggested that while the paella is good, we should opt for the small plates instead so at least we can try what we liked/didn't like.  He then suggested several small plates, which all were really, really good (not sure if Denis has good taste or that everything at Coqueta is good, probably both):

- Salmon Ahumado (honey truffle was so good)
- Gambas al Negro (prawns cooked perfectly)
- Trio de Salchichas (Denis didn't specifically recommend this but we wanted to try this anyway, pretty good.  If you like lamb, the lamb sausage is very lamb-y, which I like.)
- "Bikini" brioche a la plancha with caña de cabra, roast eggplant and preserved quince (wow, this was good, the goat cheese was just salty enough, really good.)
- Manchego cheesecake bites (surprisingly good, was thinking it was going to be more savory than sweet, but Denis said they were really good, so of course we trusted him after all those other recommendations, and yes, they were good)
- Conquistador cocktail (if you like fennel/anise, you'll like this)

Obviously, Denis was a big plus to the experience.  Spot on recommendations, and didn't try at all to get us to order the more expensive things, which is the case at other restaurants.  Will come back to try other things on the menu.
author: Amanda B.

description: Made the reservation for a party of 5 via Yelp. Excellent service. Busy place. And the food = delicious! We ordered so many food items. Btw my absolute fave drink: Barca Gintonic! ... It's description: BLOOM LONDON DRY GIN, FEVER TREE TONIC, and GRAPEFRUIT); the drink encompasses a pleasant presentation and is refreshingly tasty!
author: Pina U.

description:
Coqueta was one of the best experiences I've had at a restaurant in the city. Not only was the food out of this world, but the service and atmosphere were too. 

The place is constantly packed with people scavenging for tables, but if you're lucky enough to get a reservation it's fairly easy to get straight in.

Everything I had was delicious and prices were pretty low considering the overall value of the product. The Paella was my favorite dish. I'm not a big fan of classic paella but after trying Coqueta's I realized it's because I've never had it prepared the right way. 

Snag a reservation while you can because this place is killer.

I have a blog post about it with pictures at eatingthroughsf.tumblr.com
author: Lily K.

description: Beautiful restaurant, amazing food, and the ambiance was spectacular! Michael Chiarello didn't miss a beat with this one! To top it off, Michael himself was there that night and offered to take a picture with me! Nice guy:) They have a great selection of Spanish wines and the paella was everything it should be. Can't wait to go back!
author: Nikki C.

description:
Definitely a fan of Michael Chiarello's outing here. Came here for an anniversary dinner, and my expectations were exceeded. First off, let me say that even with a late reservation, service was excellent, and we did not feel rushed to get out of there. We had the potato chips, cauliflower, brussel sprouts, grilled octopus, the sausages, meatballs, and for dessert the moscarpone cheesecake bites and the austrian apple pie with blue cheese ice cream. Almost everything was excellent.

2 Reasons I'm not giving 5 stars. First, I don't know Spanish food that well, so I hesitate to say its as good as it gets, because I don't know. Second, the brussel sprout special was just not an amazing dish. They didn't do anything to combat the sulfur-y taste of the sprouts and along with being a little generous with the char, it kinda tasted like burnt weed on the aftertaste.
author: Dom S.

description:
Fine dining with an all around beautiful scene both indoors and outdoors.  First off, Coqueta has served over 800,000 Gin & Tonics, definitely order one! Must tries: Carmel covered goat cheesecake & churros with chocolate sauce and berry powder. I also tried this strawberry gazpacho dessert but can't remember the name. To fill your stomach a little more try the ensalada de Kale, which is lil vinegary but the cana de cabra cheese smooths out the taste. If your mouth can handle a lil spice, then try the Pimientos de Padron; green roasted peppers that can be simultaneously sweet & spicy. 

This place offers brilliant Spanish food and chic modern aesthetics. Definitely a good place for a date or to impress your friends on a night out in SF. 

*Special insider's note: this is where Kanye and Kim went after he proposed to her at the ballpark. Fancy!
author: Byrrnye W.

description:
My boyfriend and I decided on a whim to try out Coqueta. Even though reservations were completely booked until August, the host told us he could accommodate us at the chef's counter around 7:15 pm. What a happy coincidence! We just happened to sit front row to the man himself, Michael Chiarello. 

Chef introduced himself as we received our first plate, a new item on the menu called watermelon with ham and "its essence". (In essence, pig fat.) Even though I couldn't eat pork, he sliced a different cut for my boyfriend to sample with it. We ordered several other tapas, but my favorite by far was the calamari with onion jam and squid ink aioli. (I only wish it was bigger!) The mojito "costa brava" with tarragon-lime air was an interesting cocktail to drink, though the foam kept bubble bathing my nose. And to top off an already kicka** night, Chef brought us not one but two types of cider to chase our apple pie and goat cheese ice cream with. 

Amazing experience, incredible food. Thank you so much for the hospitality and looking forward to coming back soon!
author: Auburn S.

description: We had an exceptional experience here! The food was inspired, the service was great, and the ambience was beautiful. Their grilled calamari, gambas al negro, gazpacho, pretty much the entire dessert list, and even just the garlic mushrooms were amazing. We will be back, and next time with enough time to order the paella.
author: Rachel J.

description:
Make a reservation!

Personally I think Coqueta is a bit overpriced for what you get. The food was ok. Very small portions. Each small plate is made for 3 or less.  I recommend going with a group so you can try a variety of plates, but you will likely have to double each order so everyone can try. 

Service was great. The food came out regularly. 

I'm expecting so I had to order the J+T 'mock'tail and it was delicious! Best mocktail I have had so far! All the cocktails looked delicious too!
author: Julie J.

description:
Caveat: This review is for the service, not the food. 

Every year for at least the last ten or so, we have a holiday dinner with 3 other couples in the city. It is one of the highlights of our holiday season. This year, my husband and I are out of the country, so we were sadly unable to join our friends for dinner. In an effort to be part of the night nonetheless, we emailed Coqueta a week or so beforehand to ask them to make sure that some drinks and appetizers from us were already on the table when our friends got there. I received an email back saying that would be no problem.  Since we didn't have cell phone reception, we emailed back confirming and giving them our credit card number. We also asked them to include a note with the drinks/apps. Again, confirmation back - no problem. 

Emailed with our friends the next day to find out that NONE of what we asked had been delivered. No pitcher of sangria waiting, no plate of meat/cheese (they ordered their own), and no note. Frankly, it was a bit embarrassing to even have to ask them - but we knew that something was up since none of them mentioned it when telling us about the night before. We were *really* disappointed. 

I gave Coqueta a day or so to send an apologetic email explaining that something had gone wrong (which I would totally understand - these things happen), but nothing. So I sent an email back to all the people that had been cc:ed on my first two emails that wasn't nasty - just asking what had happened. The response I got back....NOTHING. Not an apology, not an explanation, nothing. 

What a disappointment.
author: Emily S.

description: We went for lunch today and loved it! Ambiance was great, food was very good. Perfect amount and very tasty, we ordered the 3 hot tapas and the Paella and it was perfect. We were four of us. My husband and the kids and of course I enjoyed the food. Great place, will like to go again and try some other menu items.
author: Mausumi S.

description: Great place. Best to have at least a party of four so you can sample the tapas properly .  Even the drinks are served in bottles meant to share.  I think the sharing is what makes this restaurant so special.  The food is incredible.  Every bite bursts with flavor.  Our table ordered the paella which takes 20 minutes to make.  That's ok because you can share more tapas while you wait.  We had prawns, Brussels sprouts, dainty coquettes, meatballs, cheese platters, and still had room for the main course.  The menu, the service and the food all encourage the art of conversation with friends. Isn't that why we don't dine alone?
author: Renee H.

description:
Really delicious. 4.5 stars.  I brought a group of 6 here for lunch on the weekend and I can't think of a dish that disappointed.  We had plenty of food but were able to finish it all since it was so good.   In a vaguely descending order of my favorites (but again I liked it all), we ordered: 

- Tortillita de Camaron- Crispy shrimp chickpea flour pancake with saffron aioli - surprisingly good, crispy 
- Paella - bomba rice, jamón serrano-shellfish broth, Gulf shrimp, clams, chorizo, with broccolini , asparagus, and lemon aioli - rice was so tasty with the shellfish broth, the shrimp was perfectly cooked (they add enough shrimp to make sure each person got one), and the clams were huge. 
- "Sunny side-up" Huevo With Shrimp, crispy potato, and chorizo dressing - this was a bit oily from the dressing but was very tasty when all mixed together.  It consisted of small shrimp, thin crispy potato sticks, and chorizo with a chili oil. 
- Salmon Ahumado open faced sandwich - small portions of Smoked salmon queso fresco and truffle honey on bread - super fresh.  
- Pimientos de Padron - padron peppers with tiny strips of jamon 
- Ensalada de Remolacha - Roasted baby beets with Sausalito watercress, beet vinaigreta, tierra and cabrales blue cheese snow 
- Setas al ajillo - Wild and cultivated mushrooms with garlic,chilli,and sherry  - this was probably a bit too oily but good. 
- Jamon serrano (house cured) 
- Croquetas de Pollo -  Chicharon crusted Chicken and English pea croquetas with cured cara-caraorange - I always find croquetas a bit too mushy but it's a classic. 
- Pulpo a la Parilla Wood-grilled octopus, fingerling potatoes, pimentó olive oil
- Albondigas a la Feria - Grilled duck and pork meatballs with tart cherry and tempranillo salsa and crispy shallots (to be fair, I didn't try these). 

I also ordered their Tariff cocktail which was delicious - it was the equivalent of a slightly fruity gin and tonic, with a rough hewn ice slab. 

Everything came to about $45 per person before tip.  

Great job Coqueta!
author: Vivian W.

description:
Having dined at Bottega, and being a fan of Mr. Chiarello's, I've been looking forward to trying Coqueta since it opened.  Finally happened last night.  Yes, I know it's been 9 months.  Easy now.  I'm just one person.  There are a lot of restaurants in this town.
So...
While I can appreciate a converted warehouse just as much as the next person, I didn't appreciate the exposed stacks of boxes.  Eye sore.  If you've been, you know.  If you haven't, you will right away.  At this price point, and when you're packed every friggin night of the week...?  Since a glass of red wine averages $16 bucks, it seems reasonable to surmise that they have the budget that would afford said boxes to be concealed.  I understand that there is a spatial challenge to consider...just cover them up.  Next, about the service.  Our server was helpful & über informed.  Nice.  But my man selected a bottle of wine after some deliberation, and he was the victim of a swift up sell attempt.  Hey.  We know you gotta make money.  But hey.  Everybody does.  Up selling is totally fine while the deliberating is in progress, but once a selection has been specified and actually ordered, it's bordering on disrespectful.  My man chose another bottle, so it all worked out in the end.  But now our experience has stepped out of the realm of perfection.  Ok.  Onto the food.  The pintxos: chorizo, quail egg, & the jamon serrano...all delicious.  The smoked salmon with queso fresco & truffle honey...so tasty.  The albondigas...those were knocked right outta the park.  I mean, it will be hard for me to have "regular" meatballs from now on.  Like, forever.  The sunny side up egg with crispy potato & shrimp & a spicy tomato tapenade (that I'm pretty sure my man could eat on top of anything & by the jarful)...mouth watering.  Order it.  The pork shoulder entree was absolutely divine.  My man commented on the small portion (given the price of $38 bucks), something along the line of "I could put all of it in a burrito..." and I realized I could have easily polished it off by myself.  Being that I'm petite & don't eat a lot, I have to agree w him.  It's the size of an appetizer.  More than happy to pay big bucks for food.  As long as it's worth it.  No one, and I do mean no one, likes to feel ripped off.  Now dessert.  How could I not order a dessert that includes liquid nitrogen?  It is a show stopper.  Just mad sick.  Order it.
All in all, food was outstanding, and the service was attentive & efficient, despite the wine issue.  Definitely worth checking out.  4 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
Coqueta exceeded my expectations on so many levels.  A solid cocktail/tapas spot for sure. There were a few misses that ultimately made me take off a star, but overall we had a wonderful dinner with friends.

We had made a reservation for dinner several weeks in advance. Upon arriving, the hostess informed us they were running 30-45 mins behind. Ughs. Normally, I'm ok with this, even with having a reservation, so long as I can wait comfortably and order a drink to kill time.  There was a company holiday party consuming the bar area, so the hostess told us we couldn't wait there, and she'd send a bartender our way. Ok, no biggie, but what got me was her attitude. You honestly would have thought we were bothering her.  There's hardly any room to "wait" if you're not in the actual bar area, so we were forced to sit/stand awkwardly in the tiny entrance area.  She really just wasn't friendly or helpful. 

Luckily the wait wasn't too bad and we were seated in about 20 minutes. What set things immediately back on track were the cocktails.  Definitely some of the most inventive, tasty, and well-presented drinks I've had in the bay!  Service was a little slow from the start but improved as we started ordering.  We ordered too many dishes to name, but in particular, the table agreed that the standouts were the salmon open-faced sandwich and the sunny side up shrimp.  We also really enjoyed the cheese/meat board as well as the meatballs - absolutely delicious and so moist. We were stuffed, but sprung for dessert - the apple pie with blue cheese ice ream, and left no crumb behind.

Overall food was easily 5/5, and our waiter was fantastic, too.  Chiarello was in house this evening, and even though he promised he'd "come back by" for a picture after we asked..he never showed up :(  I get he has other matters to tend to, but I was eager to pay him a compliment and maybeeeee get a picture. He promised! 

Definitely worth a stop in - be prepared for a fun night of tasty cocktails, shared plates, and a buzzing ambiance.
author: Brianna M.

description: I was craving some  Spanish food to take me back to when I lived in Spain. It was good and had a good concept of Spanish food, but not the same flavor. I like the decor. Very rustic yet trendy. It was a bit on the pricey side for the amount of food.
author: Talisa R.

description: Had a late reservation arrived early ordered and had some cocktails at the bar, we were seated early and between the cocktails which were fantastic and our tapas which were more than plenty and tasty I have to return for my favorite cocktail and dessert which we did not try cause we were tooooo full
author: Mariataide M.

description:
This place is amazing!  Everyone hear knows and understand what the goal of the food, the ambiance, the drinks are.  Our waitress was extremely knowledgable about Michael Chiarello's concept and we really appreciated that. 

Everything we got was super tasty and the steak--it's a big one--was cooked to perfection.  I need to come back and spend some more time here!
author: A. C.

description: It was just OK. We live and eat regularly in the Napa valley and have an expectation of quality especially at this price point. Both the greens and paella were not properly cleaned and made for gritty bites. Appears the team could use some solid leadership.
author: Leslie M.

description: The food wasn't all that great. There's no ways about it. And I'm not even comparing it to the price. It has nothing to do with the price...it just wasn't that good. the location is pretty cool, and the place is decorated really modern and exquisite, but the food,....(sigh). Dare I say not even average. And it has nothing to do with location either as I like plenty of other places along the water like La Mar, and the The Waterfront. this was a disappointment.
author: Nick V.

description: I'm actually unable to review Coqueta's food, as my family and I never got a chance to taste it after waiting for 45 minutes past our reservation time.  We were told, after arriving at 9:25 for our 9:30 reservation, that the party at our table was "finishing up," and that we should be seated right around our reservation time.  At 9:50, we were told that the party had just ordered dessert, and that there was no way of telling when they would be finished.  There were no apologies from either of the two seemingly unconcerned (if not downright rude) hostesses.  When we hadn't been seated by 10:15 and let a hostess know that we would have to leave, she had literally nothing to say.  We  scrambled to find another restaurant in the area that could accommodate us at that late hour.
author: Nancy Y.

description:
Three of us came here for a mini-celebration, and it turned out really, really well. I was uncertain about how the menu would work for me, but it ended up being GREAT.

We started with cocktails. Everyone got something different (I got an extra spicy Castro, which was a great idea!), and the gin and tonic menu was awesome. The Conquistador, with the fennel salt, was another standout of creative and delicious cocktailery.

For our dining, we shared an array of items. The padron peppers were a real standout for me (they had no problem putting the ham on the side so that my dining companions could have their peppers with meat, and I could have it without). They were flavorful and perfect! We also got the greens and the mushrooms, and both were excellent, though the mushrooms stood out the most to me. The patatas bravas were good enough, but I prefer the ones at Duende in Oakland.

I would have liked to have tried the gazpacho, but not this time!

My dining companions RAVED about the manchego cheesecakes, and they did look insanely tasty.

Our waitress was great with guiding us to dessert wines, and overall, taking excellent care of us all night.

We went on a whim and were seated promptly in the bar with no reservation. We had a great evening, though it was more expensive than I think it necessarily deserved. However, we were all really happy with the food, the drinks, the service, and the experience. I definitely plan to go back!
author: Vivienne P.

description:
My husband's review is "Good but nothing special.  Been there , done that.  Check" as in check this one off!

Lately I have been wondering if we are just now old and cranky or just plain spoiled.  We dine out at least 3 times a week; enjoying both dives as well as all the Michelin starred restaurants as well as all those in between.  I make all the reservations so my husband always looks at me with disdain when I pick one that does not thrill.  I counter with it had rave reviews on Yelp or by Michael Bauer which makes him double down on his disdain. LOL

We got there early for our 5:15 reservations so sat in the bar for a cocktail but soon were moved into their amazingly very small restaurant.  I got a Galleon $12 which tasted like strawberry water, no alcohol.  A young man asked what I thought of it so I told him.  A minute later our waitress with concern came by offering me a substitute.  At first I waved her off but she said she wanted me to be happy and suggested their Barca Gintonic so how could I say no to being made happy?  And so our service continued thru out the night with everyone we came in contact with being kind, accommodating and gracious.

We ordered a lot.  I was so looking forward to their *Jamón Ibérico de Bellota IMported $29 paired with their Manchego Crudo firm sheep, Spain, raw $6 which turned out to be a bit under whelming.  We were expecting stellar but got OK.  Next was their Huevos Nacional Deviled eggs filled with spring pea, smoked pimentón alioli, on pickled saffron potatos and olive oil poached Bonito $7 which was 2 half eggs.  I loved it and got to eat both as my husband does not share my deviled egg fetish.

We each enjoyed 3 skewers each, Pintxos Bite-size Skewers
$2.50 each.  
1.  House cured boquerones White anchovies, olives, pearl
onions, and guindilla peppers
2.  Chorizo roasted artichokes, and piquillo peppers
3.  Huevos de Codorniz Quails egg "Diablo", pickled
mustard seed, and jamón Serrano

We got a special here which was 2 skewers of what seemed like prechewed, marinated overnight lamb bites though oddly a bit tough in a tasty oily curry.  It was accompanied by a watermelon and onion salad which was the best part of the dish.

*Pulpo a la Parilla Wood-grilled octopus, fingerling
potatos,pimentón olive oil $14  was my husband's favorite dish.  Great grilled flavor but almost too tender.  Very much like Kokkari's which we had last week.

Calamares a la Plancha Whole Monterey calamari on the
plancha with onion jam and squid ink alioli $10.  3 whole calamari whose taste was delicate, a bit oily but enjoyable.

Our last dish was the Pluma Acorn fed, Spanish Ibérico de bellota
pork shoulder loin with honey-chili glaze $38.  Well................ yes it was fatty, moist and tasty but the serving is really, really small.  Did it knock our socks off?  NO!  We also got the Setas al ajillo Wild and cultivated mushrooms with garlic, chilli, and sherry $10 to go with it.  It was good but was swimming in way too much oil.

Total was $240+ plus tip which included 2 cocktails and a $50 bottle of wine.

We were full!  

Service was excellent, wall seats comfortable though others not as much, fun venue, decent food.  I can see why this place is popular especially with the younger crowd.  It is fun to order a bunch of plates and a few drinks.  I would go back but since my husband will not, I am out of luck.  LOL
author: Kell M.

description: It is sad to write this review as we have been to Coqueta many times since visiting SF last year and it is one of my daughter's favorites. The 3 stars is for the consideration of the prior visits. This was a 2 star visit really. She wanted to bring her Dad there who flew out for the night form NY for her birthday.  Unfortunately we waited over 1/2 hour in the bar for a 7 PM reservation without apology and spent over $40 on cocktails as we waited. It was only 30 min later after we asked about when the table would be ready they "found" the table which was a table for 2 set for 3 in the middle of a traffic area with constant bumping and tripping of the wait staff behind us. We asked to move but nothing available and no apologies. Since it is tapas they did time it well enough with a "stripped down" table so we were not stacking dishes on top of each other but it was tight! The tapas as usual was good and we enjoyed a lovely RIoja reserva. However they delivered a cheesecake happy birthday dessert which we did not order in addition to our ordered chocolate churros (which are delicious). The bill was confusing as they added the cheesecake to the bill then took it away. Initially they took the bottle of wine off the bill as well which was confusing. When we asked to speak to the manager he pointed that the cheesecake was not really billed which in the end was just an annoyance. But we didn't care about the bill-really the experience was very underwhelming, not special and lackluster enthusiasm from the staff. They did take a $6 tapas off for us for good will, and added the wine back in but it was not about the money as we wanted a better experience.  This place gives a vibe of really not caring about your experience so if that is not important don't worry the food is pretty good. Not sure we will return though as we very much felt like an afterthought. Which is a shame as we previously had good experiences.
author: Kathy H.

description:
Their gin and tonic is so refreshing, they add edible flowers, fruits!! YUM! 
Make sure you make space after  that delicious (and hard to understand) tapas food for the manchego cheesecake with caramel popcorn( don;t worry its bite size)
author: Meher S.

description:
Amazing view, and amazing tapas. Here's what we got when we went for Sunday Brunch:

-Chef selection of cured meat and cheeses
-Anchovies + Quail eggs skewers
-Smoked salmon and truffle honey sandwich (Amazing!)
-Wood grilled octopus (drooling)
-Gulf prawns with garlic and chili sauce (so fresh)
-crispy potatoes with garlic alioli (might pass on this next time, love the texture but not a lot of flavor)

Will definitely be back to try out the rest of the menu :)
author: Kym L.

description:
I had one of the best experiences dining out at Coqueta! Our server, Josh, was amazing. He was patient with us and explained menu items in full detail. We started with the bite-size skewers that were these darling little bites on toothpicks, perfect for tasting. Patatas Bravas, the egg with shrimp, were among other "tapas" that we started with. The Ribeye, however, was my favorite. Just tender, flavorful, awesomeness. 
Our Spanish gin and tonic was beautiful! I honestly forgot the names of the other cocktails, but I remember Josh being so informed on the back stories of them. Little stories behind menu items gets me all excited. A+ food, service, and ambiance. Thank you Josh! Can't wait to go back.
author: Mia V.

description:
I have a very short attention span in terms of food so it is best to stuff my face with a variety of different things to keep me entertained. Thus, tapas are my favorite style of food. I first wandered into this establishment a year ago when a fellow foodie insisted we go here for a late-night second dinner. Since they're conveniently open till 11:00pm for dinner Thursdays through Saturdays, our stomachs called and we followed! We entered the portion of the restaurant that looks like a greenhouse, which permits a wonderful view of the bay and had a few drinks before going into the main dining area. The crowd consists mainly of working professionals and the ambiance is a blend of rustic charm and trendy modernity. The style of food offered is best described as a modern Californian interpretation of traditional Spanish tapas. 

So, what do you get? Allow me to illuminate your options...

Pinxtos:
Jamon serrano, manchego, and apricot-sherry conserva
Qualis egg "Diablo", pickled mustard seed, and jamon serrano 

Tapas Calientes:
Sunny side-up egg with shrimp, crispy potato, and chorizo dressing
Wood-grilled octopus with fingerling potatoes, pimenton, and olive oil

La Brasa:
Gaucho bone-in 32 oz. natural beef ribeye
Whole grilled branzino with green olive and preserved meyer lemon salsa

Refrescos:
Limonada - roasted sparkling, lemonade, rosemary, seasonal fruit

Postres pequenos:
Pan con chocolate, ice cream sandwich with olive oil ice cream

Your wallet be damned, enjoy! =)
author: Charlotte Z.

description: We just came here for cocktails so I can't say anything about the food, but the cocktails were amazing. I tried both the white and red sangria which were great, but I'd say the red was best. My fiance got a really delicious tequila cocktail (forgot the name). The bartenders were friendly and the space had a fun atmosphere and nice view. I would definitely return!
author: Maggie W.

description: I think Coqueta is fabulous! The food, the staff and waiter were great!  We showed up late for our reservation and they were still able to accommodate us.  One item we ordered was delayed and they were very kind in offering us appetizers while we waited for our order. I will definitely be back!
author: Mari B.

description: I was curious to try out Michael chiarelli's restaurant. I made a reservation the day before for 5.30pm.  Being a  tourist trying to find my way around, I ended up walking and running 1.5 miles from fisherman's wharf to the restaurant because traffic was in a gridlock. I arrived at the restaurant at 5.35pm, and had to stand in line for another 5 to 7 mins to be helped by a blonde staff member at the front. It was 5.40pm and she told me, sorry I couldn't hold the table, you were or 10 mins late we had to give your table to others that were waiting! I explained that I had to wait over 5 mins even to be helped by her. And she didn't even attempt to call me before giving my table to someone else. She simply said I could sit in their outside patio. The cocktails were mediocre and food unfortunately was mediocre. It was truly a disappointment. One should try lolo and Bellota where the food and drinks are in a whole different level!
author: Simone Y.

description:
How stupid am I? Never once in my life have I made to Spain. And judging by how good Coqueta is, all I have to say is why not?

Spanish food is amazing, and Coqueta does it the best. It's owned and operated by some celebrity chef which normally can be a recipe for fail. But not here, nope no sireeee. 

Everything from the service to the bayside location Coqueta is 5 star awesome. The food (and lets not forget the drink) are scrumptious. 

Come hungry and get your Spanish on. Once you've dined here, you will get a hankering for Barcelona.
author: V B.

description:
Amazing!!!! Best place in sf! 
I absolutely loved this place! It's now become a must visit place for every trip I make to San Francisco!
author: Yashar A.

description: Their signature gin & tonic and the Uni biscult are both a must get!
author: Marygrace C.

description:
We've had small plates and tappas at a lot of places on both the East and West Coast and this is the best we have experienced in the U.S.

Just walking in is a treat!  The sights and aromas are very exciting.  They will come to you table with  a tray of wonderful small bites on a stick.  You can choose to your hearts content.

It is an absolute joy to 'graze' on their many small plates.  The variety and creativity is incredible.  The quality of the ingredients is first class.  You can taste, smell and see the how well they have incorporated the various ingredients to provide you with a delectable bite of this and that.  Some of it will tease your senses and others will drive you to want more!

Yes, it can be expensive but the value is there.  And by comparison, I did not think it was as expensive as Va da Vi, Walnut Creek.

We were a party of four adults and our bill was under $200 (including tax but not tip), with drinks.

It's a "must do" kind of place.  It's vairly small so be sure to get reservations.  This place is good enough to take people from out of town to impress them.

We will be back.

Jim
author: James Q.

description:
The reason i gave it 2 stars are:
1. The ambianceand the view
2. The food is actually not bad

If not for the above mentioned, they will not get a star otherwise. The service is so bad! The person that does the reservation is so rude. Never again! We had a reservation at 6 and we were asked to leave at 7pm because they had a reservation 7. Never in my life had I heard or experience such thing. If you do decide to dine here, I would be prepared to take dessert and coffee to go before you too get asked to leave prior to their next reservation.
author: joyce s.

description:
Had a great early dinner on a sunny Saturday afternoon with the windows open. One of the first experiences upon entering the dining room is the pleasing smell of the wood fire burning brightly at the right side of the kitchen.

We sampled the Estrella Galicia and Dam beers.  We started with the cold Huevos Nacional with smoked pimenton aioli on a lightly pickled potato, with poached bonito on top. For hot tapas we had the duck-and-pork albondigas, very crispy Brussels sprouts and finally enjoyed the grilled octopus with fingerling potatoes.  Service was very attentive throughout the meal.
author: David E.

description: Excellent service. Paella is a bit too salty. Pulpo a la Plancha was good. Sangria was cute, but wasn't that good.
author: Peter K.

description: I am very disappointed by the place. The tapas we ordered were too expensive for their size, and the plates weren't as good as expected. For example, we ordered chorizo and received 8 small pieces of chorizo for 8$. The pan con tomate and the patatas bravas had to be prepared by the client. The tomato paste had to be spread onto the bread and the patatas bravas had to be dipped in the spicy sauce. The service was decent, for we had to wait 15 minutes for a server to serve us a cup of water. Overall, I wouldn't recommend this place.
author: DJ B.

description:
One of the best restaurants in SF- hands down! 

From the patatas bravas, to the gin and tonic, to the kale salad, to the pork, to the cafe con leche- this place nailed it! 

I love the interior and the music. Great place for groups!
author: Sam P.

description:
I went last month.
