We had the ensalade resorte (a cold summer vegetable salad), the bean gazpacho soup (not split by the server so tough to share), the crispy shrimp pancake, the beet salad, and the arroz cremosa as a smallish shared main entree. All were delicious and it was the perfect amount of food for 2 women. (For pricing consideration, our total bill came to $112, including food, drinks, the 3% Healthy SF, and tax.)

Our server was attentive and other servers were readily available to assist. My only complaint, and in my experience this is common to tapas style restaurants across the country, is that the servers always seem to way overestimate how much food you should order. We were advised to order 4 appetizers per person, plus entrees. This would have been twice the amount of food that we actually ordered.
author: Marie F.

description: Went for drinks and small plates as we had eaten before. Excellent customer service and very cozy and nice place, except thay We ordered a sangría which was never brought to our table but we were fine with it. To eat we had the patatas bravas and meatballs which tasted really good, just the right amount of spice. For dessert we ordered the machego cheesecake bites, they were tiny but more than enough and delicious!
author: C G.

description: This place has outstanding tapas. It is a bit expensive but due to the view and location. The meatballs were beyond delicious - a must. They have some great chorizo. Croquetas were good too.. Good wine selection. Next time I go back I'll be trying some of their dishes, more specifically their steak as it's probably the biggest piece of meat I've seen being cooked in front of me (I was sitting in the chef's counter).
author: Rob L.

description: The food is tasty but the portions are small for the price they charge. I guess nobody said this restaurant experience would be cheap. Believe me, I'm willing to drop a pretty penny on my food but I had dinner  (appetizers, main, dessert) here and was still hungry by the time I was done. I not a huge eater but I did go home to have a second dinner. This kind of defeats the purpose of eating out but it's "been there, done that" for Coqueta. Perhaps other patrons will think otherwise as they are rightly entitled. I would go back here again just for the drinks!
author: W A.

description:
Coqueta's restaurant is the spot to go for an extraordinary culinary experience in San Francisco. The food is innovative and every dish is presented with pizzazz. At first glance, the menu is a bit confusing to get around; it is mainly designed for you to order small plates called tapas, which allow you to order several different dishes on the menu, which is perfect for someone like me who often wants to try many items on a menu-or if you can't make up your mind. The flavors of the various foods we tried were spectacular! I suppose if I had to pick a favorite dish it would be the wood-grilled octopus, but it's a very tough call!  For a non-alcoholic drink, the J & T Referesco (Juniper, Lime, Fever Tree Mediterranean Tonic.) is the way to go; it has the sophistication of an alcoholic beverage, and most importantly, tastes amazing-it's refreshing-and is presented superbly, but I won't spoil the surprise and tell you how. 

The service is exceptional. The staff is incredibly astute.  As an example, at one point, my husband got up from the table and the wait staff slyly folded his messy looking napkin. Searching hard for downfalls, the tables are too close together and it took me some time to get acclimated to the music which is on the loud side, but it's only because it was unexpected, and before long it was just part of the scene and I hardly noticed it. The vibe in the restaurant is like you are at a happening spot (Which you are!), but it does not have to try too hard to be that cool place, it just is.

For two people, expect to pay around $100 for enough food/beverage to satisfy your hunger pangs-and that's if you don't order an entree (which is not necessary), but every dollar is well worth the money. I can't wait to go back here and have some repeats and try a few more dishes and get another J & T. Go if you can, you won't regret it. Oh, and save room for dessert!
author: Karen L.

description: As a Chef, I beg you to RUN, don't walk to the most unbelievable tapas and small plate resto in the country.  Brioche and truffle with stone fruit, Holy S*#@  I wanted to bathe in it. Four visits in two months, and it keeps getting better.
author: Rob M.

description: I absolutely love this restaurant! I had the arroz cremosa, cheese platter, and the wood grilled octopus. Everything had great flavors, but a tad salty. I was definitely in need of a glass of water after. I loved the arroz cremosa the best. It is a rice dish that looks kind of like risotto topped with scallops. The flavors hit your mouth like a tidal wave....it was absolutely delicious!  I also had the sangria which was very refreshing. I definitely want to come back to try the other tapas on the menu.
author: Rebecca D.

description: This place is a lot fun for two! They have some really fantastic gin and mezcal drinks. Their paella is omgs delicious! It's a very refreshing place to dine out at :)\
author: Spencer A.

description: Took a friend there from out of town for brunch, atmosphere ok outside, sexier inside which we weren't allowed in.  We had reservations requesting for bar seating, but they only allowed for outside bar seating instead of inside bar seating and told us it's because we specified for bar seating...whatever.  Food was a little on the higher price point for the quantity since all servings are bit sized but tiny, not sure if it encourages sharing.  Nonetheless, we did.  The razor clams were tiny compared to the ones I had at Eataly a week ago...disappointing.  Sunnyside up eggs w/ shrimps & crispy potatoes was to die for and worth going back just for that.  Duck patties were small but eatable.  Cocktails are ok.  Good when you have extra cash or corporate account.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Love, love Coqueta. Always yummy drinks & tapas.
author: Kalani K.

description: Foods, service, and ambiance are well balanced. The chef is playing the art with dishes wonderfully .
author: Patricia H.

description: Couldn't get a last minute rezzy at the restaurant so we took our chances at the bar, where you can order off the full menu.  It was kind of stressful standing around and hovering over people while they ate in order to yoink their seats, and I spilled some drinks off a poor waitress's tray. When we finally did get a seat, however, everything was delicious, but some things more than others. First, I would not recommend the paella. I am a lover of paella but this one was pretty small and not amazing for $45. If you must have it, then note that you can order this while you're still scavenging for tables as it takes 40 min to prepare. The kalbi (Korean short ribs) were stringy and tough. However, the octopus, papas bravas, churros and sangria were deeelicious. I think the couple we were accidentally on a double date with mentioned that the albondigas (meatballs) were good too.
author: Jenny J.

description: I was a bit nervous before coming here for my sister's birthday. There's a few negative reviews on the service; however, we were lucky to have a great & attentive waitress. The food was absolutely amazing! Every dish was flavorful & unique, and the rustic/wooden atmosphere pulled the whole dining experience together. Some of my favorite dishes were the salmon ahumado, sunny side-up huevo, chicken croquetas & churros!
author: Rachel L.

description: Came in for a couple of drinks with a group of friends and sat at the bar. The bartenders (brothers I think!) were skilled, really kind, fun to talk to... and very attractive. The last bit doesn't matter, but it certainly doesn't hurt. I'll definitely be back!
author: Jenny Z.

description:
I loved our experience dining here. The ambiance, drinks and food were all top notch. My husband and I made reservations as we loved our experiences at Bottega and were excited to try Michael Chiarello take on Spanish tapas. We were not disappointed! Don't get me wrong, not every dish exceeded our expectations... but that's the fun part of tapas - trying different things. Here are the things we'd order again:

Barca Gintonic - You must start with this cocktail. Perfectly balanced and refreshing.
Tattas Bravas - They look like tater tots, and have a really creamy texture. The salsa dipping sauce was amazing.
Chicken and English Pea Croquetas - One of our favorite dishes, this is like your own delicious chicken pot pie.
Grilled Duck and Pork meatballs - Michael was actually working the night we came, and brought these out to us after we chatted and realized we didn't order. They were my favorite dish of the night, and I will definitely order them the next time we go.
Pluma - The pork was cooked perfectly and the honey-chili sauce was wonderful.

Cannot wait until next time!
author: Jessica W.

description:
Coquetaaaaaaaaa - I love you. You're officially one of my favorite restaurants ever now, though you're way above my pocketbook level.

My elderly Mom was visiting from out of town, and I had planned to take her to a different restaurant on fourth street. After waiting for a bus for about an hour, some kind soul told us the street was closed, and the buses had been rerouted due to a demonstration. We attempted to go to both the left and right side street for a work-around bus: both streets ran in the wrong direction. By then my Mom was getting tired and it was getting late. She was just tired and was looking longingly in the direction of McDonalds.

Eating at McDonalds while in SAN FRANCISCO?!!! Not on my watch!!!

Thank you whichever mayor is responsible for universal wifi, because I was able to check back-up plan restaurant directions on yelp on my Kindle (I don't have a cellphone). from Market street. 

One such back-up plan was Coqueta. It was on the original list because it contained some Basque items, and Mom wanted to try Basque food. I had crossed it off the list because it seemed way too trendy, seemed to require reservations, seemed to involve communal tables, and seemed to be out of our price range. But it was located near the BART station (enabling us to go home soon after eating), and we were only blocks away. It was our best option.

When we straggled in, Coqueta had less than an hour left open. They asked us if we had a reservation. Coqueta gets 5 stars just for what happened next.

At most 5 star restaurants the host/hostess will then assess you for how rich you are, how many drinks you will most likely buy, how big your party is, how you are dressed, how big a tip you are likely to leave. These guys didn't even hesitate (and there were two - no dispute between them): they saw a moderately (poorly?) dressed woman dragging in her exhausted elderly mother, and they found us a table. No reservations necessary. 

We got our own table - not the communal table. It had a great view of the Bay Bridge with its fantastic light show! I actually did want to order a cocktail out of gratitude, but they were out of the one I tried to order. D:

But the kind service we got is not the best part. The best part was the food! We ordered 4 plates of tapas that turned out to be so generously proportioned, we needed a to-go box later. And it was DELICIOUS! DELICIOUS!!!

The very best thing was the duck and sour cherry meatballs. Heavenly scrumptious. Possibly one of the best things I've ever tasted. I'm so glad that's the dish Mom and I were wise enough to get 2 of. We also had a crispy shrimp griddlecake, and the crispy potatoes). I had coffee - I can't remember whether my Mom had anything else to drink. The bill ran us in the $50 range, which I swear just ONE of those duck/cherry meatballs was worth!

The next day I was happy to mention Coqueta by name when I described the little misadventure with the closing of fourth street to friends. I doubt I will be in a position to eat there again any time soon, but if anyone asks me for an upscale, hip recommendation in San Francisco, Coqueta is getting my vote!
author: Nella C.

description:
Cocktails are very good, food equally so.  House cured anchovies, calamari, Iberico ham are all wonderful. The pop rocksicle desert was a bust without much flavor. 
Very active bar scene, young professional crowd. Service was attentive but a bit too "cute".  Will I go again?  Absolutely.
author: Phil S.

description:
This review is not about the food. Their hostess is quite terrible and their phone lines are a huge pain. I was on hold for 5 minutes before I got a live person on the phone and then when I did, I was met with a curt and generally unhelpful demeanor. 

Poor customer service based on my first contact with the establishment.
author: S I.

description: Hands down best tapas in SF! I got the seafood paella and the steak. They're the trademark dishes of this place, and I think I know why : )
author: Austin N.

description:
Beware of the hyped $45 paella!!!

Yes... You read that right. Forty five freakin dollars. It was horrible. It was burnt, dry, hard, entirely overcooked, and complete with small rocks and shells. I understand sometimes you get shells with seafood, but in both my bites I had them. Bad. Sorry, but I expect more from a restaurant of this caliber and for that crazy price. 

I just found another Yelp review that mentions the same experience. So now we know it wasn't a fluke. I'm sure there are more. 

Otherwise the other dishes were good... duck and pork meatballs, octopus, patatas bravas, jamon and manchego. Not great, but good. 

Also beware of the condescending, pretentious waiter with the worst personality of any waitstaff I have encountered. I hope you do not sit in his station. I was so excited to finally try this place and he instantly ruined it for me. Sounds like the other bad Paella Yelp reviewer was also in his station.  

Hope you do get the lovely bus boy. Wish I knew his name. He provided the only small pleasure of the experience. 

Well... It's checked of my list and sadly I will never go back. Way prefer Zarzuela to this place.
author: Sharon G.

description: We heard many good things about Coqueta and were looking forward to visit it during our time in San Francisco. We made a reservation at 9:30pm on July 4th. We didn't eat too much during the day, as we hope to try many dishes there. When we arrived 9:25pm, the general host told us the table was not ready yet. Okay, we understand it was July 4th. Busy time for all the restaurants. While waiting for our table, we went outside to enjoy the firework. We came back to restaurant when firefox finished at 9:50, the general manger told us our table has been taken. Seriously, she even didn't apologize or attempt to recover the glitch. Perhaps they've good food. But if it's how they treat their guests, we would never want to go there. Very disappointed.
author: Pei-Ching C.

description: Cocktails are divine! Hints of pine, fennel, rose petal and fresh berries created an absolute gem in gin. Paella sucked.
author: Miss H.

description:
This is a great restaurant and my new favorite place in San Francisco. The bar can be very noisy but it is separate from the actual restaurant and usually standing room only - the drinks however are spectacular and the view is fantastic!

The restaurant itself is beautifully done with the exposed wooden structure reaching up into the high ceiling. very chic, very tasteful. the staff are attentive and the food is fantastic. The wine list is a comes up a little short and leans heavily towards Napa for US wines, as one might expect. But on the whole the experience deserves five stars for quality and ambiance. Expect to pay about $120 per person for a dinner with cocktails and wine.
author: Andrew G.

description: Coqueta is a good place to bring a sexy woman for date, but diners beware, if she's a little over weight, she might get offended because the portions are a bit on the small side. My date thought I brought her here, so she can shed a few pounds with the small amount of food they offer. After I bought her some booze she started to mellow out a bit and we both enjoyed the remainder of our date. Anyway, we both had the pleasure to enjoy the beet salad, grilled octopus, and the paella for two, which was more for one person. I recommend this place, but just don't go when you're really hungry.
author: Kris S.

description: Love this place! Went on a Thursday and sat in the bar area. We ordered a bunch of different tapas and wine and it was delicious.  Great atmosphere.  Will defintely be going back!!
author: Laura R.

description:
This place is fantastic.  A group of us came here for lunch and tried many of their dishes.  Each dish was different and very tasty.  I noticed the food was cooked using a wood burning stove - AMAZING!

Service was great, drinks (mojito/sangria) was good and refreshing, and their dessert was phenomenal.  Definitely coming back!!!!!
author: Cliff H.

description: The food at Coqueta was very disappointing. We ordered multiple tapas from the patatas bravas to the grilled octopus, and all the pintxos but nothing we ordered memorable or worth ordering again. If you're hoping to experience a little of San Sebastian in SF, you'll be sorely disappointed.  It is a beautiful spot though...
author: Corinne O.

description: Mediocre at best. Cool location and ambiance. Unfortunately the food didn't live up to the hype. Was greeted by a rude host who was unapologetic in telling us our table wouldn't be ready for 45 minutes despite making the reservation a month in advance. I really wanted to like Coquetta but it was a disappointment. Would only go back or recommend it for a drink and the view.
author: Melissa B.

description: We discovered Coqueta within its first week of opening and immediately knew we had found a gem in San Francisco. We are tequila and Mezcal advocates so this spot is like heaven us. The sunny side up huevo is insanely delicious. I could easily have that item every day of my life. The ambiance is earthy, and rustic with a Spanish chalet elegance. Very well done. The creativity of the menu in both the food and beverage sides was well thought out. It's a perfect haven for sophisticated relaxation with an urban flair in the heart of the city.
author: Shannon M.

description: for being tapas food okay but drinks  but I didn't like waiter Michael not the best Custmor service. when we are order just little bit of food he stated" if I ate before I came in. what was that. so I don't recommend this place
author: Roberta G.

description:
Love this place! 2nd time there with a consistent experience.  First, I screwed up the reservations, but the lovely hostesses were so nice to accommodate us anyway at a very nice table and avoid a potential "dog house" situation with my wife & 2 girls. THANK YOU ladies.

Next, the food was fantastic!  Can't go wrong with anything on the menu, but definitely try the paella.  The wines (reds/port) were great and my wife couldn't stop the flow of sangria.  The flan and churros were also a crowd pleaser with the kids.

Most of all...the service is FIRST CLASS from the entire staff.   Sarah (waitress) was fabulous. Very attentive and just nice people at this place. Clearly a well managed team.

THANK YOU for a perfect experience for my family. Can't wait to come back.
rg
author: Ryan G.

description: Beautifully presented tapas that are also delicious. The Pinxtos skewers are beautiful and delicious. Interesting flavor and texture combinations. The paella has just the right amount of crispy rice and is perfectly seasoned.  Excellent service.
author: Karen M.

description: First of all, the small plates are SO small you have to order 6-8 to feel full. Secondly, the shrimp was delivered with feces.. What high end place doesn't devein their shrimp?! #livid
author: Chris S.

description: everything micheal does is outstanding even if it is just a awesome cocktail with micheal"s spin on it. don"t miss his mew place in back of bottega in yountville called ottimo you won"t want to go home.
author: Geri M.

description: My new favorite tapas place. Came here and sat facing the kitchen. It was amazing watching them at work and the food was simply incredible. Started with the wood grilled octopus, chicken and English pea croquetas, and grilled albondigas. It was the most tender and well seasoned octopus I've ever had. The duck and pork meatballs were very flavorful as well. For the main dish, we got the paella to share. It took about 30-40 minutes because they make each one individually but the timing worked out perfectly with the tapas. The paella portion was generous with a good variety of prawns, clams, mussels and chorizos. I can't wait to return and try the other dishes. On the top of my list is to try their bone in ribeye!
author: Peggy L.

description:
The flavor is definitely a five star and service was great too. The only reason I give them a 4 not 5 is that the portions are way too small. I understand the concept of tapas and been to Spain but it's pricey to the portions provided on the plate. 
Finally; a good selection of drinks and pleasant atmosphere not too noisy or loud.
author: Hib.zi R.

description:
The vibe, food and service all rock at this new awesome place. Don't miss out!

Be sure to order the manchega cheesecake pops!
author: Vicki L.

description: Just had an IPA, stopped here while walking down the embarcadero on a sunny day in Fransisco. Great location. Slow service. Place looks fancy.
author: Nikhil G.

description: lunch on friday. restaurant has very nice decor, and amazing views of the bay.  3 of us walked in 15min early for our reservation and hostess tells us our table is not ready but a bigger one is, but we only have an hour to eat there. huh?  we agree, with the dream of this bigger table with a time limit.  fail. it was the smallest table in the room. huh again? we ask the hostess about her offer and she says our table is big....it was literally a tiny table meant for 2, fine. we just want lunch. food was good tho - the paella was tasty, tho bit oily. octopus was the table favorite.  waiter was not pleasant and asking for water was painful, but the food was good overall. don't know if it's worth coming back since so many places in the city to eat, but if on the embarcadero and looking for a pricey meal that is good and don't care about service, then this place is ok. sadly, i give 3 stars since my wife is still upset about arguing whether a table is big or small - damn election season!
author: Roy N.

description: It was ok.   I thought a bit overpriced for the quality of food.  The service was irritating.  They wanted us out and kept asking if finished our plates all the time. We end up ordering more wine just to get them off our backs.  In my mind if I leave $100 for dinner Saturday night I should be able to enjoy it at least for an hour.
author: Vita P.

description: It feels so good to have a piece of Madrid here. Everything is perfect. Food is great, tempranillo is great, view is great, music is great. My favorite spot in town
author: Fernando Y.

description: Wow, nice place to hang out. The margaritas are delicious (try the conquistador) ! We tried the croquettes and little potatoes for tapas - they were great! It has an awesome view of the embarcadero and the pier. The only downside is that it's kinda small in the open area. So finding seats can be a little tricky.
author: Rehan Y.

description:
I had a lunch at this restaurant yesterday. Ordered a Paella, House red wine, and green olives. 

The food was a complete disaster. It is so salty and there was a few shrimps, two small Manila clams, couple of thin sliced sausages. The worst paella I had over the last 30 years. Wine was good and the location is for tourist.

If you are looking for a place to enjoy an authentic Spanish food, do not go there.
author: Youngsoo R.

description:
A friend of mine was able to snag a 5:30 on a Sunday "Early Bird Special" reservation, so I went along.  We were excited to taste for ourselves what the hype was about, hearing it was great from a friend who'd been twice in one week already.  

When we sat down, we were greeted by our server who seemed to have trouble annunciating, which made it hard to understand her though out the evening.  Strange.  Anywho, after perusing the menu and having a hard time deciding because everything sounded so good, we started with the chef's selection of meats and cheeses.  It was a pretty great board with lots to choose from.  Next came the grilled octopus, which was done as well as I've ever had it, but then the disappointing papas fritas, which were basically 8 fancy "tots" at about a buck a piece.  We also tried the asparagus (don't bother) and pallela, which was yummy though with overly greasy rice. 

Right around this time, Michael C himself sauntered into the joint and we soon discovered it was because some of San Francisco society socialites (BARF!) had just walked in.  Note to self, if you want any special attention from the exec chef, be a Traina.  We requested MC swing by our table to say hello, but in the 20 minutes that transpired afterwards, he never bothered.  Too bad because one of the people I was dining with buys out fancy restaurants for a living.  Just goes to show you never know who you are snubbing off.

We tried a couple desserts and decided, overall, with or without MC in the building, the food was good, not great.  Maybe people are star struck by having a brand new celeb chef destination in SF, but we are not in a rush to return.  Unless the Trainas adopt us in the meantime, then I'd want to go back to get the five star attention.
author: e w.

description: Just loved this little place. Food, wine and service were excellent. The humongous rib eye was beyond amazing and the meatballs were perfection. When in the city I wouldn't miss this authentic and well done restaurant. The atmosphere is what I'd describe as "rustic, community ". Great old world feel but with an upbeat & chic vibe.
author: Dina T.

description: The food, ambiance, and service was ridiculously fantastic!  I would like to repeat what many have said in the previous reviews about the Gin and Tonics, the tapas including the squid, potatoes, cheese plate, desserts and so on were delicious.  The view of the Bay is always a crowd pleaser. Timing with food, drinks, and questions by our server seemed almost rhythmic.  I plan to bring all friends that I really like here. I may even dine alone it was that good.
author: Kathy J.

description: I really wanted to like this place based on how much we enjoy Bottega. The space is extremely cramped. My husband and I both had our seats bumped regularly throughout the evening. Perhaps we have become spoiled by all the yummy Jose Garces tapas we've enjoyed on the East Coast. It was hard to find things on the menu we were actually excited to eat. It also felt like the staff was trying to up-sell / nickel and dime us. They were pushing us to order expensive wine, charged us when we ordered extra bread and even charged us for a dessert they brought us that we never ordered. With all the amazing dining spots in the Bay area, this one is worth skipping.
author: Mia C.

description:
Our family just celebrated our daughter's birthday here and loved every minute of it. From the drinks at the bar to the final fork-full the whole experience was wonderful. We got several of the "toothpick appetizers", grilled squid, chicken croquets... the paella... Everything was just wonderful.
I have to say that my favorite part was our waiter and actually the entire wait staff. They were all knowledgable and made us feel wonderful and made my daughter feel so special.
I would go back for the food and the drinks (go for the pitcher) and to leave the wait staff a HUGE tip.
author: Fred M.

description: Know what was the most interesting thing about this place, was the creativity and imagination Chef put into his menu. The flavors were on point. Had a very nice time. Would have enjoyed a more attentive wait staff.... The fifth STAR goes to ASHLEY!!!!
author: JA M.

description: This was a great treat! The tapas were amazing, and Alley really made our anniversary dinner, one to remember. The atmosphere is quaint, with a rustic modern vibe. Highly recommend.
author: Courtney S.

description:
Do not waste your time -- literally.   
We waited over thirty minutes for our table (for which we had a reservation) only to be seated next to a very large very loud party that made conversation impossible.
The management made zero effort to make things right for our inconvenience. 
Food was good - but nothing too exciting -- and was a bit pricey given the small servings.
MANY better choices in our neighborhood. Leave this one to the tourists.
author: david o.

description: I love pork, I love coqueta! the pork shoulder is my favorite pork dish in city now - i would tattoo a pig on me but not a cow nor a chicken.   I also loved the sunny side up egg hot tapas.   The sticks are not as tasty as it looks - I'd rather eat a macaroon for the same price.
author: Wakako U.

description: I had a lovely time here. The food and drinks were creative and beautifully presented. It's a nice setting.
author: J P.

description: All I will say is: the attitude behind the kitchen matters. Although there are some great Chefs that have passed through Coqueta, I cannot help but taste the greed in their food. I worked here for a long period of time, and it was the worst job I ever had. I came in to eat multiple times, and couldn't help but leave dissatisfied. Support a restaurant that treats their workers well. For the price, might as well go to Foreign Cinema.
author: Jack J.

description: Enjoyed a very lovely dinner here. This is a tapas bar - the menu had a nice selection of warm and cold dishes. I really liked the "bikini" plate with goat cheese and honey, the open faced plate with a fried egg was great, sausages great, we also ordered a steak plate that was so tasty, meat cooked perfectly medium. This place is small, suggest reservations. And the noise level is high, especially in the smaller bar area that is external to the main dining room. That area was elbow to elbow and very loud. Despite the crowd, our waiter was awesome, in a good mood, made good suggestions, knew the food well, and he never rushed us. Service was awesome, well done.
author: Shelley C.

description: The sangria & meatballs were epic, has an amazing experience here and can't wait to return. Be careful everything food & drink here is delicious!
author: B S.

description:
Made a reservation 2 weeks ahead for a table (weekday), got there few minutes early and was seated at the bar. They didn't even ask if we'd like to wait for a table or be seated at the bar immediately. At least give us that option. 

Hostess gave me and my boyfriend a head-to-toe-why-are-you-dressed-like-that look. Yeah, we were both under-dressed (with jeans, t-shirts, hoodies, and tennis shoes for our all-day touristy walk in the area). We didn't have time to change, but please don't treat us like we're second-class citizens. 

Boyfriend got their Sangria, didn't like it at all. I got The Sun Never Sets, yummy and pretty. Food was good--Patatas bravas, Croquetta de pollo, Albondigas a la Feria, Salmon Ahumado, Ensalada de Kale, and Setas al ajillo (which our waiter forgot and brought after we asked for it again). He gave us free dessert.. the cheesecake lollipop thingy (delicious!) for not getting a table as we requested. 

I'll come back again when we're visiting, but next time, I'm dressing up like Rihanna in swarovski dress!
author: Hun K.

description: Great service!!!  Awesome outdoor bar area! :-) Disappointed in the food, though - we ordered almost everything on the menu, and I only liked the peppers and meatballs.  I'm a total foodie.  So maybe I'm just spoiled by all the other amazing restaurants in SF :/
author: Deanna T.

description: I've been here a few times, now.  The food is very tasty, if Americanized.  I would call it Spanish-style, rather than Spanish. Seriously, I want bacalao at a Spanish restaurant.  There is a good wine selection.  Last night we were a group of four.  After grabbing cocktails in the bar area, we nabbed a couple of pintxos each.  We then ordered a selection of hot and cold tapas, finished with a cheese plate.  In no particular order, brocollini, kale salad, pulpo, chicken/pea croquetas, albondigas (2 orders, they were so nice), roasted brussels sprouts, and a fun play on smoked salmon, on toasted bread, a little cream cheese, a few drops of truffle oil (not really a tapa, it takes a few bites).  It is overpriced, for sure.  However, my guests and I had a good time. A nice spot on the Embarcadero.
author: Laura H.

description: We arrived early for our reservation & were offered a seat at the chefs bar instead of waiting. I am so very happy that occurred! We got to watch the chefs prepare the food and they answered all of the 100's of questions we had on everything they were preparing with no hesitation. We ordered 7-8 dishes and they were all AMAZING! The only dish I didn't care for were the deviled eggs, which normally I love. The grilled octopus was delightful & tender. The chicken croquets were to die for & the kale salad I couldn't get enough of!! Also, the manchego cheesecake was one of the best desserts I've eaten in a long time! Now for our drinks... I ordered the barca gintonic and I can truly say it is the best gin drink I've ever had! Refreshing, crisp, light, and beautiful to look at. Next, our waiter.... I feel terrible for not remembering his name, I think maybe Patrick. (He looked like the new superman and was a former flight attendant) He truly made our experience an outstanding one, and as a business owner myself, I believe that your staff is everything! So thank you all for outstanding dining experience on our trip to San Fran!
author: Tracy L.

description: Oh my. One of my favs. Drinks are a little on the sweet side, but the food is amazing. Main dining room is beautiful. The copper cups are the only thing I don't like about this place. Everything else I love. Reservations a must for the dining room.
author: Food L.

description:
Apparently, this is one of the hottest new places in the city.  So, my friend made a lunch reservation to ensure we got a table when we went last week.  Upon arrival, the hostess seated us at the bar, not a table.  When we asked if we could get a table, many of which were open, we were informed that those were all reserved for people who made reservations earlier.  We asked the hostess to double check and we were again informed in a dismissive way that only the bar was available. We sat at the bar, had a very pleasant waitress, and a good meal.
However, the hostess' attitude affected our experience and through our meal we noticed that there were open tables.  We also noticed that in addition to us, there were only two other people of color in the restaurant.
C'mon Coqueta, this is San Francisco in 2014.  Ditch the attitude, the hostess, or both.  You've lost the business of an executive at a nearby company with lots of potential customers
author: Michael K.

description: Excellent food and service. Domenic went above and beyond to make sure we were happy. Best restaurant in San Fran. Unbelievable menu and presentation. Highly recommend.
author: Sal F.

description: Very cool environment, we ate in the bar area which is a patio bar, but it gave you the illusion that you were inside because of the nice table and light fixtures. The tapas were great, the server was very knowledgeable and could pair food very well. The drinks were great, complex cocktails that excited the palette. Highly Recommend this restaurant.
author: David W.

description:
The food here is absolutely amazing. We came with a party of 6 and ordered many tapas and family entrees to share. Out waitress, Shelby, was very helpful suggesting quantities to order for our party size and she was spot on. 
We started off with some pintxos - tiny and I mean tiny bite size appetizers. They bring them out to you on a platter to pick which ones you would like. 
We ordered a lot of tapas. The croquetas were amazing!  The patatas bravas were good, I've had better in France, but they were good. Also on out tapas list were the delicious pork and duck albondigas (meatballs), very flavorful octopus - awesome!!!, and a crispy shrimp pancake. 
From the "entrees" we got two orders of the Iberian pork to share - it was absolutely delicious. It was perfectly good and the season was wonderful. We also got the fish, which was so good - it melted in your mouth. The mushrooms were delicious as was the asparagus. 
Of course, we saved room for dessert. The chirps were awesome - we went through three servings. My kids couldn't get enough of those. We also tried the gazpacho, which was entertaining for the kids. They use liquid nitrogen at the table to free strawberries and then let you eat them. Then vapor comes out of your mouth and nose and the kids thought that was so cool. Ok so did the adults ;).  We also got two orders of the ice cream sandwich, which is a small bite but tastes good.
The good was great, the beverages were good and it has a warm fun atmosphere. The staff was extremely friendly which sealed the deal. 
Definitely will go back for another special occasion. It's not priced for every day eating, more like for a treat.
author: Isabelle B.

description:
We were here with a group of 4 couples to celebrate a birthday and it was a perfect place for a birthday dinner. Our friend made the reservation on Open Table and the only opening was for 5:30 on a Tuesday! I could see why reservations might be hard to come by as the restaurant is small - though really beautiful, with the open kitchen in the middle of the main dining room and gorgeous views of the water. Dress code is casual - walking in in jeans and sneakers is no problem, but dressing up for fun is fine too.

The service was friendly and helpful in guiding us on what to order, how much for our group, etc.  We did get a pitcher of sangria and a pitcher of sherry mojito - light, fruity, and refreshing - our group is not much for drinking, but everyone enjoyed it.

It seemed like almost everything we ordered was really delicious - the sunny-side up huevos with shrimp, the chicken and pea croquettes, the grilled octopus were our favorite tapas and a must-try. The kale salad and chard - were just OK. The uni open faced sandwich was good too  - but when considering how expensive it was it was two tiny circles of toast with uni and proscitto, just a bit bigger than a bagel bite, I don't think I would order that one again! We ordered two plates of each tapa so our group of 8 could try everything. Our main entrees were the 1) ribeye - so juicy and amazing, they bring out the ginormous gorgeous meat before cutting it so we can see it in it's full glory, a showstopper entree, 2) the pork pluma with honey-chili glaze - my favorite but the bigger pieces were just too rare for me and we sent half of it back to be seared which they did with a smile (thankful the waitstaff was down to earth and did not try to shame us for not digging extra rare pork - no matter what the pig's pedigree), and 3) the paella  - beautiful but at that point we were all stuffed and don't think we could really appreciate how good it was.

For dessert we got the churros and flan. Maybe I am crazy but I liked the flan more! I just don't know if these fancy churros with chocolate dipping sauce are really better than Disneyland churros...It was good - but again, may not have been able to really appreciate it since I was so stuffed.

In short - amazing food, beautiful restaurant, and a perfect place to celebrate with friends. I would not come here as a couple on a date night - you won't get to have a real tapas experience and try a bit of everything. I would also not come here except for special occasions - just too pricey! But for a special event - it is perfect.
author: Michael H.

description:
The wife and I had booked it for Anniversary #49 - our reservation was for 8:15.  We got there a couple of minutes early and we were told that our table would be available in five minutes.  That apparently depended on the previous diners leaving their table - they had already paid the bill.  Half an hour later, we were still on seated.  We had ordered glasses of wine which were delivered, but there was no comfortable place to wait.  We called our favorite Spanish place Piperade, and they had a table (just several blocks away) so we left, having not gotten to sample their food.  

On the positive side, and the reason I gave them two rather than one star, they comped the wine and as we were leaving, the GM ran out on to the street and apologized.

It probably isn't the perfect place for old fogies like us celebrating an anniversary - it's a very young and boistrous crowd, particularly on a Friday night.  I doubt we'll try it again.
author: Larry H.

description:
This place is extremely overrated. I like trying new places around the city and was excited to go to Coqueta for my birthday. We made a reservation well in advance.

My boyfriend and I got seated at the bar overlooking the kitchen- I'm sure that's normal or maybe we should've requested a table, but that was fine. What I didn't like about sitting at the bar is that the waiters are too busy attending to everyone else at the tables, that we hardly got any attention toward the beginning. The drinks took wayyyy too long to arrive and they didn't even live up to the hype. Later on, I think the waiter realized what a dismal job he was doing with service and gave us free drinks and dessert, which made it slightly better.

The food- the appetizer meats and paella were great. The croquetas were average in taste and were barely warm when they were brought to us. We were brought what I assumed was my "birthday" cake with "Happy Anniversary" lettering on it. I thought it was funny at the time, but come on.

Maybe I need to go back and try other dishes, but then they also need to double their staff. If you're looking for a nice tapas-style place to dine, I recommend Gitane instead.
author: Clarissa B.

description: If we could give this place 10 stars we would...the drinks were yummy, as was the food and as was the server Scotty!  Had the Barca Gintonic and it was mixed perfectly with the flavors that just blended so well, the ending of Arroz Cremeso de Verano and Albondigas a la Feria was the perfect ending to all of our bites, until we were offered a bite of heaven, Manchego Cheesecake with caramel popcorn...the perfect ending off our lunch...if I lived in SF I would be here weekly...this is the place to go!  And ask for Scotty...he is a gem of a server and equally with great knowledge of the food he serves!
author: Lynda G.

description:
Yum! Coqueta was so delicious. The restaurant is beautiful - located right on the water with a cute little bar area in what looks like a converted greenhouse. Between three people, we shared the following: 

Jamon serrano: Really good, comes with little biscuits as well. The perfect balance of smoky and salty
House-cured white anchovies: Not a fan. My brother loves anchovies, so he really enjoyed the dish. I never really like anchovies, so my review on this dish is definitely skewed
Pan con tomate: good, but not spectacular. It was basically two small slices of bread with an oil/tomato paste. 
Smoked salmon: My favorite dish! I would describe these as mini bagel bites. They are little round crispy bagels (basically) smothered with fresh cheese, drizzled with honey, and topped with layers of delicious smoked salmon. I could eat 20 of these. 
Patatas bravas: Deep fried potatoes...what else do you really need to know? It's hard to mess these up
Chicken and English pea croquetas: These were my second favorite. Imagine chicken pot pie, but instead of a pastry shell you have a breadcrumb/fried coating
Wood-grilled octopus: Super tender octopus with fingerling potatoes. This was a great dish, but by this point I had eaten so many potatoes. 
Flan: So delicious :D I love flan! This was a super rich and creamy flan topped with huckleberry compote. I would definitely recommend this as the finishing touch to your meal

Overall, I would have given Coqueta 5 stars but the portions are just too tiny! I understand that this is tapas style, but I would have liked to receive a bit more per plate.
author: Anna N.

description: Another lovely romantic restaurant. Getting reservations here is a little ridiculous but I enjoyed the food. The pinxtos were tasty and artfully prepared. We tried 2 of each and I believe there were 6 different pintos to try. The cocktails here were amongst the best I've had at any restaurant. I will definitely be back just to hang out with friends and enjoy the awesome painstakingly prepared drinks! They were that good! The view is nice since it is conveniently located on the embarcadero on top of the water.
author: Steve L.

description: Great atmosphere in a great location, but other than that I was very disappointed. The food wasn't horrible, but there are tons of better tapas places in SF that are half the price. Also, don't try to make a reservation here, I made reservations at 8 PM, the place had a few open tables but I had to wait until 8:30 to get seated. Spend your money elsewhere there are a ton of great places along the Embarcadero.
author: Ajay N.

description:
I was looking forward to eating here and came with some girlfriends for a birthday celebration.  I had made early reservations by phone, we came on time, and there were several open tables available.  Unfortunately we were seated at the bar, on wobbly uncomfortable seats, where it was difficult for us to talk.  We asked if we could move to one of the open tables but were told it was a busy night with a tight schedule and those tables were reserved (we had reservations, too!).

As for the food, we enjoyed the sangria and the albondigas (duck and pork meatballs), but the wood-grilled octopus was so-so and a bit burnt.  The paella, which I was really looking forward to was sorely lacking in ingredients--we ate a little over half of it and were left with a pan of just rice.  It was a disappointing experience, and I won't be back.
author: C C.

description: Good ambience, great smells from the kitchen & great drinks menu. I enjoyed the shrimp & sunny side up, olives, chicken and pea croquettes, cauliflower and cheeseboard. Excellent espresso.
author: Barry O.

description:
Good place to take some foodie visitors, especially when it's nice out along the Embarcadero.

That being said, I don't understand how people can justify dining here regularly.  The portions are teeny and overpriced, even for tapas.  A reasonably-priced meal here will not fill you up if you come hungry.

My favorites were the chicken and English pea croquetas, calamari (much more flavorful than the grilled octopus), and the duck/pork meatballs.

The honey-chili glazed pork shoulder loin was delicious but cost $38 for 7 bite-sized slices of meat =\ not worth it.

There were bugs flying around our faces and food throughout the meal, but otherwise, the interior is beautiful.
author: S L.

description: We had dinner at Coqueta for our first anniversary on Christmas eve. The food and drinks were great! My husband had the gin and tonic drink and I had the Galleon (sp?), both were great, I highly recommend them. We ordered a few plates of tapas, my husband loved the shrimp with chorizo. I really enjoyed the chicken fritters type thing. For dessert, we had the churros with chocolate syrup and they were absolutely delicious. Our waiter was great as well, he recommended the drinks and food and we were not disappointed, he was very attentive.
author: Navjot K.

description:
Enjoyed a very nice dinner at Coqueta. Service is very good, atmosphere is excellent... especially the moderate noise level. Location on great on at Pier 5 is also nice. Basically, a worthy place to dine - you won't be disappointed.

The food was superb - high quality, authentic, and delicious. Enjoyed the fried  brussels sprouts, patatas, pork and duck meatballs, and branzino. The cocktails are excellent too- recommend the Galleon.
author: Tracey P.

description: Love this restaurant, this time we made a reservation and had a table , everything on the menu is delicious .
author: Johnny A.

description: I double checked that there were no nuts besides almonds in the sauce for the asparagus dish. It turns out that there were hazelnuts & I had an allergic reaction because I am allergic to nuts besides almonds. They need to be more aware of allergies and not take it lightly. I was pretty upset about that. We did get the lunch for free and they were very apologetic.
author: Piya M.

description:
This place is absurd.

Noisy, full of second tier wannabes staring in confusion at the pricey, complex faux-MexTech menu. After a weird dim sum offering of toothpicked pigeon eggs and other tiny items (you are charged for each toothpick-beware!), and numerous odd little plates of TINY everything, potatoes, carrots etc etc.,  we were FINALLY presented with a sliver of fish for 6 people and a pretty good gumbo that brought a welcome sigh of relief (and a restrained, but erstwhile battle for our fair shares). And we're FRIENDS!!

$249 before tip for 6 (no drinks beyond great ice water ) for "I'm still ravanous" food is pretty cheeky, but SF nouveax love this sort of thing. SADLY.

Try The Waterfront next door....a really fine spot.
author: Pete G.

description:
We expected probably too much. But it is Michael Chiarello after all and we are big fans.
Had a late reservation and that is probably not good. They were out of branzino and crab mains. Only 2 others remain then. One  32 oz steak and a pasta/shrimp dish.
Anyway we tried more tapas instead. Tortilla Andres was excellent but the crispy shrimp was overly fried and a bit bitter on the outside. Then we were told they were also out of calamari.How can you be out of 3 dishes in one night?
Then we tried the gambas which unfortunately tasted slightly chemical. The vegetable side dish was ok but nothing noteworthy.
Cheeses were also fine but the slightly sweetened cracker with it was not to my liking.We asked for extra toast and were charged 2.00 for it.
The chocolate dessert takes 20 min to make..It was also just ok.
Nice and hip interior, great job on that. Great bar  area ,too.

Service was fine. The Spanish whites we had were excellent (250ml ,not by the glass) but then I asked for red wine, my friend for another white. The server must not have been thinking and poured the new white in my old white which still had some in it(diff variety). After I told him( he didn't even notice) the mistake was quickly corrected and I got some more of my old white back.

A bit of a nightmare. But will try it again after all the hype has died down, hopefully 2 months or so.
Lots of potential here for sure but it needs much more attention.
author: Maria C.

description: Great food, great service, and great overall experience! The plate with shrimp, egg, and potato strings was excellent, the skewer with chorizo was amazing...and their sangria was like drinking Christmas! Thank You!
author: Tara C.

description:
I was really hoping this place was going to be great & I love his other restaurants.  The space is beautiful, inviting and in a great location.  

As for the food, everything just tasted okay with most of the flavors just missing the mark.  The sangria was very watered down and tasteless.  We had to send it back twice. 

We were there for lunch but the bar area looked like it could be a very fun happy hour spot.
author: John C.

description: Food was excellent - lots of variety and flavors. They even accommodated vegetarians   and gluten sensitive guest.    We practically had everything off the menu.  Service staff was attentive there was never an empty glass of water or wine.
author: Trisha M.

description:
I have never written a Yelp review before this one. I went to Coqueta last night with two other friends and was very disappointed with the service. As I read the other 1 star reviews, it describes perfectly what we experienced last night. Food wasn't great, super overpriced and we were treated like they didn't want us there. We had made a reservation a month in advance for 5:15pm. If they are going to seat us at the counter, they should've told us that when we made the reservation (we made the reservation via a phone call). There were open tables which we asked to be moved to but they continued to say it was reserved for others. Not sure why others could reserve tables and we could not. 

I will definitely NOT be going back nor will I recommend this restaurant to anyone!
author: Juliet P.

description: Great tapas but perhaps a little on the pricy side.  We arrived a little early but were seated promptly and served by a very friendly waitress. She recommended six dishes for the two of us which we very much enjoyed. Only confusing part of our experience was when the manager came to our table and offered what we thought were meal samples but we ended up getting charged for them. None the less, good food, great room and great service. Definitely worth a visit.
author: Farsh K.

description: The smoked salmon for starters is a good choice. The paella is worth the wait. Takes about 30 mins. The drinks are quite nice too if youre looking for something fresh and different. The ambiance is really cozy and the lighting is perfect for date night. Our server for the night was Shelby and she was quite the character - very helpful and gave us great suggestions on what to order since it was our first time here. Would definitely go again :)
author: Christian M.

description:
Our recent experience at Coqueta was extremely disappointing. Having dined there on numerous occasions and previously enjoyed good food and attentive service, we were astonished by the poor treatment we experienced on our last visit.
 
We reserved a table a month in advance and after traveling a great distance, upon arrival we were escorted to the counter. My girlfriend was in a full leg brace and it was obvious she couldn't sit on a tall stool up against counter without room for her leg. When I pointed out to Antonio that I didn't ask for a counter seat and needed my reservation for a table honored to allow her to sit down, he simply informed me "This is all there is."  That was the extent of his interest and his attempts to resolve the situation and accommodate our needs. When I emphasized that she was unable to bend her knee and needed a chair, not the cramped counter, Antonio responded "I don't have a table for you." His arrogance and insensitivity was shocking. 
 
Needless to say, we did not dine there and left the restaurant very frustrated with the way we were treated and how badly this was handled. Coqueta has lost me as a customer!
author: Frank P.

description: This place never lets me down.. Small place yes.. But all the walls are glass. Allowing for great seats everywhere.. Attention to detail is certainly top priority from the really cool "put  that drinking cup" in your pocket kind of thing.. Drink menu is always changing.. Try not to get too attached to one drink.. It will change but change is good. Parking is usually not a problem. Pretentious? Yes.. But only with the customers. Servers are 2 legit 2 quit.
author: Chris L.

description:
3.5 stars.  5 for atmosphere / 4.5 for staff (aside from waitress) / 3 for food / 2 for prices.  Being huge fans of Bottega (where we ate the night before), we had high expectations for Coqueta, but have to say food was just okay for the money.  Being right on the water the space has a great feel and the staff in general was great, but from the second you walk in you feel like you are being nickel and dimed for everything (which is the opposite of Bottega).  We went expecting to drop a bomb on food as that was kind of the point of this splurge trip to San Francisco, so didn't mind the high menu prices, but rather the way things were forced on you.  For instance, as soon as you sit down they bring you a tray with about 2 dozen "bite sized skewers" (Pintxos) which they present as an amuse-bouche (which is almost expected at nicer restaurants these days); however, once you take one, waitress explains they are $2.50 each (really not worth it for food that has just been sitting out and visited every table in restaurant...ick....and yes, I have spent time in Spain, where this is done at bars, but this just feels wrong). 
Moving on, we each ordered about 2 Tapas plates (there were 4 of us) and Paella....we were going to add on more but waitress said it would be plenty of food.  Since on the topic of pricing, I have to jump forward to our bill before covering food flavor.  When we got our bill we were surprised to to see that we had been charged extra for every single dish...presumably to make it split-able for 4 people....the problem is that the waitress made no mention of this and we did not tell her we wanted to split the dishes (in fact some of the dishes were for certain people as other people at table had food issues and could not split).  It would have been totally been fine if she mentioned this, but instead just decided to add this to our bill which just seemed slimy.
Okay, so onto the food.
Croquetas De Pollo:  Tasty fried croquettes....hard to screw up something like this so obviously good.
Gambas al Negor:  Very good and has a nice kick to it with the pepper.
Totillita de Camaron: Everyone felt this was okay but not great.
Pulpo a la Parilla:  The grilled octopus was highlight of entire meal and wish I just ordered several plates of it.  It was perfectly cooked and melts in your mouth.
Albondigas a la Feria: The duck meatballs just felt kind felt kind of flat.  Maybe it was that the cherry sauce was too weak....raspberry would make it a million times better.
Patatas Xips e Salsa Apertivo: The chips are great, but $7 for 6 small potato chips is just ridiculous (this should be something they just include with the meal).
Huevos Nacional: Great presentation and overall taste, but the bonito essentially tastes like chicken of the sea.
Esparrago Trigeros con Remesco: excellent flavor and taste.
Ensalada de Remolacha:  good, but ridiculously small serving size.
Paella: Says it serves 2-3, but really the seafood is about enough for 1.5, and the rice is for 3.  It was okay, but dry and really not any better than any standard corner Spanish restaurant (which we have a lot of in NYC).

By the way, the Sangria is really nice and light and refreshing.

In summary, it is good and has a great atmosphere, but we weren't blown away and while we expected to spend a lot, felt deceived by how hidden costs were added to the bill.

Finally, I have to say that  I am impressed with how present Michael Chiarello is at his restaurants.  He was at Coqueta greeting people when we were there, and has been doing the same thing at Bottega 3 of the 4 times we have been there....I rarely see the owners at the big name restaurants in NYC.
author: Jonathan H.

description: Great food and great service. Everything we had was perfectly cooked from the grilled octopus, to steamed mussels. The Gambas--gulf prawns--were our favorite. DElish. And again, perfectly cooked.
author: Ali A.

description: Great Moscow Mule's! Food recommendations: Amazing Grilled Octopus, Chicken Croquettes, Ribeye Steak, and there was some type of Chorizo/Egg dish was quite tasty. My only complaint is the uncomfortable seating arrangements. It was very tight, and I constantly hitting knees with the person next to me.Overall I highly recommend!
author: Jenna S.

description: Just drinks. It was a full house and I liked how the bar and dining are separated. It has a nice ambience and fun drinks with pretty presentations!
author: Zara S.

description:
Went here on Valentine's Day, so they may have been a bit overwhelmed, but that does not excuse the poor treatment. Staff and host did nothing to accommodate our requests. Despite having a reservation, we were seated at the bar and when we asked to sit on chairs, were told "that's not possible." Several times during the meal, our requests, such as for drinks or to order more food, were ignored or put off for ten minutes or more. At one point we asked for another piece of bread to finish off the  cheese plate. After asking a second time 15 minutes later, we were given a plate of bread and charged for it.

The food was tasty and featured interesting combinations, but was overpriced and served in extremely small portions, even for tapas. 

Would not come back.
author: Timothy J.

description: A nice tapas place to hit after the Exploratorium.  Upbeat vibe.  Nice tapas.  My 11 year old daughter and I came here for lunch and she liked the view and the food!
author: James B.

description:
You will love Coquetta if:
-you don't mind waiting 30 minutes to 1 hour for a reservation you made 3 weeks earlier, in person!
-requested the dining room by the window & arrive an hour earlier (as instructed), when the hostess tries to seat you in the bar & refuses to even try to honor the seating request-you end up at a table by the door
-the manager asks how the experience was (oops) and when you tell him you didn't like waiting a half hour, he says "don't feel bad-we've got people with reservations waiting over an hour"
-you like red wine served COLD
-enjoy paying $2.50 for a toothpick

No one is managing this restaurant....there is a skill and talent to management, sadly they don't have it!
author: Peppermint P.

description:
1.They have the best Paella rice dish I've ever had in my Life.  Soooo damn good and they have a unique shrimp in it too that I've never seen before.
2. This restaurant is the first and only place I know that has Razor Clams.  Very unique and delicious.
3. This is the best Peruvian restaurant I've ever been to.
4. Good customer service.
author: Sandra L.

description: My favorite restaurant bar in the city.  Joe is so much fun to hang out with and the drinks are some of best I have ever had.
author: Anthony N.

description: Amazing dinner. Good and wine paired perfect. Great atmosphere, can't wait to get back.
author: Rob M.

description: Bloody Mary was just okay. Nothing special. Meat- cheese tray was very tasty. Had to pay extra for more crackers. Chef had a long beard which made the food unappetizing when watching from the chefs table.
author: los gatos l.

description: I want to start this review by saying that I am a food value person. I guess I should stay away from small plates restaurants. We sat outside on a wam day and felt the service was average at best. I loved the kale salad. But our chorizo artichoke appetizer was seriously two toothpicks worth of food for $7 - even though the menu says there are 3 toothpicks. Actually they call them skewers. Maybe I'll go back when I can order 10 things instead of 5.  And maybe I'll upgrade my review to 4 stars in exchange for the other toothpick... Don't get me wrong - what we had was delicious. Just not sure if it was worth the price...
author: Lori P.

description:
This place is wonderful ! One of the most pleasant lunches I've had in San Francisco. Not only is the place super stylish, but the service is absolutely perfect. Laid back and warm yet very elegant, we were truly well taken care of.

And of course the food is amazing, I would come here every day if I could. Just the carpaccio and sunny side up eggs are worth going there.

Probably my favorite restaurant in SF. Fairly priced if you're a group and don't go heavy on drinks !
author: C L.

description: Hubby & I had a good dinner on our last visit in May so we decide try again on July 16th. We arrived 7:55pm for 8pm reservation and hostess told us our table isn't ready so we went to the bar for a drink each. We had a bottle of 1978 Cab that decanted from 7am and put back into a bottle which I set on the bar front of me. 25min later we got to our table and manager told us that "I cannot let you have your wine when is opened already for liability reason". You telling me this now? Why not when we arrived? Hostess told me she wasn't aware of this it looks manager is only one know of this policy. Now, we set on the bar for 25 min with bottle front of me, both bartender, female and male didn't say anything and hostess didn't  say anything. No other restaurant have problem with it, Parallel 37, Ame, Bix, Zuni, Prospect even restaurants in Carmel and Lake Tahoe. You could of told me when we walked in not after waiting for 25 min!!! Let me put it this way to you, you are in HOSPITALITY business not to piss off your customer. You should take care of your local patrons. What are you going to do when there are no more tourist? I probably start going out to dinner before you were even born. We go out to dinner every Friday and Saturday no matter which Continent we are in but Coqueta will be the last one on our list, further, I will not recommend to anyone to dine at coqueta, no friends, no family members and for sure not our business associates. We went to Bix and had a wonderful dinner with our 1978 Spring mountain Cab. There!!!!!!!!
author: Kim M.

description: Simply the best Salmon Ahumado I've ever had, this is always the first stop on my list when entering the city! Chef's Table is the best, you get to see everything as it's passed from the kitchen into the dining room. Last week's visit was hands down the best visit we've had so far, and the cocktails were simply amazing as well. We usually go for lunch and its a bit $$$ for lunch but well worth it! There are always so many amazing spots on my list for visits to the city, but this is one place that I always insist on going to! One of my top 5 favorites in the city!
author: L B.

description:
I usually don't like tapas, but Coqueta doesn't just do the traditional old world tapas.  There's been a lot of hype surrounding this place on pier 5. The bar area is actually pretty big and had open seats when we arrived for our 8:30pm reservation on a Monday. Unfortunately, as the dining room is small and the previous party was lingering, we waited an additional 30 min for our table (some other people waiting way past the reservation time actually just took seats at the bar).

Drinks: loved their cocktails and also pitchers
- Tarriff: probably my favorite of the night - iberico ham infused gin, cava, acorn and apricot tonic
- Conquistador: fennel salt rim is a good match for the apple flavor
- Sun never sets: torched meringue and pineapple!
- Sangria pitcher: traditional, not too sweet
- Rebujito pitcher: not a huge cinnamon fan, but interesting
* The pitchers are fun because you can actually pour them directly into your mouth.  Drinks are pretty strong

Small plates:
- Stone fruit salad: loved the peach with queso fresco, crunch from the nuts
- Croquetas: warm, deep fried goodness that was crisp on the outside and basically like a chicken pot pie inside.  The heirloom tomatoes are a nice, sweet complement.
- Grilled octopus: wonderful charred flavor, tender, served with potatoes
- Sunny side up egg: with shrimp, potato, and chorizo dressing.  The yolk was nice and runny.. this would be awesome at brunch!
- Calamari: grilled whole with squid ink aioli and onion jam
- Gambas: head on, plump and super sweet, great flavor, and it came with toasted bread slices to soak up extra sauce 
- Crispy shrimp: a crisp deep fried pancake with lots I shrimp and topped with a yellow saffron aioli
- Albondigas: pork and duck meatballs, moist, loved the tart cherry puree on top
- Mar y montana: open faced iberico and uni sandwich: like an open faced slider, very rich with iberico and uni

Larger dishes:
- Pluma: pork shoulder, loved the sweet glaze, actually leaner than I expected 
- Paella: sort of had a crust, served in the traditional pan, takes 30-40 min to prepare, so you should order it early on

Desserts:
- They were able to make me affogato with a blue cheese ice cream, which was awesome 
- I can't really remember the last dessert we got... something with fruit..?  blame it on the drinks

It's a fun place for a group of 4-6 so that you can share pitchers and try lots of different dishes.  It's not cheap, but it's a nice change from all the new American farm to table places that are popping up everywhere in SF. The view of the bridge and water in the background are beautiful at night, too.
author: Marilyn T.

description: Went here Friday night after a conference downtown. They're open fairly late and the service is amazing! We started with a bottle of the 7 Fuentes wine, which was great. I've been wanting to try paella since I first learned of it as a child in my Spanish class. They prepare it a la carte and so you need to order it at the start of your visit. We ordered a few cheeses -- a goat cheese and a sheep cheese. It came served with some quince (I haven't found that anywhere! Last time I had it was in Europe), almonds and these beautiful sugar-crusted crispy flat breads. Everything tasted so beautiful together! Next came the mushrooms, which were such the perfect blend of a few, seasoned with garlic and just the right amount of heat, as well as these chicken and cheese bites. I think we were expecting a chicken "nugget" but were delightfully surprised at how they had shaped the chicken and bread crumbs around the cheese, which was perfectly melted and gooey inside. The orange pieces it was served with gave such a smooth and not-too-sweet finish to the bites. And then the paella came out. The rice was perfectly al dente and a beautiful gold from the saffron. The chorizo and seafood in it blended so beautifully together. We finished the evening with an order of churros (served with such a beautiful cacao sauce -- not too sweet, which we LOVED!) and an order of the manchego cheesecake lollipops. So much awesomeness! Our waiter was so great about making recommendations and he was incredibly sweet :) We will definitely be coming back here! I don't think you can go wrong with anything on the menu. Just delicious!
author: Butterfly D.

description:
Don't you just want to trash a celebrity chef restaurant? Show how much more you know? 

Not here. It's reaaaallyyy good. Tasty, fun, fresh. Vibrant bar scene.  Great place to take a date. Heck, take the wife on a date.

Very enjoyable in the sunshine at lunch - will be back for dinner.
author: Robert H.

description:
I don't know why everyone is raving about this place.  I found them to be consistently rude, from when I called to make a reservation, to the matre'd, to everyone in the place.  It feels like a typical hot restaurant that does not care about the patrons, but once they are not the newest greatest thing they will be kissing everyone's ass.
If you want to be treated like you do not matter and they are doing you a favor serving you.  If thats what you are looking for I recommend you go,otherwise avoid this place.
By the way, the food is very average and not that interesting.
author: Trevor S.

description:
Eh- not really all that impressed.

Expected waaaay more from a place that 'open' their reservations 1 month prior and all this 'talk'.

Made reservations, arrived....staff said that table was not ready, wait 15 minutes.  When we got seated, we were in a table clearly meant for 3, when we were 4.  Due to this, the ENTIRE remainder of the night the waitstaff kicked my chair EVERY SINGLE TIME they came to table....and not one of them even once apologized.  (I was slightly annoyed that we were not given a proper table for four since I had made the reservations 11am the first day I could.  I expect to be shoved into a corner as a 'walk-in').

We ordered:  

El Gran Plat Cap ($38), very good
Huevos Nacional ($7/two pieces, essentially paying $7 one egg), yuck!  Tasted like tuna/fish.
Coliflor con Romescu ($11), very good!
Pimientos de Padron ($10), good, just peppers with seasoning (can make at home)
Pulpo a la Parilla ($14), recommended by waitress, was ok.
Albondigas a la Feria ($14), good
Arroz Cremoso de Verano ($19), I enjoyed, friends did not.  Sizable portion.
Pluma ($38) - good but COMPLETELY overpriced.  We got 7 thin teeny slices, not like the pics other posted.  

Churro 'Fantasia, ($10), good
Manchego cheesecake ($4), very good

Plus we ordered some drinks, some wine and coffee.  Our bill was easily $250 (I was treated to dinner).

Overall not at all impressed with food or waitstaff.  It reminded me of restaurant week in NYC.  The service is terrible because the waitstaff knows the gratuity is included in bill.  

I also felt that the waitstaff provided different treatment to each table.  For instance the table next to us was told about every single plate that came out, we got maybe two explanations.

Not sure why this is the 'place to go', as I was not at all impressed.  Heck, I enjoyed my dinner at Contigo 10x more, same idea, less attitude.

But to each their own, I doubt I'll be going here again.
author: LM F.

description: Amazing tapas, great location with beautiful views. Indoor and outdoor seating. Get a parron, or 4, they are delicious. Definitely will come here again.
author: Madie H.

description: We especially enjoyed the sparkling cider from Asturias, Spain, Brought back good memories of the three hour meals the Europeans seem to have mastered, with our late friend.
author: Chris M.

description:
Finally got time to review this place. 

Great place. Good ambience and tasty food makes your evening perfect. I will go again. 


Parking friendly
Kids - not friendly. 
Location - great views of BB and piers
author: Nifty G.

description: The food was really good. I loved the "Bikini Brioche" and my friend really enjoyed the duck meatballs. But what stood out was the service. Our server, Sara, was amazing. So attentive. When she found out that I don't eat shellfish, she brought me a menu with the items containing shellfish thoughtfully crossed out. And when she overheard it was my friend's birthday, she brought us a dessert.  All in all, the experience was great and I will definitely be back.
author: Leah A.

description:
The two stars are for the flavors of the tapas only.  I think we need to ask, what kind of restaurant is this?  Is it casual dining as tapa places usually are, where you can chill and relax after work. grab some food on a decent budget?  Or is this fine dining, where everything is impeccable and can justify the prices on the menu?  Hopefully they find it's identity soon.

3 gals enjoying a friday night out, we definitely planned to be there for awhile, so we ordered just a few tapas to start and the paella since that took a long time to cook.  We were going to just add to the order as the evening went on.  Sadly, after the first 2 tapas, we were so majorly disappointed, we had to make alternative plans afterwards.  we ordered the beet salad, you would think at that price, it wouldn't be just a spoon full of beets on a plate of nothingness.  wood grilled octopus - 6 minuscule pieces dotted with maybe half a fingerling potato cut into 4-5 pieces, those toothpicks are there for a reason, there's no way a fork can pick up such tiny pieces.   i understand the concept of small plate tapas, i was in Madrid/Barcelona just not too long ago.  But portion size does not justify the price.  Iberco Jamon...it's basically $10 per slice.  You get 3 paper thin slices cut into little tiny pieces on a square of newspaper.  Ouch!  Lastly, paella...at $40, you would think they would put a little more effort into this.  4 head-on shrimps, 5 small clams and 6 slices of root vegetable. The seafood was overcooked and the rice was overdone, someone left this under the broiler too long?  The one saving grace was the pork and duck meatballs, at least there were 3 meatballs so we didn't have to cut those little down to share, and the flavor was spot on.  Unfortunately, the overall meal left us hungry, unsatisfied and extremely disappointed.
author: Ames K.

description: Excellent happy hour spot. Great house specialty gin cocktail. The steak was outstanding.
author: Jessica B.

description: We brought our two teens and all four of us loved this place.  We started with the charcuterie and cheese plate,  it was very tasty.  We had the mushrooms,  we highly recommend it.  We had the greens,  also highly recommend it.  We had the huevo plate, which was tasty for the first bite,  but then we found it a little on the salty side.  The paella was great,  definitely a must try!!  We had the churos for dessert,  which was very tasty especially with the chocolate dipping sauce. The coffee was good.  We would definitely come back here again!!  We saw many other dishes that were served at other tables that we are eager to try.
author: Andy W.

description: Amazing tapas! Super delicious. We also got the paella, which wasn't as burned as I would of liked. The portion of the Paella was good for 2 people, with 2 or 3 other tapas to make it a complete meal. I also ordered 2 types of gin drinks and they were all delicious and truly unique. I definitely recommend trying the drinks.
author: Sherry K.

description: One star for the food, as It is quite good, but the service is absolutely ridiculous! We sat outside sharing a table with a few other people. The other party at the table ordered at the same time as us, and they promptly received their drinks AND food before we had our wine. I had to go inside and track down our drinks. It then took another 45 minutes before they brought our initial order of almonds. Seriously? 45 minutes for almonds! We decided we would still order more food, which was a mistake....it took another hour before the food arrived. This place is NOT cheap and to have to wait that long for your order AND have to pay a hefty price....its just not worth it!
author: Wendy W.

description:
Not impressed with the food given the price - very expensive for what it was. 

Most annoying, they served us this 'bites' platter with $2.50 bites on a stick. It was eat what you want and they charge you for them. Wildy overpriced and they counted ours wrong.  Worse, we watched them continually reserve the same platter to others which is a health code violation.
author: David B.

description:
Well... I wish I could report glowing reviews about Coqueta but unfortunately I cannot. 

Arrived a bit early for our reservation so we sat in the bar area. Server in this area passed me twice without offering to show us a drink menu. Finally when he deigned it time to offer us a menu, he wasn't very hospitable or helpful in suggesting a drink for my friend. She chose a gin and tonic that had junipers in it and I had a taste of it. We were not impressed by amount of alcohol in it and my friend felt like the ornamental flowers kept getting in the way of drinking it. Points for effort but my drink is not where I would want the decoration. I don't like herbaceous beverages bec/ it tastes like I took a swig of a man's aftershave so I opted for the sangria. How could that be bad, right? Pretty watered down and not great. Would have died for some sangria from another veteran establishment in the Mission. Anyhoo... when it was time to dine, I did like the decor and the open feeling of the dining area. But hey, we are here for the food, right?? 

Started with some jamon and deviled eggs. So-so on both.
